text: organism, whose actions form and express a unity and solidarity, since
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they generate one another. Life itself is _creation_; it is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: capable of expression merely in physico-chemical formulae. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creative character, which is its essence, never can be so expressed.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bernard postulated an abstract, _id<e9>e directrice et cr<e9>atrice_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presiding over the evolution of an organism. "_Dans tout germe vivant,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: il y a une id<e9>e cr<e9>atrice qui se d<e9>veloppe et se manifeste par
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: l'organisation. Pendant toute sa dur<e9>e l'<ea>tre vivant reste sous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: l'influence de cette m<ea>me force vitale, cr<e9>atrice, et la mort arrive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lorsqu'elle ne peut plus se r<e9>aliser. Ici comme partout, tout d<e9>rive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de l'id<e9>e, qui, seule, cr<e9>e et dirige_."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Introduction <e0> l'Etude de la M<e9>d<e9>cine exp<e9>rimentale_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The positivist spirit is again very marked in the doctrines of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Berthelot (1827-1907), another very great friend of Renan, who, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: addition to being a Senator, and Minister of Education and of Foreign
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Affairs, held the Chair of Organic Chemistry at the Coll<e8>ge de France.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In 1886 he published his volume, Science et Philosophie, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contains some interesting and illuminating observations upon _La
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science id<e9>ale et la Science positive_. Part of this, it may be noted,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was written as early as 1863, in correspondence with Renan, and as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reply to a letter of his of which we shall speak presently._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Berthelot states his case with a clearness which merits quotation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See the _Fragments_ of Renan, published 1876, pp
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 193-241. _Reponse de M. Berthelot_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Positive science," he says, "seeks neither first causes nor the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimate goal of things. In order to link together a multitude of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phenomena by one single law, general in character and conformable to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the nature of things, the human spirit has followed a simple and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: invariable method. It has stated the facts in accordance with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observation and experience, compared them, extracted their relations,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that is the general facts, which have in turn been verified by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observation and experience, which verification constitutes their only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: guarantee of truth. A progressive generalisation, deduced from prior
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: facts and verified unceasingly by new observations, thus brings our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: knowledge from the plane of particular and popular facts to general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: laws of an abstract and universal character. But, in the construction
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of this pyramid of science, everything from base to summit rests upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observation and experience. It is one of the principles of positive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science that no reality can be established by a process of reasoning.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The universe cannot be grasped by a _priori_ methods."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Like Comte, Berthelot believed in the progress of all knowledge
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: through a theological and metaphysical stage to a definitely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific or positive era. The sciences are as yet young, and we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot imagine the development and improvement, social and moral,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which will accrue from their triumph in the future. For Berthelot, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for Renan, the idea of progress was bound up essentially with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: triumph of the scientific spirit. In a Discourse at the Sorbonne given
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in commemoration of the fiftieth anniversary of his being appointed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Professor at the Coll<e8>ge de France, we find this faith in science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reiterated. "To-day," he remarks, "Science claims a triple direction
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of societies, materially, intellectually and morally. By this fact the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: role of the men of science, both as individuals and as a class, has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unceasingly come to play a great part in modern states."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These scientific men, Berthelot and Bernard, with whom Renan was on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: terms of friendship, had a large influence in the formation of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought, after he had quitted the seminary and the Church. As a young
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man Renan possessed the positive spirit in a marked degree, and did
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not fail to disclose his enthusiasm for "Science" and for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific method. His book _L'Avenir de la Science_, which we have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: already noted, was written when he was only twenty-five, and under the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immediate influence of the events of 1848, particularly the socialist
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit of Saint-Simon and the "organising" attitude of Auguste Comte.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It did not, however, see publication until 1890, when the Empire had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: produced a pessimistic temper in him, later accentuated by the Commune
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the Prussian War. The dominant note of the whole work is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: touching and almost pathetic belief in Science, which leads the young
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: writer to an optimism both in thought and in politics. "Science"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constitutes for him the all-in-all. Although he had just previously
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abandoned the seminary, his priestly style remained with him to such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: degree that even his treatment of science is characterised by a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mixture of the unction of the _cur<e9>_ and the subtilty of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dialectician. Levites were still to be necessary to the people of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Israel, but they were to be the priests of the most High, whose name,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: according to Renan, was "Science."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His ardour for Science is not confined to this one book: it runs
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: through all his writings. Prospero, a character who personifies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational thought in _L'Eau de Jouvence_, one of Renan's _Drames
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophiques_, expresses an ardent love for science continually. In
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his preface to _Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse_ we find Renan upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the same theme. Quaintly enough he not only praises the objectivity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is characteristic of the scientific point of view, but seems to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: delight in its abstraction. The superiority of modern science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consists, he claims, in this very abstraction. But he is aware that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the very indefatigability with which we fathom nature removes us, in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense, further from her. He recognises how science leads away from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immediacy of vital and close contact with nature herself. "This is,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, as it should be," asserts Renan, "and let no one fear to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prosecute his researches, for out of this merciless dissection comes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life." He does not stay to assure us, or to enlighten us, as to how
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that life can be infused into the abstract facts which have resulted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the process of dissection. Fruitful and suggestive as many of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pages are, they fail to approach the concrete difficulties which this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: passage mentions.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Writing from Dinant in Brittany in 1863 to his friend, Berthelot,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan gives his view of the Sciences of Nature and the Historical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Sciences. This letter, reprinted in his _Dialogues et Fragments
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophiques_, in 1876, expresses Renan's.views in a clear and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: simple form upon the place of science in his mind and also upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idea of progress, as for him the two are intimately connected. Extreme
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: confidence is expressed in the power of science. Renan at this time
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: had written, but not published, his _Avenir de la Science_. In a brief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manner this letter summarises much contained in the larger work. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point of view is similar. Science is to be the great reforming power.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The word "Science" is so constantly upon Renan's lips that we can see
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that it has become an obsession with mm to employ it, or a device.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Certainly Renan's extensive and ill-defined usage of it conceals grave
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: diffi-* *culties. One is tempted frequently to regard it as a synonym
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for philosophy or metaphysics, a word which he dislikes. That does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not, however, add to clearness, and Renan's usage of "Science" as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: term confuses both science and philosophy together. Even if this were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not the case, there is another important point to note-- namely, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even on a stricter interpretation Renan, by his wide use of the term,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: actually undermines the confidence in the natural sciences. For he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: embraces within the term "Science" not merely those branches of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: investigation which we term in general the sciences of nature, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: also the critical study of language, of history and literature. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expressly endeavours to show in the letter to Berthelot that true
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science must include the product of man's spirit and the record of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of that spirit.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan assumed quite definitely a positivist attitude to metaphysics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Philosophy," he remarks, "is not a separate science; it is one side
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of every science. In the great optic pencil of human knowledge it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the central region where the rays meet in one and the same light."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Metaphysical speculation he scorned, but he admitted the place for a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: criticism of the human mind such as had been given by Kant in _The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Critique of Pure Reason_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kantian also, in its professions at least, was the philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Vacherot, who stated that the aim of his work, _La M<e9>taphysique et la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science_, was "the reconciliation of metaphysics with science."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These dialogues between a philosopher and a man of science, for of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such discussions the book is composed, never really help us to get
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: close to the problem, for Vacherot's Kantianism is a profession which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely covers an actual positivism. His metaphysical doctrines are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: superimposed on a severe and rigid naturalism, but are kept from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conflict with them, or even relation with them, by being allotted to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: distant limbo of pure ideals, outside the world which science displays
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to us.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See particularly his statements to this effect in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Preface, pp. xxxvii-xl.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine, in spite of his severely positive attitude, was a strong
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: champion of metaphysics. The sciences needed, he claimed, a science of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: first principles, a metaphysic. Without it, "the man of science is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely a _manuvre_ and the artist a _dilettante_." The positive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences he re- garded as inferior types of analysis. Above them "is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: superior analysis which is metaphysics, and which reduces or takes up
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these laws of the sciences into a universal formula." This higher
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: analysis, however, does not give the lie to the others: it completes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was indeed a belief and hope of Taine that the sciences will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more and more perfected until they can each be expressed in a kind of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: generic formula, which in turn may be capable of expression in some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: single formula. This single law is being sought by science and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysic, although it must belong to the latter rather than to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: former. From it, as from a spring, proceeds, according to Taine, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: eternal roll of events and the infinite sea of things.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine's antagonism to the purely empirical schools centres round his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of the law of causality. He disagrees with the assertion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that this law is a synthetic, a _posteriori_ judgment, a habit, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Hume said, or a mechanical _attente_, as Mill thought, or a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: generalisation of the sensation of effort which we feel in ourselves,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as was suggested by Maine de Biran. Yet he also opposes Kant's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine, in which causality is regarded as a synthetic _a priori_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: judgment. His own criticism of Hume and Kant was directed to denial of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the elements of heterogeneity in experience, which are so essential to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Hume's view, and to a denial of the distinction maintained by Kant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between logical and causal relations. Taine considered that all might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be explained by logical relations, that all experience might some day
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be expressed in one law, one formula. The _more geometrico_ of Spinoza
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the "universal mathematic" of Descartes reappear in Taine. He even
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essays in _L'Intelligence_ to equate the principle of causality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (_principe de raison explicative_) with that of identity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His attempt to reduce the principle of causality to that of identity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: did not succeed very well, and from the nature of the case this was to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be expected. As Fouill<e9>e well points out in his criticism of Taine,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: both in _La Libert<e9> et le D<e9>terminisme_ and the concluding pages of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his earlier work on Plato,_*_ the notion of difference and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: heterogeneity which arises in the action of cause and effect can never
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be reducible to a mere identity, for the notion of identity has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nothing in common with that of difference. Differences cannot be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ignored; variety and change are undeniable facts of experience.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e here touches the weak spot of Taine's doctrine. In spite of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seemingly great power of criticism there is an underlying dogmatism in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his work, and the chief of those dogmas, which he does not submit to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: criticism, is the assertion of the universal necessity of all things.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To this postulate he gives a false air of objectivity. He avoids
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stating why we do objectify causality, and he diverts discussion from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the position that this postulate may itself be subjective.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: Vol. 4.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The particular bearing of Taine's psychology upon the general problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of knowledge is interesting. He defines perception in _L'Intelligence_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as _une hallucination vraie_. His doctrine of the "double aspect,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: physical and mental, recalls to mind the Modes of Spinoza. In his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attitude to the difficult problem of movement and thought he rests in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the dualism of Spinoza, fluctuating and not enunciating his doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clearly. The primacy of movement to thought he abandoned as too
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanical a doctrine, and regarded the type of existence as mental in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: character. Taine thus passes from the materialism of Hobbes to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idealism of Leibnitz. "The physical world is reducible to a system of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: signs, and no more is needed for its construction and conception than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the materials of the moral world."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: When we feel ourselves constrained to admit the necessity of certain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truths, if we are inclined to regard this as due to the character of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our minds themselves (_notre structure mentale_), as Kant maintained,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine reminds us that we must admit that our mind adapts itself to its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: environment. He here adopts the view of Spencer, a thinker who seems
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to have had far more influence upon the Continent than in his own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: country. Although Taine thus reposes his epistemology upon this basis,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he does not answer the question which the Kantian can still put to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him--namely, "How do we know the structure of things?" He is unable to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: escape from the difficulty of admitting either that it is from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: experience, an admission which his anti-empirical attitude forbids him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to make (and which would damage his dogma of universal logical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity), or that our knowledge is obtained by analysing our own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thoughts, in which case he leaves us in a vicious circle of pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: subjectivity from which there is no means of escape.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The truth is that Taine vainly tried to establish a phenomenal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine, not purely empirical in character like that of Hume, but a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phenomenalism wedded to a necessity which is supposed to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self-explanatory. Such a notion of necessity, however, is formal and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abstract. Rather than accept Taine's view of a law, a formula, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "eternal axiom" at the basis of things, we are obliged to postulate an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: activity, creative in character, of whose action universal laws are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but expressions. Law, formula, axiom without action are mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abstractions which can of themselves produce nothing.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine's positivism, however, was not so rigid as to exclude a belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the value of metaphysics. It is this which distinguishes him from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Comtian School. We see in him the confidence in science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complemented by an admission of metaphysics, equivalent to a turning
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of "positivism" in science and philosophy against itself. Much heavier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: onslaughts upon the sovereignty of science came, however, from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinker who is the great logician and metaphysician of our period,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier. To him and to Cournot we now turn.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: II
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While Taine had indeed maintained the necessity of a metaphysic, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shared to a large degree the general confidence in science displayed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by Comte, Bernard, Berthelot and Renan. But the second and third
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: groups of thinkers into which we have divided our period took up first
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a critical attitude to science and, finally, a rather hostile one.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot marks the transition between Comte and Renouvier. His _Essai
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sur les Fondements de nos Connaissances et sur les Caract<e8>res de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Critique philosophique_ contains some very calm and careful thought on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the relation of science and philosophy, which is the product of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sincere and well-balanced mind._*_ He inherits from the positivists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an intense respect for scientific knowledge, and remarks at the outset
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that he is hostile to any philosophy which would be so foolish as to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempt to ignore the work of the modern sciences.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See in particular the second chapter of vol. 2, _Du
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Contraste de la Science et de la Philosophie et de la Philosophie des
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Sciences_, pp. 216-255.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His work _Mat<e9>rialisme, Vitalisme, Rationalisme_ is a striking example
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of this effort on Cournot's part, being devoted to a study of the use
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which can be made in philosophy of the data afforded by the sciences.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Somewhat after the manner of Comte, Cournot looks upon the various
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences as a hierarchy ranging from mathematics to sociology. Yet he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds the scientists of the insufficiency of their point of view,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for the sciences, rightly pursued, lead on to philosophy. He laments,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, the confusion of the two, and thinks that such confusion is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "partly due to the fact that in the realm of speculations which are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: naturally within the domain of the philosopher, there are to be found
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here and there certain theories which can actually be reduced to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific form"_*_ He offers, as an instance of this, the theory
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the syllogism, which has affinities to algebraical equations--but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this interpenetration should not cause us, he argues, to abandon or to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lose sight of the distinction between science and philosophy.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Essai sur les Fondements de nos Connaissances_, vol.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This distinction, according to Cournot, lies in the fact that science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: has for its object that which can be measured, and that which can be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reduced to a rigorous chain or connection. In brief, science is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterised by quantity. Philosophy, on the other hand, concerns
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself with quality, for it endeavours not so much to measure as to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appreciate.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot reminds the apostles of science that quantity, however
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intimately bound up with reality it may be, is not the essence of that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reality itself. He is afraid, too, that the neglect of philosophy by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science may cause the latter to develop along purely utilitarian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lines. As an investigation of reality, science is not ultimate. It has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limits by the fact that it is concerned with measurement, and thus is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: excluded from those things which are qualitative and incapable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quantitative expression. Science, moreover, has its roots in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy by virtue of the metaphysical postulates which it utilises
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as its basis. Physics and geometry, Cournot maintains, both rest upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: definitions which owe their origin to speculative thought rather than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to experience, yet these sciences claim an absolute value for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves and for those postulates as being descriptions of reality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in an ultimate sense.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Following out his distinction between philosophy and the sciences,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot claims in a Kantian manner that while the latter are products
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the human understanding the former is due to the operation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason. This apparent dualism Cournot does not shrink from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintaining; indeed, he makes it an argument for his doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discontinuity. The development of a science involves a certain breach
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with reality, for the progress of the science involves abstraction,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which ever becomes more complicated. Cournot here brings out the point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which we noticed was stressed by Renan._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See above, p. 105.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Reason produces in us the idea of order, and this "idea of order and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reason in things is the basis of philosophic probability, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: induction and analogy."_/-_ This has important bearings upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unity of science and upon the conception of causality which it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upholds. In a careful examination of the problems of induction and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: analogy, Cournot emphasises the truth that there are facts which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be fitted into a measured or logical sequence of events.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Reality cannot be fitted into a formula or into concepts, for these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fail to express the infinite variety and richness of the reality which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: displays itself to us. Science can never be adequate to life, with its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pulsing spontaneity and freedom. It is philosophy with its _vue
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: d'ensemble_ which tries to grasp and to express this concreteness,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which the sciences, bound to their systematic connection of events
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: within separate compartments, fail to reach or to show us. Referring
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the ideas of beauty and of goodness, Cournot urges a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "transrationalism," as he calls it, which, while loyal to the rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: requirements of science, will enable us to take the wider outlook
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assumed by philosophy._/=_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Essai sur les Fondements de nos Connaissances, p.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : The parallelism of some of Cournot's ideas here with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those expressed by Bergson, although they have been enunciated by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: later thinker in a more decided manner, is so obvious as hardly to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: need to be indicated.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Like Cournot, the author of the _Essais de Critique g<e9>n<e9>rale_ was a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: keen antagonist of all those who sought to deify Science. It was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed this which led Renouvier to give this title to his great work,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the first part of which was published at a time when the confidence in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science appeared to be comparatively unassailed. We find him defending
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy as against the scientists and others by an insistence upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its critical function.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In examining Comte's positivism in his work _Histoire et Solution des
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Probl<e8>mes m<e9>taphysiques_, Renouvier points out that its initial idea
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a false one--namely, that philosophy can be constituted by an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assembling together of the sciences._*_ Such an assembly does not,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he objects, make a system. Each science has its own postulates, its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own data, and Science as a whole unity of thought or knowledge does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not exist. He attacks at the same time the calm presumption of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist who maintains that the scientific stage is the final and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: highest development. Renouvier is considerably annoyed at this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unwarranted dogmatism and assumed air of finality.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Book X.: _De l'Etat actuel de la Philosophie en
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: France_, chap. 1., _De l'Aboutissement des Esprits au Positivisme_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Owing to the excellent training he had received at the Ecole
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Polytechnique, and by his own profound study, Renouvier was able on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: many technical points to meet the scientists on their own ground. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: third _Essai de Critique g<e9>n<e9>rale_ is devoted to a study of "the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Principles of Nature," in which he criticises many of the principles
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and assumptions of mechanism, while many pages of his two previous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Essais_ are concerned with the discussion of questions intimately
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: affecting the sciences._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : This is particularly noticeable in the matter printed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as appendices to his chapters. (_Cf_. the _Logic_, vol 2.)]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: An important section of his second Essay, _Psychologie rationnelle_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deals with the "Classification of the Sciences."_/=_ Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there points out that the attempt to classify the sciences in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accordance with their degrees of certainty ends in failure. All of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them, when loyal to their own principles, endeavour to display equal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certainty. By loyalty Renouvier shows that he means adherence to an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: examination of certain classes of phenomena, the observation of facts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and laws, with the proposal of hypotheses, put forward frankly as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such. He draws a line between the logical and the physical sciences--a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: division which he claims is not only a division according to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature of their data, but also according to method. Following another
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: division, we may draw a line between sciences which deal with objects
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which are organic, living creatures, and those which are not.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : Vol. 2, chap. xviii., _De la Certitude des Sciences
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: et leur Classification rationnelle_, pp. 139-186, including later
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observations on Spencer]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's line is not, it must be remembered in this connection, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely imaginary one. It is a real line, an actual gap. For him there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a real discontinuity in the universe. Taine's doctrine of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal explanation, of a rigid unity and continuity, is, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, anathema, _c'est la math<e9>matisation a l'outrance_. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appears most markedly in the pages which he devotes to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consideration of _la synth<e8>se totale_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: An important section of his _Trait<e9> de Logique_ (the first _Essai de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Critique g<e9>n<e9>rale_) deals with the problem of this Total Synthesis of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all phenomena._*_ This is a conception which Renouvier affirms to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be unwarrantable and, indeed, in the last analysis impossible. A
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general synthesis, an organisation or connected hierarchy of sciences,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a fond hope, an illusion only of a mind which can overlook the real
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discontinuity which exists between things and between groups of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: Vol. I, pp. 107-115, and also vol. 2, pp. 202-245.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He sees in it the fetish of the Absolute and the Infinite and the lure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of pantheism, a doctrine to which he opposes his "Personalism." He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds the scientists that personality is the great factor to which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all knowledge is related, and that all knowledge is relative. A law is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a law, but the guarantee of its permanence is not a law. It is no more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: easy, claims Renouvier, to say why phenomena do not stop than it is to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: know why they have begun. Laws indeed abide, but "not apart from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscious personalities who affirm them."_/-_ Further, attacking
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the self-confident and dogmatic attitude in the scientists, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds them that it is impossible to demonstrate _every_ proposition;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in an important note on "Induction and the Sciences"_*_ he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: points out that induction always implies a certain _croyance_. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no peculiar, mystical thing; it is a fact, he remarks, which colours
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all the interesting acts of human personality. He here approaches
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot in observing that all speculation is attended by a certain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: coefficient of doubt or uncertainty and so becomes really rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief. With Cournot, too, Renouvier senses the importance of analogy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and probability in connection with hypotheses in the world of nature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and of morals. In short, he recognises as central the problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Logique_, vol. 2, p. 321.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Note B to chap. xxxv. of the Logique, vol. 2, p. 13.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier attacks Comte's classification or "hierarchy" of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences as mischievous and inexact. It is not based, he claims, upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any distinction in method, nor of data. It is not true that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences are arranged by Comte in an order where they successively
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imply one another, nor in an order in which they have come to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constituted as "positive"._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_: This outburst of attack is a sample of Renouvier's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: usual attitude to Positivism. (_Deuxi<e8>me Essai_, vol. 2, pp.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He justifies to the scientist the formulation of hypothesis as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessary working method of co-ordinating in a provisional manner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: varying phenomena. Many hypotheses and inductions of science are,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, unjustifiable from a strictly logical standpoint, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds us. His chief objection, however, is that those hypotheses and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inductions are put forward so frequently as certainties by a science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is dogmatic and surpasses its limits.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science, Renouvier claims, does not give us a knowledge of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolute, but an understanding of the relative. It is in the light of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his doctrine of relativity and of the application of the law of number
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that he criticises many of the attitudes adopted by the scientists.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Whatever savours of the Absolute or the Infinite he opposes, and his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view of cause depends on this. He scorns the fiction of an infinite
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regress, and affirms real beginnings to various classes of phenomena.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Causality is not to be explained, he urges in his _Nouvelle
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Monadologie_, save by a harmony. He differs from Leibnitz, however, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claiming in the interests of freedom that this harmony is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pre-established. In meeting the doctrine of the reduction of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complex to the simple, Renouvier cites the case of "reducing" sound,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: heat, light and electricity to movement. This may be superficially
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander
