text: correct as a generality, but Renouvier aptly points out that it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: overlooks the fact that, although they may all be abstractly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterised as movement, yet there are differences between them as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: movements which correspond to the differences of sensation they arouse
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in us.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier upholds real differences, real beginnings, and, it must be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: added, a reality behind and beyond the appearances of nature. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Monadologie_ admits that "we can continue to explain nature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mathematically and mechanically, provided we recognise that it is an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: external appearance--that thought, mind or spirit is at the heart of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it." This links Renouvier to the group of new spiritualists. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attitude to science is akin to theirs. He does not fear science when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it confines itself to its proper limits and recognises these. It has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no quarrel with philosophy nor philosophy with it. Advance in science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves, he believes, an advance also in theology and in metaphysics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The sciences are responsible for working out the laws determining the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of the Universe. But between Science, an ideal unachieved,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the sciences which in themselves are so feeble, imperfect and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limited, Renouvier claims that General Criticism, or Philosophy, has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its place. "In spite of the discredit into which philosophy has fallen
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in these days, it can and ought to exist. Its object has been always
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the investigation of God, man, liberty, immortality, the fundamental
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: laws of the sciences. 'All these intimately connected and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interpenetrating problems comprise the domain of philosophy." In those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cases where no science is possible, this seeming impossibility must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself be investigated, and philosophy remains as a "General
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Criticism" (_Critique g<e9>n<e9>rale_) of our knowledge. "It is this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notion," he says, "which I desired to indicate by banishing the word
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 'Philosophy' from the title of my Essays. The name ought to change
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: when the method changes."_*_ Thus Renouvier seeks to establish a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "critique" midway between scepticism and dogmatism, and endeavours to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: found a philosophy which recognises at one and the same time the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demands of _science et conscience_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Logique, vol. 2, p. 352.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: III
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: On turning to the spiritualist current of thought we find it, like the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neo-criticism, no less keen in its criticism of science. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inadequacy of the purely scientific attitude is the recurring theme
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from Ravaisson to Boutroux, Bergson and Le Roy. The attitude assumed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by Ravaisson coloured the whole of the subsequent development of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: new spiritualist doctrines, and not least their bearing upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem of science and its relation to metaphysics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Mechanism, Ravaisson pointed out, quoting the classical author upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whom he had himself written so brilliantly (Aristotle), does not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: explain itself, for it implies a "prime mover," not itself in motion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but which produces movement by spiritual activity. Ravaisson also
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: refers to the testimony of Leibnitz, who, while agreeing that all is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanical, carefully added to this statement one to the effect that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanism itself has a principle which must be looked for outside
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matter and which is the object of metaphysical research. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritual reality is found only, according to Ravaisson, in the power
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of goodness and beauty--that is to say, in a reality which is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: non-scientific but rather ultra-scientific. There are realities, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims, to which science does not attain.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The explanation of nature presupposes soul or spirit. It is true,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson admits, that the physical and chemical sciences consider
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves independent of metaphysics; true also that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysician in ignoring the study of those sciences omits much from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his estimate of the spirit. Indeed, he cannot well dispense with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: results of the sciences. That admission, however, does not do away
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the possibility of a true "apologia" for metaphysics. To Newton's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sarcastic remark, "Physics beware of metaphysics," Hegel replied
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cogently that this was equivalent to saying, "Physics, keep away from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought." Spirit, however, cannot be omitted from the account; it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the condition of all that is, the light by which we see that there is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such a thing as a material universe. This is the central point of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson's philosophy. The sciences of nature may be allowed and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: encouraged to work diligently upon their own principles, but the very
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fact that they are individual sciences compels them to admit that they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view the whole "piecemeal". Philosophy seeks to interpret the whole as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a whole. Ravaisson quotes Pascal's saying, "_Il faut avoir une pens<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de derri<e8>re la t<ea>te et juger de tout par l<e0>_." This _pens<e9>e de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: derri<e8>re la t<ea>te_, says Ravaisson, while not preventing the various
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences from speaking in their own tongue, is just the metaphysical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or philosophical idea of the whole.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is claimed, Aristotle used to say, that mathematics have absolutely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nothing in common with the idea of the good. "But order, proportion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: symmetry, are not these great forms of beauty?" asks Ravaisson. For
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him there is spirit at the heart of things, an activity, _un feu
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: primitif qui est l'<e2>me_, which expresses itself in thought, in will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in love. It is a fire which does not burn itself out, because it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is enduring spirit, an eternal cause, the absolute substance is this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritual reality. Where the sciences fall short is that they fail to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: show that nature is but the refraction of this spirit. This is a fact,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, which both religion and philosophy grasp and uphold.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These criticisms were disturbing for those minds who found entire
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: satisfaction in Science or rather in the sciences, but they were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: somewhat general. Ravaisson's work inculcated a spirit rather than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sustained a dialectic. Its chief value lay in the inspiration which it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imparted to subsequent thinkers who endeavoured to work out his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general ideas with greater precision.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was this task which Lachelier set himself in his _Induction_. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: had keenly felt the menace of science, as had Janet;_*_ he had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appreciated the challenge offered to it by Ravaisson's ideas.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Moreover, Lachelier's acute mind discovered the crucial points upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which the new spiritualism could base its attack upon the purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific dogmatism. Whatever Leibnitz might have said, creative
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spontaneity of the spirit, as it was acclaimed by Ravaisson, could not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: easily be fitted into the mechanism and determinism upheld by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences. Ravaisson had admitted the action of efficient causes in so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: far as he admitted the action of mechanism, which is but the outcome
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of these causes. In this way he endeavoured to satisfy the essential
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demands of the scientific attitude to the universe. But recognising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the inadequacy of this attitude he had upheld the reality of final
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: causes and thus opposed to the scientists a metaphysical doctrine akin
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the religious attitude of Hellenism and Christianity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : We refer here to the quotation from Janet's _Probl<e8>mes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: du XIXe Si<e8>cle_, given above on p. 95. Janet himself wrote on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Final Causes_ but not Wlth the depth or penetration of Lachelier.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier saw that the important point of Ravaisson's doctrine lay in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the problem of these two types of causality. His thesis is therefore
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: devoted to the examination of efficient and final causes. This little
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work of Lachelier marks a highly important advance in the development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the spiritualist philosophy. He clarifies and re-affirms more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: precisely the position indicated by Ravaisson. Lacheher tears up the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: treaty of compromise which was drafted by Leibnitz to meet the rival
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demands of science with its efficient causes and philosophy with its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: final causes. The world of free creative spontaneity of the spirit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be regarded, Lachelier claims (and this is his vital point), as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely the complement of, or the reflex from, the world of mechanism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and determinism.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He works out in his thesis the doctrine that efficient causes can be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deduced from the formal laws of thought. This was Taine's position,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and it was the limit of Taine's doctrine. Lachelier goes further and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: undermines Taine's theories by upholding final causes, which he shows
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: depend upon the conception of a totality, a whole which is capable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creating its parts. This view of the whole is a philosophical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception to which the natural sciences never rise, and which they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot, by the very nature of their data and their methods,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comprehend. Yet it is only such a conception which can supply any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational basis for the unity of phenomena and of experience. Only by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seeing the variety of all phenomena in the light of such an organic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unity can we find any meaning in the term universe, and only thus,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continues Lachelier, only on the principle of a rational and universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: order and on the reality of final causes, can we base our inductions.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The "uniformity of nature," that fetish of the scientists which, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier well points out, is merely the empirical regularity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phenomena, offers no adequate basis for a single induction.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier developed his doctrines further in the article, _Psychologie
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: et M<e9>taphysique_. We can observe in it the marks which so profoundly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: distinguish the new spiritualism from the old, as once taught by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cousin. The old spiritualism had no place between its psychology and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its metaphysics for the natural sciences. Indeed it was quite
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: incapable of dealing with the problem which their existence and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: success presented, and so it chose to ignore them as far as possible.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The new spiritualism, of which Lachelier is perhaps the profoundest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speculative mind, not only is acquainted with the place and results of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the sciences, but it feels itself equal to a criticism of them, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advance which marks a highly important development in philosophy.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In this article Lachelier endeavours to pass beyond the standpoint of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cousin, and in so doing we see not only the influence of Ravaisson's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideas of the creative activity of the spirit, but also of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discipline of the Kantian criticism, with which Lachelier, unlike many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his contemporaries in France at that time, was well acquainted.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He first shows that the study of psychology reveals to us the human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: powers of sensation, feeling and will. These are the immediate data of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness. Another element, however, enters into consciousness,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not as these three, a definite content, but as a colouring of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whole. This other element is "objectivity," an awareness or belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the world without exists and continues to exist independently of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our observation of it. Lachelier combats, however, the Kantian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of the "thing-in-itself." If, he argues, the world around
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us appears as a reality which is independent of our perception, it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _not_ because it is a "thing-in-itself," but rather it appears as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: independent because we, possessing conscious intelligence, succeed in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: making it an object of our thought, and thus save it from the mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: subjectivity which characterises our sense-experience. It is upon this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fact, Lachelier rightly insists, that all our science reposes. A
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theory of knowledge as proposed by Taine, based solely on sensation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and professing belief in _hallucination vraie_, is itself a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contradiction and an abuse of language. "If thought is an illusion,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarks Lachelier, "we must suppress all the sciences."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Psychologie et M<e9>taphisique, p.151.(See especially the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: passages on pp.150-158.)]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He then proceeds to show that if we admit thought to be the basis of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our knowledge of the world, that is, of our sciences, then we admit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that our sciences are themselves connstructions, based upon a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: synthetic, constructive, creative activity of our mind or spirit. For
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our thought is not merely another "thing" added to the world of things
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: outside us. Our thought is not a given and predetermined datum, it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "a living dialectic," a creative activity, a self-creative process,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is synthetic, and not merely analytic in character. "Thought,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he says, "can rest upon itself, while everything else can only rest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon it; the ultimate _point d'appui_ of all truth and of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existence is to be found in the absolute spontaneity of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit."_*_ Here, Lachelier maintains, lies the real _a priori_;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here, too, is the very important passage from psychology to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_: _Psychologie et M<e9>taphysique_, p. 158.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Finally his treatment of the problems of knowledge and of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: foundations of science leads him to reemphasise not only the reality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of spirit but its spontaneity. He recognises with Cournot and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier that the vital problem for science and philosophy is that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. The nature of existence is for Lachelier a manifestation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit, and is seen in will, in necessity and in freedom. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important to note that for him it is _all_ these simultaneously.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Being," he remarks in concluding his brilliant essay,_/-_ "is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: first, a blind necessity, then a will which must be for ever bound
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: down in advance to necessity and, lastly, a freedom which would merely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be able to recognise such necessity and such a bound will; being is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: entirely free, in so far as it is self-creative; it is entirely an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expression of will, in so far as it creates itself in the form of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: something concrete and real; it is also entirely an expression of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity, in so far as its self-creation is intelligible and gives an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: account of itself."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_: _Ibid_., p. 170]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: At this stage something in the nature of a temporary "set-back" is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: given to the flow of the spiritualist current by Fouillee's attitude,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which takes a different line from that of Ravaisson and Lachelier. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attitude towards Science, which we find adopted by Fouillee, is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determined by his two general principles, that of reconcilation, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his own doctrine of _id<e9>es-forces_. His conciliatory spirit is well
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seen in the fact that, although he has a great respect for science and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inherits many of the qualities contained in Taine's philosophy,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: particularly the effort to maintain a regular continuity and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solidarity in the development of reality, nevertheless he is imbued
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the spirit of idealism which characterises all this group of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinkers. The result is a mixture of Platonism and naturalism, and to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this he himself confesses in his work, _Le Mouvement id<e9>aliste et la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: R<e9>action contre la Science positive_, where he expresses a desire "to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bring back Plato's ideas from heaven to earth, and so to make idealism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consonant with naturalism."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Le Mouvement id<e9>aliste el la R<e9>action contre la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science positive_, p. xxi.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e claims to take up a position midway between the materialists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the idealists. Neither standpoint is, in his view, adequate to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: describe reality. He is particularly opposed to the materialistic and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanistic thought of the English Evolutionary School, as presented
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by Spencer and Huxley, with its pretensions to be scientific. Fouillee
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accepts, with them, the notion of evolution, but he disagrees entirely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with Spencer's attempt to refer everything to mechanism, the mechanism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of matter in motion. In any case, Fouill<e9>e claims, movement is a very
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: slender and one-sided element of experience upon which to base our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterisation of all reality, for the idea of motion arises only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from our visual and tactual experience. He revolts from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: epiphenomenalism of Huxley as from a dire heresy. Consciousness cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be regarded as a mere "flash in the pan." Even science must admit that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all phenomena are to be defined by their relation to, and action upon,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other phenomena. Consciousness, so regarded, will be seen, he claims,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as a unique power, possessing the property of acting upon matter and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of initiating movement. It is itself a factor, and a very vital one,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the evolutionary process. It is no mere reflex or passive repre-*
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sentation. On this point of the irreducibility of the mental life and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the validity of its action, Fouill<e9>e parts company with Taine. On the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other hand, he disagrees with the idealistic school of thought, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upholds a pure intellectualism and for whom thought is the accepted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterisation of reality. This, complains Fouill<e9>e, is as much an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abstraction and a one-sided view as that of Spencer.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In this manner Fouill<e9>e endeavours to "rectify the scientific
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of evolution" by his doctrine of _id<e9>es-forces_. "There
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is," he says,_*_ "in every idea a commencement of action, and even
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of movement, which tends to persist and to increase like an _<e9>lan_. .
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: . . Every idea is already a force." Psychologically it is seen in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: active, conative or appetitive aspect of consciousness. To think of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thing involves already, in some measure, a tendency toward it, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: desire it. Physiologically considered, _id<e9>es-forces_ are found to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operate, not mechanically, but by a vital solidarity which is much
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more than mere mechanism, and which unites the inner consciousness to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the outer physical fact of movement. From a general philosophical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point of view the doctrine of _id<e9>es-forces_ establishes the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: irreducibility of the mental, and the fact that, so far from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mental being a kind of phosphorescence produced as a result of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evolutionary process, it is a prime factor in that evolution, of which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanism is only a symbol. Here Fouill<e9>e rises almost to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritualism of Ravaisson. Mechanism, he declares, is, after all, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a manner of representing to ourselves things in space and time.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Scientists speak of forces, but the real forces are ideas, and other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: so-called "forces" are merely analogies which we have constructed,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: based upon the inner mental feeling of effort, tendency, desire and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _La Libert<e9> et le D<e9>terminisme_, p. 97, 4e ed.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : This was a point upon which Maine de Biran had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insisted. (See p. 20.)]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The scientists have too often, as Fouill<e9>e well points in his work on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _L'Evolutionnisme des Id<e9>es-forces_, regarded the concept of Evolution
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as all-sufficing, as self-explanatory. Philosophy, however, cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accept such dogmatism from science, and asserts that evolution is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself a result and not in itself a cause. With such a view Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is found ultimately in the line of the general development of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritual philosophy continuing the hostility to science as ultimate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or all-sufficing. Further developments of this attitude are seen in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux and in Bergson.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the work of Boutroux we find a continuation of that type of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: criticism of science which was a feature in Ravaisson and Lachelier.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He has also affinities with Renouvier (and, we may add, with Comte),
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because of his insistence upon the discontinuity of the sciences; upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the element of "newness" found in each which prevents the higher being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deduced from the lower, or the superior explained by reference to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inferior. Boutroux opposes Spencer's doctrines and is a keen
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: antagonist of Taine and his claim to deduce all from one formula. Such
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a notion as that of Taine is quite absurd, according to Boutroux, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is no necessary bond between one and another science. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux's main point in _La Contingence des Lois de la Nature_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By a survey of laws of various types, logical, mathematical,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanical, physical, chemical, biological, psychological and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociological, Boutroux endeavours to show that they are constructions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: built up from facts. Just as nature offers to the scientist facts for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: data, so the sciences themselves offer these natural laws as data to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the philosopher, for his constructed explanation of things which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysics or philosophy.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "In the actual condition of our knowledge," he remarks, "science is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not one, but multiple; science, conceived as embracing all the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sciences, is a mere abstraction." This is a remark which recalls
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's witty saying, "I should very much like to meet this person
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: I hear so much about, called 'science.'" We have only sciences, each
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: working after its own manner upon a small portion of reality. Man has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a thirst for knowledge, and he sees, says Boutroux, in the world an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "ensemble" of facts of infinite variety. These facts man endeavours to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observe, analyse, and describe with increasing exactness. Science, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: points out, is just this description.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is futile to attempt a resolution of all things into the principle
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of identity. "The world is full of a number of things," and,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: therefore, argues Boutroux, the formula A = B can never be strictly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and absolutely true. "Nature never offers to us identities, but only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: resemblances." This has important bearing upon the law of causality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of which the sciences make so much. For there is such a degree of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: heterogeneity in the things to which the most elementary and general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: laws of physics and chemistry are applied that it is impossible to say
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the consequent is proportional to the antecedent--that is to say,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is impossible to work out absolutely the statement that an effect
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the unique result of a certain invariable cause. The fundamental
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: link escapes us and so, for us, there is a certain contingency in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: experience. There is, further, a creativeness, a newness, which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unforeseeable. The passage from the inorganic to the organic stresses
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this, for the observation of the former would never lead us to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other, for it is a creation, a veritable "new" thing. Boutroux is here
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dealing hard blows at Taine's conception. He continues it by showing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that in the conscious living being we are introduced to a new element
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is again absolutely irreducible to physical factors. Life, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness too, are both creators. The life of the mind is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolutely _sui generis_; it cannot be explained by physiology, by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflex action, or looked upon as merely an epiphenomenon. Already
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux finds himself facing the central problem of Freedom. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: recognises that as psychological phenomena appear to contain qualities
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not given in their immediate antecedents, the law of proportion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cause to effect does not apply to the actions of the human mind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The principle of causality and the principle of the conservation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: energy are m themselves scientific "shibboleths," and neither of them,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: asserts Boutroux, can be worked out so absolutely as to justify
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves as ultimate descriptions of the universe. They are valuable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as practical maxims for the scientist, whose object is to follow the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: threads of action in this varied world of ours. They are incomplete,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and have merely a relative value. Philosophy cannot permit their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: application to the totality of this living, pulsing universe. For
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cause, we must remember, does not in its strictly scientific meaning
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imply creative power. The cause of a phenomenon is itself a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phenomenon. "The positive sciences in vain pretend to seize the divine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essence or reason behind things."_*_ They arrive at descriptive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formul<e6> and there they leave us. But, as Boutroux well reminds us in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concluding his thesis, formulas never explain anything because they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot even explain themselves. They are simply constructions made by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observation and abstraction and which themselves require explanation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Contingence des Lois de la Nature_, p 154.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The laws of nature are not restrictions which have been, as it were,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imposed upon her They are themselves products of freedom; they are, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: her, what habits are to the individual. Their constancy is like the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stability of a river-bed which the freely running stream at some early
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time hollowed out.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The world is an assembly of beings, and its vitality and nature cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be expressed in a formula. It comprises a hierarchy of creatures,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rising from inorganic to organic forms, from matter to spirit, and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man it displays an observing intelligence, rising above mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sensibility and expressly modifying things by free will. In this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception Boutroux follows Ravaisson, and he is also influenced by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that thinker's belief in a spiritual Power of goodness and beauty. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thus leads us to the sphere of religion and philosophy, both of which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavour, in their own manner, to complete the inadequacy of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely scientific standpoint. He thus stands linked up in the total
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development with Cournot and Renouvier, and in his own group with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier, in regard to this question of the relation of philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the sciences.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The critique of science, which is so prominent in Boutroux, was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characteristic of a number of thinkers whom we cannot do more than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mention here in passing, for in general their work is not in line with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the spiritualist development, but is a sub-current running out and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: separated from the main stream. This is shown prominently in the fact
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that, while Boutroux's critique is in the interests of idealism and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the maintenance of some spiritual values, much subsequent criticism of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science is a mere empiricism and, being divorced from the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: principles of the spiritualist philosophy, tends merely to accentuate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a vein of uncertainty--indeed, scepticism of knowledge. Such is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general standpoint taken by Milhaud, Payot, and Duhem. Rather apart
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from these stands the works of acute minds like Poincar<e9>, Durand de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Gros, and Hannequin, whose discussion of the atomic doctrines is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work of considerable merit. To these may be added Lalande's criticism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the doctrine of evolution and integration by his opposing to it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that of dissolution and disintegration. Passing references to these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: books must not, however, detain us from following the main development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which, from Boutroux, is carried on by Bergson.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We find that Bergson, like Boutroux, holds no brief for science, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in particular he opposes some of its doctrines which have been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dogmatically and uncritically accepted. His work, _Mati<e9>re et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: M<e9>moire_, is a direct critique of the scientific postulate of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psycho-physical parallelism which Bergson regards as the crux of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem at issue between science and philosophy-- namely, that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. He shows that this theory, which has been adopted by science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because of its convenience, ought not to be accepted by philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: without criticism. In his opinion it cannot stand the criticism which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he brings against it. A relation between soul and body is undeniable,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but he does not agree that that relation is one of absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: parallelism. To maintain parallelism is to settle at once and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beforehand, in an unwarrantably _a priori_ manner, the whole problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom. His intense spiritualism sees also in such a doctrine the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deadly enemy Epiphenomenalism, the belief that the spiritual is only a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: product of the physical. He maintains the unique and irreducible
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature of consciousness, and claims that the life of the soul or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit is richer and wider than the mere physical activity of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brain, which is really its instrument. Bergson asks us to imagine the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: revolution which might have been, had our early scientists devoted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves to the study of mind rather than matter, and claims that we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: suffer from the dogmatism of materialistic science and the geometrical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and mathematical conceptions of "a universal science" or "mathematic"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which come from the seventeenth century, and are seen later in Taine.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The inadequacy of the scientific standpoint is a theme upon which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson never tires of insisting. Not only does he regard a metaphysic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as necessary to complete this inadequacy, but he claims that our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellect is incapable of grasping reality in its flux and change. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: true instrument of metaphysics is, according to him, intuition.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson's doctrine of intuition does not, however, amount to a pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hostility to intellectual constructions. These are valuable, but they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are not adequate to reality. Metaphysics cannot dispense with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: natural sciences. These sciences work with concepts, abstractions, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: so suffer by being intellectual moulds. We must not mistake them for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the living, pulsing, throbbing reality of life itself which is far
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wider than any intellectual construction.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By his insistence upon this point, in which he joins hands with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: several of his predecessors, Bergson claims to have got over the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kantian difficulties of admitting the value and possibility of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysic. There is nothing irrational, he insists, in his doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of metaphysical intuition or "intellectual sympathy"; it is rather
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: super-rational, akin to the spirit of the poet and the artist. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: various sciences can supply data and, as such, are to be respected,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for they have a relative value. What Bergson is eager to do is to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: combat their absolute value. His metaphysic is, however, no mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "philosophy of the sciences" in the sense of being a mere summary of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the results of the sciences. His intuition is more than a mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: generalisation of facts; it is an "integral experience," a penetration
