title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reality in its flux and change, a looking upon the world _sub
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: specie durationis_. It is a vision, but it is one which we cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obtain without intellectual or scientific labour. We can become better
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: acquainted with reality only by the progressive development of science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _and_ philosophy. We cannot live on the dry bread of the sciences
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alone, an intuitional philosophy is necessary for our spiritual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: welfare. Science promises us well-being or pleasure, but philosophy,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims Bergson, can give us joy, by its intuitions, its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: super-intellectual vision, that vital contact with life itself in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fulness, which is far grander and truer than all the abstractions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science. This is the culmination of much already indicated in Cournot,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, Ravaisson, Lachelier, and Boutroux, which Bergson presents
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in a manner quite unique, thus closing in our period the development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of that criticism and hostility to the finality and absoluteness of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the purely scientific attitude which is so marked a feature of both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our second and third groups, the neo-critical thinkers and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neo-spiritualists.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Beginning with a glowing confidence in the sciences as ultimate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interpretations of reality, we thus have witnessed a complete turn of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the tide during the develop-* since 1851. Also, in following out the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: changes in the attitude adopted to Science, we have been enabled to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discover in a general manner that the central and vital problem which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our period presents is that of Freedom. It will be interesting to find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whether in regard to this problem, too, a similar change of front will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be noticeable as the period is followed to its close.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: NOTE.--The reader may be interested to find that Einstein has brought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: out some of Boutroux's points very emphatically, and has confirmed the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view of geometry held by Poincar<e9>. Compare the following statements:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux: "Mathematics cannot be applied with exactness to reality."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Mathematics and experience can never be exactly fitted into each
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Poincar<e9>: "Formul<e6> are not true, they are convenient."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Einstein: "If we deny the relation between the body of axiomatic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Euclidean geometry or the practically rigid body of reality, we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: readily arrive at the view entertained by that acute and profound
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinker, H. Poincar<e9> . . . _Sub specie <e6>terni_, Poincar<e9>, in my
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opinion, is right" (_Sidelights on Relativity_, pp. 33-35).
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: CHAPTER IV
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: FREEDOM
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The discussions regarding the relation between science and philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: led the thinkers of our period naturally to the crucial problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. Science has almost invariably stood for determinism, and men
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: were becoming impatient of a dogmatism which, by its denial of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, left little or no place for man, his actions, his beliefs,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his moral feelings.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "_La nature fatale offre <e0> la Libert<e9>
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Un probl<e8>me_."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_: Guyau, in his _Vers d'un Philosophe_, "_Moments de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Foi_--I.," _En lisant Kant_, p. 57.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was precisely this problem which was acutely felt in the philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of our period as it developed and approached the close of the century.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In a celebrated passage of his _Critique of Judgment_ the philosopher
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kant had drawn attention to the necessity of bringing together the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concept of freedom and the concept of nature as constructed by modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science, for the two were, he remarked, separated by an abyss. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself felt that the realm of freedom should exercise an influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon the realm of science, but his own method prohibited his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempting to indicate with any preciseness what that influence might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be. The fatal error of his system, the artificial division of noumena
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and phenomena, led him to assign freedom only to the world of noumena.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Among phenomena it had no place, but reigned transcendent, unknown and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unknowable, beyond the world we know.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The artificiality of such a solution was apparent to the thinkers who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: followed Kant, and particularly was this felt in France. "Poor
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consolation is it," remarked Fouill<e9>e, in reply to Kant's view, "for a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prisoner bound with chains to know that in some unknown realm afar he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: can walk freely devoid of his fetters."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The problem of freedom, both in its narrow sphere of personal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free-will and in its larger social significance, is one which has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merited the attention of all peoples in history. France, however, has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been pre-eminently a cradle for much acute thought on this matter. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: loomed increasingly large on the horizon as the Revolution approached,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it shone brilliantly in Rousseau. Since the Revolution it has been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: equally discussed, and is the first of the three watchwords of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: republic, whose philosophers, no less than its politicians, have found
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it one of their main themes.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The supreme importance of the problem of freedom in our period was due
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mainly to the need felt by all thinkers for attempting, in a manner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: different from that of Kant, a reconciliation between science and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morals (_science et conscience_), and to find amid the development of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific thought a place for the personality of the thinker himself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not merely as a passive spectator, but as an agent, a willing and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: acting being. Paul Janet, in his essays entitled _Probl<e8>mes du XIXe
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Si<e8>cle_,_*_ treating the question of science, asks whether the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: growing precision of the natural sciences and "the extension of their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 'positive' methods, which involve a doctrine or assumption of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: infallible necessity, do not imperil gravely the freedom of the moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: agent?" While himself believing that, however closely the sciences may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seem to encroach upon the free power of the human soul, they will only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: approach in an indefinite "asymptote," never succeeding in annulling
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it, he senses the importance of the problem. Science may endeavour to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tie us down to a belief in universal and rigid determinism, but the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human spirit revolts from the acceptance of such a view, and acclaims,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to some degree at least, the reality of a freedom which cannot be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: easily reconciled with the determinist doctrines.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Published in 1872.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the period which we have under review the central problem is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: undoubtedly that of freedom. Practically all the great thinkers in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: France during this period occupied themselves with this problem, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rightly so, for they realised that most of the others with which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy concerns itself depend in a large degree upon the attitude
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adopted to freedom. Cournot, Renouvier, Ravaisson, Lachelier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e, Boutroux, Blondel and Bergson have played the chief part in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the arena of discussion, and although differing considerably in their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: methods of treatment and not a little in the form of their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conclusions, they are at one in asserting the vital importance of this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem and its primacy for philosophy. The remark of Fouill<e9>e is by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no means too strong: "The problem which we are going to discuss is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only a philosophical problem; it is, _par excellence_, _the_ problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for philosophy. All the other questions are bound up with this."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This truth will be apparent when, after showing the development of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrines concerning freedom, we come, in our subsequent chapters, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consider its application to the questions of progress, of ethics and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the philosophy of religion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : In his preface to his Thesis _Libert<e9> et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: D<e9>terminisme_, later editions, p. vii.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We find in the thought of our period a very striking development or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: change in regard to the problem of freedom. Beginning with a strictly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist and naturalist belief in determinism, it concludes with a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritualism or idealism which not only upholds freedom but goes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further in its reaction against the determinist doctrines by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintaining contingency.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine and Renan both express the initial attitude, a firm belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism, but it is most clear and rigid in the work of Taine. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whole philosophy is hostile to any belief in freedom. The strictly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist, empiricist and naturalist tone of his thought combined
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the powerful influence of Spinoza's system to produce in him a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: firm belief in necessity--a necessity which, as we have seen, was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: severely rational and of the type seen in mathematics and in logic.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Although it must also be admitted that in this view of change and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development Taine was partly influenced by the Hegelian philosophy,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: yet his formulations were far more precise and mathematical than those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the German thinker.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We have, in considering his attitude to science, seen the tenacious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manner in which he clings to his dogma of causality or universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity. All living things, man included, are held in the firm grip
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of "the steel pincers of necessity." Every fact and every law in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe has its _raison explicative_, as Taine styles it. He quotes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with approval, in his treatment of this question at the close of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work _De l'Intelligence_, the words of the great scientist and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist Claude Bernard: "_Il y a un d<e9>terminisme absolu, dans les
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conditions d'existence des ph<e9>nom<e8>nes naturels, aussi bien pour les
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: corps vivants que pour les corps bruts_."_*_ In Taine and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: school of scientists like Bernard, whose opinions on this matter he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: voices, no room is accorded to freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _De l'Intelligence_, vol. 2, p. 480, the quotation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from Bernard is to be found in his _Introduction <e0> l'Etude de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: M<e9>decine exp<e9>rimentale_, p. 115.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine's belief in universal necessity and his naturalistic outlook led
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him to regard man from the physical standpoint as a mechanism, from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the mental point of view a theorem. Vice and virtue are, to quote his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own words, "products just as vitriol or sugar." This remark having
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeared to many thinkers a scandalous assertion, Taine explained in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an article contributed to the _Journal des D<e9>bats__/-_ that he did
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not mean to say that vice and virtue were, like vitriol or sugar,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _chemical_ but they are nevertheless products, _moral_ products, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral elements bring into being by their assemblage. And, he argues,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: just as it is necessary in order to make vitriol to know the chemical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elements which go to its composition, so in order to create in man the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hatred of a lie it is useful to search for the psychological elements
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which, by their union, produce truthfulness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : On December 19th, 1872.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Even this explanation of his position, however, did not prevent the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assertion being made that such a view entirely does away with all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: question of moral responsibility. To this criticism Taine objected.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "It does not involve moral indifference. We do not excuse a wicked man
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because we have explained to ourselves the causes of his wickedness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: One can be determinist with Leibnitz and nevertheless admit with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Leibnitz that man is responsible --that is to say, that the dishonest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man is worthy of blame, of censure and punishment, while the honest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man is worthy of praise, respect and reward."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In one of his _Essais_ Taine further argued in defence of his doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of universal determination that since WE ourselves are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determined--that is to say, since there is a psychological determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as well as a physical determinism--we do not feel the restriction
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which this determinism implies, we have the illusion of freedom and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: act just as if we were free. To this Fouill<e9>e replied that the value
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Taine's argument was equal to that of a man who might say, "Because
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _I_ am asleep, all of me, all my powers and faculties, therefore I am
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in a state where I am perfectly free and responsible." Certainly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine's remark that _we_ are determined had nothing in common with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief in that true determinism, which is equally true freedom, since
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is _self_-determination. Taine professed no such doctrine, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rested in a purely naturalistic fatalism, built upon formul<e6> of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: geometry and logic, in abstraction from the actual living and acting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the soul, and this dogma of determinism, to which he clung so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dearly, colours his view of ethics and of history. For Taine, "the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: World is a living geometry" and "man is a theorem that walks."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Like Taine, Renan set out from the belief in universal causation, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he employed the conception not so much in a warfare against man's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom of action as against the theologians' belief in miracle and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the supernatural. There is none of Taine's rigour and preciseness in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan, and it is difficult to grasp his real attitude to the problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom. If he ever had one, may be doubted. The blending of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: viewpoints, the paradox so characteristic of him, seems apparent even
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in this question.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His intense humanism prompted him to remarks in praise of freedom, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he seems to have recognised in man a certain power of freedom; but in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view of his belief in universal cause he is careful to qualify this.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Further, his intensely religious mind remained in love with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of divine guidance which is characteristic of Christian and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most religious thought. Although Renan left the Church, this belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: never left Renan. He sees God working out an eternal purpose in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history, and this he never reconciled with the problem of man's free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will. The humanist in him could remark that the one object of life is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the development of the mind, and the first condition for this is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. Here he appears to have in view freedom from political and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious restrictions. He is thinking of the educational problem. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own attitude to the ultimate question of freedom in itself, as opposed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to determinism, is best expressed in his _Examen d'une Conscience
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophique_. He there shows that the universe is the result of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lengthy development, the. beginnings of which we do not know. "In the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: innumerable links of that chain," says Renan, "we find not one free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: act before the appearance of man, or, if you like, living beings."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With man, however, freedom comes into the scheme of things. A free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cause is seen employing the forces of nature for willed ends. Yet this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is but nature itself blossoming to self-consciousness; this free cause
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: emanates from nature itself. There is no rude break between man with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his free power and unconscious nature. Both are interconnected.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Freedom is indeed the appearance of something "new," but it is not,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insists Renan, something divorced from what has gone before.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We see in Renan a rejection of the severely deterministic doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine, but it is by no means a complete rejection or refutation of it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan adheres largely to the scientific and positivist attitude which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is such a feature of Taine's work. His humanism, however, recognises
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the inadequacy of such doctrines and compels him to speak of freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as a human factor, and he thus brings us a step nearer to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of the case for freedom put forward so strongly by Cournot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Renouvier and by the neo-spiritualists.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: II
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: A very powerful opposition to all doctrines based upon or upholding
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism shows itself in the work of Cournot and the neo-critical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy. The idea of freedom is a central one in the thought of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: both Cournot and Renouvier.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot devoted his early labours to a critical and highly technical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: examination of the question of probability, considered in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mathematical form, a task for which he was well equipped._*_ Being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not only a man of science but also a metaphysician, or rather a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosopher who approached metaphysical problems from the impulse and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: data accorded him by the sciences, Cournot was naturally led to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wider problem of _probabilit<e9> philosophique_. He shows in his _Essai
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sur les Fondements de nos Connaissances_ that hazard or chance are not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely words which we use to cover our ignorance, as Taine would have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claimed. Over against the doctrine of a universal determinism he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: asserts the reality of these factors. The terms chance and hazard
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: represent a real and vital element in our experience and in the nature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reality itself. Probability is a factor to be reckoned with, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this is so because of the elements of contingency in nature and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life. Freedom is bound up essentially with the vitality which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See his _Essai sur les Fondements de nos
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Connaissances: "Hazard,"_ chap. iii.; "_Probabilit<e9> Philosophique_,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chap, iv., pp. 71-101; and chap. v., "_De l'Harmonie et de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The neo-critical philosopher, Renouvier, is a notable champion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. We have already seen the importance he attaches to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: category of personality. For him, personality represents a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness in possession of itself, a free and rational harmony--in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: short, freedom personified.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: From a strictly demonstrative point of view Renouvier thinks it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: impossible to prove freedom as a fact. However, he lays before us with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intense seriousness various. considerations of a psychological and a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral character which have an important bearing upon the problem. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem, he asserts, not only concerns our actions but also our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: knowledge. To bring out this point clearly, Renouvier develops some of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the ideas of his friend, Jules Lequier, on the notion of the autonomy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the reason, or rather of the reasonable will. In this way he shows
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doubt and criticism to be themselves signs of freedom, and asserts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that we form our notions of truth freely, or that at least they are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creations of our free thought, not laid upon us by an external
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: authority.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: More light is thrown on the problem by considering what Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: calls _vertige mental_, a psychopathological condition due to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disturbance of the rational harmony or self-possession which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constitutes the essence of the personal consciousness. This state is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterised by hallucination and error. It is the extreme opposite
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the self-conscious, reflective personality in full possession of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself and exercising its will rationally. Renouvier shows that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between these two extremes there are numerous planes of _vertige
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mental_ in which the part played by our will is small or negligible,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and we are thus victims of habit or tendency. Is there, then, any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: place for freedom? There most certainly is, says Renouvier, for our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom manifests itself whenever we inhibit an action to which we are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: excited by habit, passion or imagination. Our freedom is the product
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reflection. We are at liberty to be free, to determine ourselves in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accordance with higher motives. This power is just our personality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: asserting itself, and it does not contradict our being, more often
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than not, victims of habit. We have it in our power to make fresh
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beginnings. Renouvier's disbelief in strict continuity is here again
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: apparent. We must admit freedom of creation in the personality itself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and not seek to explain our actions by trying to ascend some scale of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: causes to infinity. There is no such thing as a sum to infinity of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: series; there is no such thing as the influence of an infinite series
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of causes upon the performance of a consciously willed act in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the personality asserts its initiative-- that is, its power of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: initiation of a new series, in short, its freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Passing from these psychological considerations, Renouvier calls our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attention to some of a moral nature, no less important, in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opinion, for shedding light upon the nature of freedom. If, he argues,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all is necessary, if all human actions are predetermined, then popular
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: language is guilty of a grave extravagance and appears ridiculous,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insinuating, as it does, that many acts might have been left undone
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and many events might have occurred differently, and that a man might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have done other than he did. In the light of the hypothesis of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rigorous necessity, the mention of ambiguous futures and the notion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "being otherwise" (_le pouvoir <ea>tre autrement_) seem foolish. Science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may assert the docrine of necessity and preach it valiantly, but the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human conscience feels it to be untrue and will not be gainsaid. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientist himself is forced to admit that man does not accept his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gospel of universal predestination or fatalism. This Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: recognises as an important point in the debate. Strange, is it not, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarks, that the mind of the philosopher himself, a sanctuary or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shrine for truth, should appear as a rebellious citadel refusing to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: surrender to the truth of this universal necessity. We believe
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ourselves to be free agents or, at least beings who are capable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: some free action. However slight such action, it would invalidate the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypothesis of universal necessity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: If all things are necessitated, then moral judgments, the notions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: right and of duty, have no foundation in the nature of things. Virtue
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and crime lose their character; the sentiments and feelings, such as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regret, hope, fear, desire, change their meaning or become
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: meaningless. Renouvier lays great stress upon these moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considerations.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Again, if everything be necessitated, error is as necessary as truth.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The false is indeed true, being necessary, and the true may become
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: false. Disputes rage over what is false or true, but these disputes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be condemned, for they themselves are, by virtue of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypothesis, necessary, and the disputes are necessarily absurd and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ridiculous from this point of view. Where then is truth? Where is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality? We have here no basis for either. Looking thus at history,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all its crimes and infamies are equally lawful, for they are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inevitable; such is the result, Renouvier shows, of viewing all human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action as universally predetermined.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The objections thus put forward by Renouvier against the doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal necessity are powerful ones. They possess great weight and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: result in the admission, even by its upholders, that "the judgment of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom is a natural datum of consciousness and is bound up with our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflective judgments upon which we act, being itself the foundation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet, we have, Renouvier reminds us, no logical proof of the reality of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. We feel ourselves moved, spontaneously and unconstrained. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: future, in so far as it depends upon ourselves, appears not as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prearranged but ambiguous, open._*_ Whether our judgment be true or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: false, we in practical life act invariably on the belief in freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: That, of course, as Renouvier admits at this stage of his discussion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: does not prove that our belief is not an illusion. It is a feeling,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: natural and spontaneous.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Cf., later, Bergson's remark: "The portals of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: future stand wide open, the future is being made."]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: One of the most current forms of the doctrine of freedom has been that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: known as the "liberty of indifference." The upholders of this theory
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regard the will as separated from motives and ends. The operation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the will is regarded by them as indifferent to the claims or influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reason or feeling. Will is superadded externally to motives, where
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such exist, or may be superimposed on intellectual views even to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extent of annulling these. Judgment and will are separated in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view, and the will is a purely arbitrary or indifferent factor. It can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operate without reason against reason. The opponents of freedom find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: little difficulty in assailing this view, in which the will appears to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operate like a dice or a roulette game, absolutely at hazard, reducing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man to a non-rational creature. Such a type of will, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier declares to be non-existent, for every man who has full
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness of an act of his has at the same time a consciousness of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an end or purpose for this act, and he proposes to realise by this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: means a good which he regards as preferable to any other. In so far as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he has doubts of this preference the act and the judgment will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: suspended. He must, however, if he be an intelligent being, pursue
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what he deems to be his good--that is to say, what he deems to be good
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: at the time of acting. Renouvier here agrees with Socrates and Plato
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the view that no man deliberately and knowingly wills what he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considers to be evil or to be bad for him. Virtue involves knowledge,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and although there is the almost proverbial phrase of Ovid and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Paul, about seeing and approving the better, yet nevertheless doing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the worse, it is a general statement which does not express an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: antithesis as present to consciousness at the time of action. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: agent may afterwards say
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: . . . "_Video meliora proboque
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deteriora sequor_."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but at the time of action "the worse" must appear to him as a good, at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any rate then and in his own judgment. Further, beyond these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychological considerations there are grave moral objections,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier points out, to admitting "an indifferent will," for the acts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of such a will being purely arbitrary and haphazard, the man will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no moral agent, no responsible person. A man who wills apart from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consideration of any motive whatever can never perform any meritorious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action. Under the conception of an indifferent will the term "merit"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ceases to have a meaning. The theologians who have asserted the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine (indeed, it seems to have originated, Renouvier thinks, with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them) have readily admitted this point, for it opens up the way for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their theory of divine grace or the good will of God acting directly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon or within the agent. Will and merit are for them quite separate,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the latter being due to the mystical operations of divine favour or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: grace, in honour of which the indifference of the will has been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: postulated. Philosophers not given to appeals to divine grace, who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have upheld the doctrine of the indifferent will, have really been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: less consistent than the theoloians and have fallen into grave error.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier appeals to the testimony of the penal laws of all nations in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: favour of his criticism of an indifferent will. Motive _is_ deemed a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: real factor, for men are not deemed to have acted indifferently. Some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deliberation, indeed, is implied in all action which is conscious and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human, some comparison of motives and a conscious, decision. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: values of truth, as well as those of morality are equally fatal to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indifferentist; for, asks Renouvier, is a man to be regarded as not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determined to affirm as true what he judges to be true?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The doctrine of freedom as represented by that of an indifferent will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is no less vicious, Renouvier affirms, than the opposing doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal necessity. The truth is that they both rest on fictions.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Indifferentism" imagines a will divorced from judgment, separated
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the rational man himself, an unseizable power, a mysterious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolute cause unconnected with reflection or deliberation, a mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chimera. For determinism the will is equally a fiction.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: A way out of this difficulty is to be found, according to Renouvier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in viewing the will in a manner different from that of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "indifferentists." Let us suppose the will bound up with motive, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: motive drawn from the intellectual and moral equipment of the man.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This, however, gives rise to psychological determinism. The will, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is argued, follows always the last determination of the understanding.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Greater subtilty attends on this argument against freedom than those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: put forward on behalf of physical determinism. Renouvier sees that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is no escape from such a doctrine as psychological determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unless we take a view of the will as bound up with the nature of man
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as a whole, with his powers of intellect and feeling. Such a will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be characterised as indifferent or as the mere resultant of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: motives.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The Kantian element in Renouvier's thought is noticeable in the strong
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral standpoint from which he discusses all problems, and this is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: particularly true of his discussion of this very vital one of freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He is by no means, however, a disciple of Kant, and he joins battle
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strongly with the Kantian doctrine of freedom. This is natural in view
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his entire rejection of Kant's "thing-in-itself," or noumena, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it follows therefrom, for Kant attached freedom only to the noumenal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world, denying its operation in the world of phenomena. The rejection
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of noumena leaves Renouvier free to discuss freedom in a less remote
