title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or less artificial manner than that of Kant.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: If it be true, argues Renouvier, that necessity rules supreme, then
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the human spirit can find peace in absolute resignation; and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: looking back over the past history of humanity one need not have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: different feelings from those entertained by the geologist or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: paleontologist. Ethics, politics and history thus become purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "natural" sciences (if indeed ethics could here have meaning, would it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not be identical with anthropology? At any rate, it would be purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positive. A normative view of ethics would be quite untenable in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: face of universal necessity). Any inconvenience, pain or injustice
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would have to be accepted and not even named "evil," much less could
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any effort be truly made to expel it from the scheme of things. To
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these accusations the defenders of necessity object. The practical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man, they say, need not feel this, in so far as he is under the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: illusion of freedom and unaware of the rigorous necessity of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things. He need not refrain from action.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: But this defence of necessity leads those who wish to maintain the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: case against it to continue the argument. Suppose that the agent does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _not_ forget that all is necessitated, what then? Under no illusion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the idea of freedom, he then acts at every moment of his existence in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the knowledge that he cannot but do what he is doing, he cannot but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will what he wills, he cannot but desire what he desires. In time this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must produce, says Renouvier, insanity either of an idle type or a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: furious kind, he will become an indifferent imbecile or a raving
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fanatic, in either case a character quite abnormal and dangerous.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These are extreme results, but between the two extremes all degrees of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: character are to be, found. The most common type of practical reason
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presents an antinomy in the system of universal necessity. The case
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for necessity must reckon with this fact-- namely, that the operation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of necessity has itself given rise to ethics which exists, and,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: according to the case, its existence is a necessary one; yet ethics
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constitutes itself in opposition to necessity, and under the sway of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity is quite meaningless. Here is a paradox which is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lessened if we suppose the ethical position to be an absurd and false
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: one. Whether false or not, morality in some form is practically as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal as human nature. That nature, Renouvier insists, can hardly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with sincerity believe an hypothesis or a dogma which its own moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: instincts belie continually.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: If, on the other hand, truth lies with the upholders of freedom, then
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man's action is seen to have great value and significance, for man
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: then appears as creating a new order of things in the world. His new
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: acts, Renouvier admits, will not be without preceding ones, without
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: roots or reasons, but they will be without _necessary_ connection with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the whole scheme of things. He is thus creating a new order; he is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creating himself and making his own history. Conscious pride or bitter
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remorse can both alike be present to him. The great revolutions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history will be regarded by him not as mystical sweepings of some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unknown force external to himself, but as results of the thought and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work of humanity itself. A philosophy which so regards freedom will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thus be a truly "human" philosophy. Renouvier rightly recognises that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the whole philosophy of history turns upon the attitude which we adopt
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In view of the many difficulties connected with the problem of freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: many thinkers would urge us to a compromise. Renouvier is aware of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dangers of this attitude, and he brings into play against it his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: logical method of dealing with problems. This does not contradict his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: statement about the indemonstrability of freedom, nor does it minimise
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the weight and significance of the moral case for freedom: it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complements it. Between contradictories or incompatible propositions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no middle course can be followed. Freedom and necessity cannot be both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: at the same time true, or both at the same time false, for of the two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things one must be true--namely, either human actions are all of them
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: totally predetermined by their conditions or antecedents, or they are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not all of them totally predetermined. It is to this pass that we are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brought in the logical statement of the case. Now sceptics would here
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assert that doubt was the only solution. This would not realh be a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solution, and however legitimate doubt is in front of conflicting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theories, it involves the death of the soul if it operates in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical affairs and in any circumstances where some belief is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolutely necessary to the conduct of life and to action.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The freedom in question, as Renouvier is careful to remind us, does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not involve our maintaining the total indetermination of things or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: denial of the operations of necessity within limits. Room is left for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom when it is shown that this necessity is not universal. Many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consequences of free acts may be necessitated. For example, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, I have a stone in my hand. I can freely will to hurl it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: north or south, high or low, but once thrown from my hand its path is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strictly determined by the law of gravity. The voluntary movement of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man on the earth may, however slightly, alter the course of a distant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: planet. Freedom, we might say, operates in a sphere to which necessity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supplies the matter. Ultimately any free act is a choice between two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alternatives, equally possible, but both necessitated as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: possibilities. The points of free action may seem to take up a small
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: amount of room in the world, so to speak, but we must realise how
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vital they are to any judgment regarding its character, and how
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tremendously important they are from a moral point of view. So far,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims Renouvier, from the admittance of freedom being a destruction
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the laws of the universe, it really shows us a special law of that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe, not otherwise to be explained--namely, the moral law.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Freedom is thus regarded by Renouvier as a positive fact, a moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certainty.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Freedom is the pillar of the neo-critical philosophy; it is the first
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth involved at once in all action and in all knowledge. Truth and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: error are not well explained, or, indeed, at all explained, by a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine which, embracing them both as equally necessary, justifies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them equally, and so in a sense verifies both of them. It was this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point which Brochard developed in his work _L'Erreur_, which has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neo-critical affinities. Man is only capable of science because he is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free; it is also because he is free that he is subject to error._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier claims that "we do not avoid error always, but we always
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _can_ avoid it."_/-_ Truth and error can only be explained, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: urges, by belief in the ambiguity of futures, movements of thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involving choice between opinions which conflict--in short, by belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in freedom. The calculation of probabilities and the law of the great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: numbers demonstrates, Renouvier claims, the indetermination of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: futures, and consciousness is aware of this ambiguity in practical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life. This belief in the ambiguity of futures is a condition, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shows, of the exercise of the human consciousness in its moral aspect,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and this consciousness in action regards itself as suspended before
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indetermination--that is, it affirms freedom. This affirmation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom Renouvier asserts to be a necessary element of any rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief whatever. It alone gives moral dignity and supremacy to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality, whose existence is the deepest and most radical of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existences. The personal life in its highest sense and its noblest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manifestation is precisely Freedom. Renouvier assures us that there is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nothing mysterious or mystical about this freedom. It is not absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: liberty and contingency of all things; it is an attribute of persons.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The part played thus freely by personality in the scheme or order of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the universe proves to us that that order or scheme is not defined or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formed in a predetermined manner; it is only in process of being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formed, and our personal efforts are essential factors in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formation. The world is an order which becomes and which is creating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself, not a pre-established order which simply unrolls itself in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time. For a proper understanding of the nature of this problem "we are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obliged to turn to the practical reason. It is a moral affirmation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom which we require; indeed, any other kind of affirmation would,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier maintains, presuppose this. The practical reason must lay
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: down its own basis and that of all true reason, for reason is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divided against itself reason is not something apart from man; it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man, and man is never other than practical--_i.e._, acting."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Considered from this standpoint there are four cases which present
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves to the tribunal of our judgment-- namely, the case for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, the case against freedom, the case for necessity and the case
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: against necessity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _De L'Erreur_, p. 47.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Psychologie rationnelle_, vol. 2, p. 96.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologie rationnelle_, vol. 2, p 78.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The position is tersely put in the Dilemma presented by Jules Lequier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the friend of Renouvier, quoted in the _Psychologie rationnelle_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: There are four possibilities:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1. To affirm necessity, necessarily.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 2. To affirm necessity, freely.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 3. To affirm freedom, necessarily.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 4. To affirm freedom, freely.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: On examining these possibilities we find that to affirm necessity,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessarily, is valueless, for its contradictory, freedom, is equally
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessary. To affirm necessity, freely, does not offer us a better
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: position, for here again it is necessity which is affirmed. If we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: affirm freedom necessarily, we are in little better case, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity operates again (although Renouvier notes that this gives a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certain basis for morality). In the free affirmation of freedom,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, is to be found not only a basis for morals, but also for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: knowledge and the search for truth. Indeed, as we are thus forced "to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: admit the truth of either necessity or freedom, and to choose between
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the one and the other with the one or with the other,"_/-_ we find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the affirmation of necessity involves contradiction, for there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are many persons who affirm freedom, and this they do, if the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinist be right, necessarily. The affirmation of freedom, on the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other hand, is free from such an absurdity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_., p. 138.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such is the conclusion to which Renouvier brings us after his wealth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of logical and moral considerations. He combines both types of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion and argument in order to undermine the belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism and to uphold freedom, which is, in his view, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essential attribute of personality and of the universe itself. He thus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: succeeded in altering substantially the balance of thought in favour
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom, and further weight was added to the same side of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scales by the new spiritualist group who placed freedom in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: forefront of their thought.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: III
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The development of the treatment of this problem within the thought of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the new spiritualists or idealists is extremely interesting, and it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proceeded finally to a definite doctrine of contingency as the century
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: drew to its close. The considerations set forth are usually
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychological in tone, and not so largely ethical as in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neo-critical philosophy.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson declared himself a champion of freedom. He accepted the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: principle of Leibnitz, to the effect that everything has a reason,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from which it follows that everything is necessitated, without which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there could be no certitude and no science. But, says Ravaisson, there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are two kinds of necessity--one absolute, one relative. The former is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: logical, the type of the principle of identity, and is found in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: syllogisms and in mathematics, which is just logic applied to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quantity. The other type of necessity is moral, and is, unlike the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: former, perfectly in accord with freedom. It indeed implies freedom,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the freedom of self-determination. The truly wise man can- not help
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doing what is right and good. The slave of Passion and caprice and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evil has no freedom. The wise man selecting the good chooses it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: infallibly, but at the time with perfect free-will. "It is perhaps
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because the good or the beautiful is simply nothing other than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: love--that is, the power of will in all its purity, and so to will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what is truly good is to will oneself (_c'est se vouloir
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: soi-m<ea>me_)."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _La Philosophie en France_, p. 268.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nature is not, as the materialists endeavour to maintain, entirely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: geometrical--that is to say, fatalistic in character. Morality enters
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: into the scheme of things and, with it, ends freely striven for. There
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is present a freedom which is a kind of necessity, yet opposed to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fatalism. This freedom involves a determination by conceptions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: perfection, ideals of beauty and of good. "Fatality is but an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appearance; spontaneity and freedom constitute reality."_/-_ So
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: far, continues Ravaisson, from all things operating by brute mechanism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or by pure hazard, things operate by the development of a tendency to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: perfection, to goodness and beauty. Instead of everything submitting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to a blind destiny, everything obeys, and obeys willingly, a divine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Providence.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_., p. 270]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson's fundamental spiritualism is clear in all this, and it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: serves as the starting-point for the thinkers who follow him.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Spiritualism is bound up with spontaneity, creation, freedom, and this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is his central point, this insistence on freedom. While resisting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanical determination he endeavours to retain a determination of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: another kind--namely, by ends, a teleology or finalism. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extremely interesting when observed in relation to the subsequent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development in Lachelier, Boutroux, Blondel and Bergson.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier's treatment of freedom is an important landmark in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritualist development. By his concentrated analysis of the problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of induction he brought out the significance of efficient and final
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: causes respectively. He appears as the pupil of Ravaisson, whose
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: initial inspiration is apparent in his whole work, especially in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: treatment of freedom. He dwells upon the fact of the spontaneity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the spirit--a point of view which Ravaisson succeeded in imparting to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the three thinkers, Lachelier, Boutroux and Bergson. Besides the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence of Ravaisson, however, that of Kant and Leibnitz appears in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier's attitude to freedom. Yet he passes beyond the Kantian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: position, and he rejects the double-aspect doctrine which Leibnitz
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintained with regard to efficient and final causes. Lachelier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insists that the spontaneity of spirit stands above and underlies the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whole of nature. This is the point which Boutroux, under Lachelier's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence, took up in his _Contingence des Lois de la Nature_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier, in attacking the purely mechanistic conception of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe, endeavoured, as he himself put it, "to substitute everywhere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: force for inertia, life for death and freedom for fatalism." Rather
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than universal necessity it is universal contingence which is the real
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: definition of existence. We are free to determine ourselves in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accordance with ends we set before us, and to act in the manner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessary to accomplish those ends. Our life itself, as he shows in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the conclusion of his brilliant little article _Psychologie et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: M<e9>taphysique_, is creative, and we must beware of arguing that what we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have been makes us what we are, for that character which we look upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as determining us need not do so if we free ourselves from habit, and,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further, this character is, in any case, itself the result of our free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: actions over extended time, the free creation of our own personality.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While with Ravaisson and Lachelier the concept of freedom was being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather fully developed in opposition to the determinist doctrines,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e, in his brilliant and acute thesis on _Libert<e9> et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: D<e9>terminisme_, endeavoured to call a halt to this supremacy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Freedom, and to be true to the principles of reconciliation which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: laid down for himself in his philosophy. He confesses himself, at the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: outset, to be a pacifist rather than a belligerent in this classic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dispute between determinists on the one hand and partisans of freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on the other. He believes that, on intimate investigation pursued
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sufficiently far, the two opposing doctrines will be seen to converge.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such a declaration would seem to be dangerously superficial in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: warfare as bitter and as sharp as this. It must be admitted that, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the case with many who profess to conciliate two conflicting views,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e leaves us at times without precise and definite indication of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his own position.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In contrast to the attitude of Ravaisson and Lachelier Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inclines in some respects to the attitude of Taine and many passages
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his book show him to be holding at least a temporary brief for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: partisans of determinism. He agrees notably with Taine in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: objecting to the contention that under the determinist theory moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: values lose their significance. Fouill<e9>e claims that it is both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: incorrect and unfair to argue that "under the necessity-hypothesis a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thing being all that it can be is thereby all that it should
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _La Libert<e9> et le D<e9>terminisme_, p. 51 (fourth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: edition)]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He goes on to point out that the consciousness of independence, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is an essential of freedom, may be nothing more than a lack of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness of our dependence. Motives he is inclined to speak of as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determining the will itself, while he looks upon the "liberty of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indifference" or of hazard as merely a concession to the operations of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanical necessity. The "liberty of indifference" is often the mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: play of instinct and of fatality, while hazard, so far from being an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: argument in the hands of the upholders of freedom, is really a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determination made previously by something other than one's own will.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is a direct attack upon the doctrines put forward by both Cournot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Renouvier. Fouill<e9>e is well aware of this, and twenty pages of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thesis are devoted to a critical and hostile examination of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: statements of both Renouvier and his friend Lequier._/-_ Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims that these two thinkers have only disguised and misplaced the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "liberty of indifference"; they have not, he thinks, really suppressed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it, although both of them profess to reject it absolutely. A keen
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion between Fouill<e9>e and Renouvier arose from this and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continued for some time, being marked on both sides by powerful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dialectic. Renouvier used his paper the _Critique philosophique_ as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his medium, while Fouill<e9>e continued in subsequent editions of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thesis, in his _Id<e9>e moderne du Droit_ and also in his acute study
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Critique des Syst<e8>mes de Morale contemporains_. Fouill<e9>e took
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier to task particularly for his maintaining that if all be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determined then truth and error are indistinguishable. Fouill<e9>e claims
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the distinction between truth and error is by no means parallel
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to that between necessity and freedom. An error may, he points out, be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessitated, and consequently we must look elsewhere for our doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of certitude than to the affirmation of freedom. In the philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, as we have seen, these two are intimately connected.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e criticises the neo-critical doctrine of freedom on the ground
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that Renouvier mars his thought by a tendency to look upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinist as a passive and inert creature. This, he says, is "the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: argument of laziness" applied to the intelligence. "One forgets," says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e, "that if intelligence is a mirror, it is not an immovable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and powerless mirror: it is a mirror always turning itself to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reality."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_., pp. 117-137.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _La Libert<e9> et le D<e9>terminisme_, p. 129.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: On examining closely the difference between Renouvier and Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: over this problem of freedom, we may attribute it to the fact that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: while the one thinker is distinctly and rigorously an upholder of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continuity, the other believes in no such absolute continuity. For
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e there is, in a sense, nothing new under the sun, while
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier in his thought, which has been well described as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy of discontinuity, has a place for new things, real
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beginnings, and he is in this way linked up to the doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creative development as set forth ultimately by Bergson. It will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seen also as we proceed that Fouill<e9>e, for all he has to say on behalf
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of determinism, is not so widely separated in his view of freedom from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that worked out by Bergson, although at the first glance the gulf
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between them seems a wide one.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e, while attacking Renouvier, did not spare that other acute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinker, Lachelier, from the whip of his criticism. He takes objection
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to a passage in that writer's _Induction_ where he advocates the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine that the production of ideas "is free in the most rigorous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense of that word, since each idea is in itself absolutely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: independent of that which precedes it, and is born out of nothing, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a world." To this view of the spontaneity of the spirit Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opposes the remark that Lachelier is considering only the _new forms_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which are assumed by a mechanism which is always operating under the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: same laws of causality. He asks us in this connection to imagine a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kaleidoscope which is being turned round. The images which succeed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: each other will be in this sense a formal creation, a form
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _independent_ of that which went before, but, as he is anxious to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remind us, the same mechanical and geometrical laws will be operating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continually in producing these forms.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having had these encounters with the upholders of freedom, and thus to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: some degree having conveyed the impression of being on the side of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinists, Fouill<e9>e proceeds to the task he had set
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself--namely, that of reconciliation. He felt the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unsatisfactoriness of Kant's treatment of freedom,_*_ and he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavours to remedy the lack in Kant of a real link between the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism of the natural sciences and the human consciousness of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, realised in the practical reason. Fouill<e9>e proposes to find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in his _id<e9>es-forces_ a middle term and to offer us a solution of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem at issue in the dispute.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: See above, p. 136. i]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He begins by showing that there has been an unfortunate neglect of one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important factor in the case--a factor whose reality is frankly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: admitted by both parties. This central, incontestable fact is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _idea_ of freedom. This idea, according to Fouill<e9>e, arises in us as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the result Of a combination of various psychological factors, such as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notions of diversity, possibility, with the tendency to action arising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the notion of action, which thus shows itself as a force. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: combination of these results in the genesis of the idea of freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Now the stronger this idea of freedom is in our minds the more we make
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it become a reality. It is an "idea-force" which by being thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tends to action and thus increases in power and fruitfulness. The idea
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom becomes, by a kind of determinism, more powerful in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proportion to the degree with which it is acted upon. Determinism thus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflects upon itself and in a curious way turns to operate against
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself. This directing power of the idea of freedom cannot be denied
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even by the most rigorous upholders of determinism. They at least are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: forced to find room in their doctrine for THE IDEA of freedom and its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical action on the lives of men, both individually and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: societies. The vice of the doctrines of determinism has been the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: refusal to admit the reality of the liberating idea of freedom, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is tending always to realise itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The belief in freedom is, therefore, Fouill<e9>e claims, a powerful force
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the world. Nothing is a more sure redeemer of men and societies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from evil ways than the realisation of this idea of freedom. So
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: largely is this the case that indeed the extinction of the BELIEF in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom would, he argues, not differ much in consequence from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finding that freedom was an illusion, or, if it be a fact, its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abolition.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having thus rectified the doctrine of determinism by including a place
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: within it for THE IDEA of freedom, Fouill<e9>e proceeds by careful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: analysis to show the error of belief in freedom understood as that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an indifferent will. This raises as many fallacious views as that of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism bereft of the idea of freedom. The capricious and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indifferent liberty he rejects, and in so doing shows us the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: importance of the intelligent power of willing, and also reaffirms the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinists' thesis of in-* *ability to do certain things. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychology of character shows us a determined freedom, and in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intelligent personality a reconciliation of freedom and determinism is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seen to be effected. Fouill<e9>e shows that if it were not true that very
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: largely what we have been makes us what we are, and that what we are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determines our future actions, then education, moral guidance, laws
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and social sanctions would all be useless. Indifferentism in thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the reversal of all thought.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e sees that the antithesis between Freedom and Necessity is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolute, and he modifies the warmth of Renouvier's onslaughts upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the upholders of determinism. But he believes we can construct a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notion of moral freedom which will not be incompatible with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism of nature. To effect this reconciliation, however, we must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abandon the view of Freedom as a decision indifferently made, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action of sheer will unrelated to intelligence. Freedom is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: caprice; it is, Fouill<e9>e claims, a power of indefinite development.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet, in the long and penetrating Introduction to his volume on the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Evolutionnisme des Id<e9>es-forces_, Fouill<e9>e points out that however
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: much science may feel itself called upon to uphold a doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism for its own specific purposes, we must remember that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sphere of science is not all-embracing. There is the sphere of action,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the practical life demands and, to a degree demonstrates, freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouillee admits in this connection the indetermination of the future,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _pour notre esprit_. We act upon this idea of relative indeterminism,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: combining with it the idea of our own action, the part which we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personally feel called upon to play. He recognises in his analysis how
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important is this point for the solution of the problem. We cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: overlook the contribution which our personality is capable of making
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the whole unity of life and experience, not only by its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: achievements in action, but by its ideals, by that which we feel both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _can_ and _should_ be. Herein lies, according to Fouill<e9>e's analysis,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the secret of duty and the ideal of our power to fulfil it, based upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the central idea of our freedom. By thus acting on these ideas, and by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the light and inspiration of these ideals, we tend to realise them. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is this which marks the point where a doctrine of pure determinism not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only shows itself erroneous and inadequate, but as Fouillee puts it,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the human consciousness is the point where it is obliged to turn
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: against itself "as a serpent which bites its own tail."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fatalism is a speculative hypothesis and nothing else. Freedom is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: equally an hypothesis, but, adds Fouill<e9>e, it is an hypothesis which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is at work in the world.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Evolutionnisme des Id<e9>es-forces_, Introduction, p.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lxxiv.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the thought of Guyau there is a further insistence upon freedom in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spite of the fact that his spiritualism is super-added to much which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reveals the naturalist and positive outlook. He upholds freedom and,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed, contingency, urging, as against Ravaisson's teleology, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is no definite tendency towards truth, beauty and goodness. At
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all times, too, Guyau is conscious of union with nature and with his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fellows in a way which operates against a facile assertion of freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In his _Vers d'un Philosophe_ he remarks:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "_Ce mot si doux au coeur et si cher, Libert<e9>,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: J'en pr<e9>f<e8>rs encore un: c'est Solidarit<e9>._"_/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Vers d'un Philosophe, "Solidarit<e9>,"_ p. 38]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The maintenance of the doctrine of liberty, which in view of the facts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we are bound to maintain, does away, Guyau insists, with the doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Providence; for him, as for Bergson, there is no _pr<e9>vision_ but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only _nouveaut<e9>_ in the universe. Guyau indeed is not inclined to
