title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: admit even that end which Bergson seems to favour--namely,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "spontaneity of life itself." The world does not find its end in us,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any more than we find our "ends" fixed for us in advance. Nothing is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fixed, arranged or predetermined; there is not even a primitive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adaptation of things to one another, for such adaptation would involve
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the pre-existence of ideas prior to the material world, to-* gether
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with a demiurge arranging things upon a plan in the manner of an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: architect. In reality there is no plan; every worker conceives his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own. The world is a superb example, not of order, such as we associate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the idea of Providence in action, but the reverse, disorder, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: result of contingency and freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The supreme emphasis upon the reality of freedom appears, however, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the work of Boutroux and of Bergson at the end of our period. They
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: arrive at a position diametrically opposed to that of the upholders of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism, by their doctrines of contingency as revealed both in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evolution of the universe and in the realm of personal life. There is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thus seen, as was the case with the problem of science, a complete
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "turn of the tide" in the development since Comte.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux, summing up his thesis _La contingence des Lois de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nature_, indicates clearly in his concluding chapter his belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency, freedom and creativeness. The old adage, "nothing is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lost, nothing is created," to which science seems inclined to attach
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself, has not an absolute value, for in the hierarchy of creatures
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency, freedom, newness appear in the higher ranks. There is at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work no doubt a principle of conservation, but this must not lead us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to deny the existence and action of another principle, that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creation. The world rises from inorganic to organic forms, from matter
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to spirit, and in man himself from mere sensibility to intelligence,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with its capacity for criticising and observing, and to will capable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of acting upon things and modifying them by freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux inclines to a doctrine of finalism somewhat after the manner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Ravaisson. The world he conceives as attracted to an end; the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beautiful and the good are ideals seeking to be realised; but this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief in finality does not, he expressly maintains, exclude
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency. To illustrate this, Boutroux uses a metaphor from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seamanship: the sailors in a ship have a port to make for, yet their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adaptations to the weather and sea en route permit of contingency
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: along with the finality involved in their making for port. So it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with beings in nature. They have not merely the one end, to exist amid
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the obstacles and difficulties around them, "they have an ideal to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realise, and this ideal consists in approaching to God, to his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: likeness, each after his kind. The ideal varies with the creatures,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because each has his special nature, and can only imitate God in and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by his own nature."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _La Contingence des Lois de la Nature_, p. 158.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux's doctrine of freedom and contingency is not opposed to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teleological conception of the universe, and in this respect he stands
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in contrast to Bergson, who, in the rigorous application of his theory
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom, rules out all question of teleology. With Renouvier and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with Bergson, however, Boutroux agrees in maintaining that this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, which is the basis of contingency in things, is not and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be a datum of experience, directly or indirectly, because
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: experience only seizes things which are actually realised, whereas
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this freedom is a creative power, anterior to the act. Heredity,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: instinct, character and habit are words by which we must not be misled
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or overawed into a disbelief in freedom. They are not absolutely fatal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and fully determined. The same will, insists Boutroux, which has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: created a habit _can_ conquer it. Will must not be paralysed by bowing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the assumed supremacy of instincts or habits. Habit itself is not a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contradiction of spontaneity; it is itself a result of spontaneity, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: state of spontaneity itself, and does not exclude contingency or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Metaphysics can, therefore, according to Boutroux, construct a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of freedom based on the conception of contingency. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supreme principles according to this philosophy will be laws, not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those of the positive sciences, but the laws of beauty and goodness,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expressing in some measure the divine life and supposing free agents.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In fact the triumph of the good and the beauti-* *ful will result in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the replacement of laws of nature, strictly so called, by the free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: efforts of wills tending to perfection--that is, to God.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Further studies upon the problem of freedom are to be found in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux's lectures given at the Sorbonne in 1892-93 in the course
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: entitled _De l'Id<e9>e de la Loi naturelle dans la Science et la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Philosophie contemporaines_. He there recognises in freedom the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: crucial question at issue between the scientists and the philosophers,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for he states the object of this course of lectures as being a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: critical examination of the notion we have of the laws of nature, with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a view to determining the situation of human personality, particularly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in regard to free action._*_ Boutroux recognises that when the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: domain of science was less extensive and less rigorous than it is now
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it was much easier to believe in freedom. The belief in Destiny
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: possessed by the ancients has faded, but we may well ask ourselves,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: says Boutroux, whether modern science has not replaced it by a yet
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more rigorous fatalism._/-_ He considers that the modern doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of determinism rests upon two assumptions--namely, that mathematics is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a perfectly intelligible science, and is the expression of absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism; also that mathematics can be applied with exactness to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reality. These assumptions the lecturer shows to be unjustifiable.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Mathematics and experience can never be fitted exactly into each
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other, for there are elements in our experience and in our own nature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which cannot be mathematically expressed. This Boutroux well
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: emphasises in his lecture upon sociological laws, where he asserts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that history cannot be regarded as the unrolling of a single law, nor
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: can the principle of causality, strictly speaking, be applied to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it._/=_ An antecedent certainly may be an influence but not a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cause, as properly understood. He here agrees with Renouvier s
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: position and attitude to history, and shows the vital bearing of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem of freedom upon the philosophy of history, to which we shall
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presently give our special attention.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _De l'Id<e9>e de la Loi naturelle_, Lecture IV., p. 29]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Compare Janet's remark, given on p. 136.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : Lecture XIII.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Instead of the ideal of science, a mathematical unity, experience
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shows us, Boutroux affirms, a hierarchy of beings, displaying variety
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and spontaneity--in short, freedom. So far, therefore, from modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science being an advocate of universal determinism, it is really, when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rightly regarded, a demonstration, not of necessity, but of freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux's treatment of the problem of freedom thus demonstrates very
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clearly its connection with that of science, and also with that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. It forms pre-eminently the central problem.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The idea of freedom is prominent in the "philosophy of action" and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Bergsonian philosophy; indeed, Bergson's treatment of the problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the culmination of the development of the idea in Cournot,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier and the neo-spiritualists. In Blondel the notion is not so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clearly worked out, as there are other considerations upon which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wishes to insist. Blondel is deeply concerned with the power of ideals
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: over action, and his thought of freedom has affinities to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychology of the _id<e9>es-forces_. This is apparent in his view of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will, where he does not admit a purely voluntarist doctrine. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insistence on the dynamic of the will in action is clear, but he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds us that the will does not cause or produce everything, for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will wills to be what is not yet; it strives for achievement, to gain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: something beyond itself. Much of Blondel's treatment of freedom is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: coloured by his religious and moral psychology, factors with which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson does not greatly concern himself in his writings. Blondel
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavours to maintain man's freedom of action and at the same time to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remain loyal to the religious notion of a Divine Providence, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: something akin to that. Consequently he is led to the dilemma which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: always presents itself to the religious consciousness when it asserts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its own freedom--namely, how can that freedom be consistent with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Divine guidance or action? Christian theology has usually been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinist in character, but Blondel attempts to save freedom by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: looking upon God as a Being immanent in man.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson makes Freedom a very central point in his philosophy, and his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: treatment of it bears signs of the influence of De Biran, Ravaisson,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lachelier, Guyau and Boutroux. He rejects, however, the doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finality as upheld by Ravaisson, Lachelier and Boutroux, while he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stresses the contingency which this last thinker had brought forward.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His solution of the problem is, however, peculiarly his own, and is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bound up with his fundamental idea of change, or LA DUR<c9>E.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In his work _Les Donn<e9>es imm<e9>diates de la Conscience_, or _Time and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Free-Will_, he criticises the doctrine of physical determinism, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is based on the principle of the conservation of energy, and on a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely mechanistic conception of the universe. He here points out, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: later stresses in his _Matiere et M<e9>moire_, the fact that it has not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been proved that a strictly determined psychical state corresponds to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a definite cerebral state. We have no warrant for concluding that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because the physiological and the psychological series exhibit some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: corresponding terms that therefore the two series are absolutely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: parallel. To do so is to settle the problem of freedom in an entirely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _a priori_ manner, which is unjustifiable.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The more subtle and plausible case for psychological determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson shows to be no more tenable than that offered for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: physical. It is due to adherence to the vicious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Association-psychology, which is a psychology without a self. To say
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the self is determined by motive will not suffice, for in a sense it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is true, in another sense it is not, and we must be careful of our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: words. If we say the self acts in accordance with the strongest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: motive, well and good, but how do we know it is the strongest? Only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because it has prevailed--that is, only because the self acted upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it, which is totally different from claiming that the self was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determined by it externally. To say the self is determined by certain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tives is to say it is self-determined. The essential thing in all this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the vitality of the self.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The whole difficulty, Bergson points out, arises from the fact that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all attempts to demonstrate freedom tend only to strengthen the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: artificial case for determinism, because freedom is only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characteristic of a self _in action_. He is here in line on this point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with Renouvier and Boutroux, although the reasons he gives for it go
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beyond in psychological penetration those assigned by these thinkers.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: When our action is over, says Bergson, it seems plausible to argue a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: case for determinism because of our spatial conception of time and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relationships of events in time. We have a habit of thinking in terms
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of space, by mathematical time, not in real time or _la dur<e9>e_ as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson calls it, the time in which the living soul acts.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson thus makes room in the universe for a freedom of the human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will, a creative activity, and thus delivers us from the bonds of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity and fatalism in which the physical sciences and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: associationist psychology would bind us. We perceive ourselves as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: centres of indetermination, creative spirits. We must guard our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, for it is an essential attribute of spirit. In so far as we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tend to become dominated by matter, which acts upon us in habit and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: convention, we lose our freedom. It is not absolute, and many never
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: achieve it, for their personality never shines forth at all: they live
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their lives in habit and routine, victims of automatism. We have,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, Bergson urges, great power of creation. He stresses, as did
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau, the Conception of Life, as free, expanding, and in several
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respects his view of freedom is closer to that of Guyau than to that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Boutroux, in spite of the latter's contingency. There is no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finalism admitted by Bergson, for he sees in any teleology only "a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reversed mechanism."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Obviously the maintenance of such a doctrine of freedom as that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson is of central importance in any philosophy which contains it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Our conceptions of ethics and of progress depend upon our view of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. For Bergson "the portals of the future stand wide open, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: future is being made." He is an apostle of a doctrine of absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency which he applied to the evolution of the world, in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: famous volume _L'Evolution Cr<e9>atrice_ (published in 1907). His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy has been termed pessimistic by some in view of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rejection of any teleological conception. Such a doctrine would
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conflict with his "free" universe and his absolute contingency. On the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other hand, it leaves open an optimistic view, because of its freedom,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its insistence upon the possibilities of development. It is not only a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reaction against the earlier doctrines of determinism, it is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deliverance of the human soul which has always refused, even when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious, to abandon entirely the belief in its own freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such is the doctrine of freedom which closes our period, a striking
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contrast to the determinism which, under the influence of modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science, characterised its opening. The critique of science and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assaults upon determinism proceeded upon parallel lines. In many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respects they were two aspects of the one problem, and in themselves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: were sufficient to describe the essential development in the thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of our half century, for the considerations of progress, ethics and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion to which we now turn derive their significance largely from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what has been set forth in these chapters on Science and Freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: CHAPTER V
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: PROGRESS
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: INTIMATELY bound up with the idea of freedom is that of progress. For,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: although our main approach to the discussion of freedom was made by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: way of the natural sciences, by a critique of physical determinism,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and also by way of the problem of personal action, involving a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: critique of psychological determinism, it must be noted that there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have appeared throughout the discussion very clear indications of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vital bearing of freedom upon the wide field of humanity's development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considered as a whole--in short, its history. The philosopher must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: give some account of history, if he is to leave no gap in his view of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the universe. The philosophy of history will obviously be vastly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: different if it be based on determinism rather than on freedom. When
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the philosopher looks at history his thoughts must inevitably centre
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: around the idea of progress. He may believe in it or may reject it as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an illusion, but his attitude to it will be very largely a reflection
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the doctrine which he has formed regarding freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The notion of progress is probably the most characteristic feature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which distinguishes modern civilisation from those of former times. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would have seemed to the Greeks foolishness. We owe it to the people
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who, in the modern world, have been what Greece was in the ancient
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world, the glorious mother of ideas. The eighteenth century was marked
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in France by a growing belief in progress, which was encouraged by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Encyclopaedists and rose to enthusiasm at the Revolution. Its best
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expression was that given by Condorcet, himself an Encyclopaedist, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: originally a supporter of the Revolution. His _Sketch of an Historical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Picture of the Progress of the Human Mind_ was written in 1793 (while
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its author was threatened with the guillotine_*_), published two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: years later, and became, in the early years of the nineteenth century,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a powerful stimulus to thought concerning progress. Much of the work
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is defective, but it had a great influence upon Saint-Simon, the early
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: socialists, and upon the doctrines of Auguste Comte, which themselves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are immediate antecedents of our own period. We may note briefly here,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that Condorcet believed in a sure and infallible progress in knowledge
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in social welfare. This is the important doctrine which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Saint-Simon and Comte both accepted from him. His ideal of progress is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contained in the three watchwords of the Revolution, _Libert<e9>_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Egalit<e9>_, _Fraternit<e9>_, particularly the last two. He forecasts an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abandonment of militarism, prophesies an era of universal peace, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the reign of equality between the sexes. Equality is a point which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insists upon very keenly, and, although he did not speak of sociology
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as did Comte, nor of socialism as did Saint-Simon, he claimed that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: true history of mankind is the history of the great mass of workers:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is not diplomatic and military, not the record of dazzling deeds of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: great men. Condorcet, however, was dogmatic in his belief in progress,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and he did not work out any "law" of progress, although he believed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress to be a law of the universe, in general, and an undeniable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth in regard to the life-history of mankind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_: He was ultimately imprisoned and driven to suicide.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Later, his friend Cabanis upheld a similarly optimistic view, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavoured to argue for it, against the Traditionalists, who we may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remember endeavoured to restate Catholicism, and to make an appeal to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those whom the events of the Revolution had disturbed and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disillusioned. The outcome of the Terror had somewhat shaken the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief in a straightforward progress, but enthusiastic exponents of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the doctrine were neither lacking nor silent. Madame de Sta<eb>l
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continued the thought of Condorcet, thus forming a link between him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Saint-Simon and Comte. The influence of the Traditionalists and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the general current of thought and literature known as Romanticism,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: helped also to solve a difficulty which distinguishes Condorcet from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte. This difficulty lay in the eighteenth-century attitude to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Middle Ages, which Condorcet had accepted, and which seriously damaged
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his thesis of general progress, for in the eighteenth century the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Middle Ages were looked upon as a black, dark regress, for which no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinker had a good word to say. The change of view is seen most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: markedly when we come to Comte, whose admiration of the Middle Ages is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a conspicuous feature of his work. While, however, Saint-Simon and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte were working out their ideas, great popularity was given to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief in progress by the influence of Cousin, Jouffroy, Guizot, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by Michelet's translation of the _Scienza nuova_ of the Italian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinker Vico, a book then a century old but practically unknown in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: France. For Cousin, the world process was a result of a necessary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evolution of thought, which he conceived in rather Hegelian fashion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Jouffroy agreed with this fatal progress, although he endeavoured to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reconcile it with that of personal freedom. Guizot's main point was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that progress and civilisation are the same thing, or rather, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: civilisation is to be defined only by progress, for that is its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fundamental idea. His definition of progress is not, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strikingly clear, and he calls attention to two types of progress--one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involving an improvement in social welfare, the other in the spiritual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or intellectual life. Although Guizot tried to show that progress in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: both these forms is a fact, he did not touch ultimate questions, nor
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: did he successfully show that progress is the universal key to human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history. He did not really support his argument that civilisation _is_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress in any convincing way, but he gave a stimulus to reflection
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on the question of the relationship of these two. Michelet's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: translation of Vico came at an appropriate time, and served a useful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purpose. It showed to France a thinker who, while not denying a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certain progress over short periods, denied it over the long period,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and reverted rather to the old notion of an eternal recurrence. For
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Vico, the course of human history was not rectilineal but rather
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiral, although he, too, refrained from indicating any law. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claimed clearly enough that each civilisation must give way to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: barbarism and anarchy, and the cycle be again begun.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such were the ideas upon progress which were current at the time when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Saint-Simon, Fourier and Comte were busily thinking out their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrines, the main characteristics of which we have already noted in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our Introduction on the immediate antecedents of our period. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought given to the question of progress in modern France is almost
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unintelligible save in the light of the doctrines current from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Condorcet, through Saint-Simon to Comte, for the second half of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: century is again characterised by a criticism and indeed a reaction
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: against the idea professed in the first half. This was true in regard
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to Science and to Freedom. We shall see a similar type of development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: illustrated again respecting Progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Already we have noted the general aim and object which both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Saint-Simon and Comte had in view. The important fact for our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion here is that Saint-Simon, by his respect for the Middle
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ages, and for the power of religion, was able to rectify the defects
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which the ideas of the eighteenth century had left in Condorcet's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of progress. Moreover, he claimed, as Condorcet had not done,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to indicate a "law of progress," which gives rise alternately to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "organic" and to "critical" periods. The Middle Ages were, in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opinion of Saint-Simon, an admirable period, displaying as they did an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: organic society, where there was a temporal and spiritual authority.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With Luther began an anarchical, critical period. According to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Saint-Simon s law of progress a new organic period will succeed this,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the characteristic of that period will be socialism. He advocated
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a gradual change, not a violent revolutionary one, but he saw in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: socialism the inevitable feature of the new era. With its triumph
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would come a new world organisation and a league of peoples in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: war would be no more, and in which the lot of the proletariat would be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free from oppression and misery. The Saint-Simonist School became
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practically a religious sect, and the chief note in its gospel was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Progress."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: That the notion of progress was conspicuous in the thought of this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time is very evident. It was, indeed, in the foreground, and a host of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: writers testify to this, whom we cannot do much more than mention
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here. A number of them figured in the events of 1848. The social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reformers all invoked "Progress" as justification for their theories
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: being put into action. Bazard took up the ideas of Saint-Simon and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expounded them in his _Exposition de la Doctrine saint-simonienne_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (1830). Buchez, in his work on the philosophy of history, assumed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress (1833). The work of Louis Blanc on _L'Organisation du Travail_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeared in 1839 in a periodical calling itself _Revue des Progr<e8>s_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The brochure from Proudhon, on property, came in 1840, and was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: followed later by _La Philosophie du Progr<e8>s_ (1851). Meanwhile
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fourier's _Th<e9>orie des Quatre Mouvements et des Destin<e9>es g<e9>n<e9>rales_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempted in rather a fantastic manner to point the road to progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Worthless as many of his quaint pages are, they were a severe
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indictment of much in the existing order, and helped to increase the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interest and the faith in progress. Fourier's disciple, Consid<e9>rant,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was a prominent figure in 1848. The Utopia proposed by Cabet insisted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon _fraternit<e9>_ as the keynote to progress, while the volumes of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Pierre Leroux, _De l'Humanit<e9>_, which appeared in the same year as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cabet's volume, 1840, emphasised _<e9>galit<e9>_ as the essential factor.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His humanitarianism influenced the woman-novelist, George Sand. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: same watchword of the Revolution had been eulogised by De Tocqueville
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in his important study of the American Republic in 1834, and that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: writer had claimed _<e9>galit<e9>_ as the goal of human progress. All these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: men take progress as an undoubted fact; they only vary by using a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: different one of the three watchwords, _Libert<e9>_, _Egalit<e9>_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Fraternit<e9>_, to denote the kind of progress they mean. Meanwhile,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Michelet and his friend Quinet combated the Hegelian conception of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history maintained by Cousin, and they claimed _libert<e9>_ to be the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: watchword of progress. The confidence of all in progress is almost
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pathetic in its unqualified optimism. It is not remarkable that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: events of 1851 proved a rude shock. Javary, a writer who, in 1850,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: published a little work, _De l'Id<e9>e du Progr<e8>s_, claimed that the idea
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the supremely interesting question of the time in its relation to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general philosophy of history and to the ultimate destiny of mankind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is fairly evident from the writers we have cited, without
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Javary's remark, but it is worth noting as being the observation of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contemporary. With the mention of Reynaud's _Philosophie religieuse_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upholding the principle of indefinite perfectability and Pelletan's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Profession du Foi du XIXe Si<e8>cle_, wherein he maintained confidently
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and dogmatically that progress is the general law of the universe, we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must pass on from these minor people to consider one who had a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: profounder influence on the latter half of the century, and who took
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: over the notion of progress from Saint-Simon.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This was Comte, whose attitude to progress in many respects resembles
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that of Saint-Simon, but he brought to his work a mental equipment
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lacking in the earlier writer and succeeded, by the position he gave
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to it in his Positive Philosophy, in making the idea of progress one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which subsequent thinkers could not omit from consideration.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: According to Comte, the central factor in progress is the mental.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ideas, as Fouill<e9>e was later to assert, are the real forces in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity's history. These ideas develop in accordance with the "Law of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Three Stages," already explained in our Introduction. In spite of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the apparent clearness and simplicity of this law, Comte had to admit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that as a general law of all development it was to some degree
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rendered difficult in its application by the lack of simultaneity in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development in the different spheres of knowledge and social life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While recognising the mental as the keynote to progress, he also
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insisted upon the solidarity of the physical, intellectual, moral and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social life of man, and to this extent admitted a connection and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interaction between material welfare and intellectual progress. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: importance of this admission lay in the fact that it led Comte to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: qualify what first appears as a definite and confident belief in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rectilineal progress. He admits that such a conception is not true,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for there is retrogression, conflict, wavering, and not a steady
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development. Yet he claims that there is a general and ultimate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress about a mean line. The causes which shake and retard the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: steady progress are not all-powerful, they cannot upset the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fundamental order of development. These causes which do give rise to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: variations are, we may note in passing, the effects of race, climate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and political and military feats like those of Napoleon, for whom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte did not disguise his hatred, styling him the man who had done
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most harm to humanity. Great men upset his sociological theories, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte was no democrat and strongly opposed ideas of Liberty and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Equality. We have remarked upon his general attitude to his own age,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as one of criticism and anarchy. In this he was probably correct, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he quite underestimated the extent and duration of that anarchy,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: particularly by his estimate of the decline and fall of Catholicism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and of militarism, which he regarded as the two evils of Europe. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: events of the twentieth century would have been a rude shock to him,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: particularly the international conflagration of 1914-1918. It was to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Europe that Comte confined his philosophy of history and consequently
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: narrowed it. He knew little outside this field.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He endeavoured, however, to apply his new science of sociology to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of European history. His work contains much which is good
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and instructive, but fails ultimately to establish any law of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. It does not seem to have occurred to Comte's mind that there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might not be one. This was the question which was presented to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinkers after him, and occupies the chief place in the subsequent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the second half of the century the belief in a definite and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inevitable progress appears in the work of those thinkers inspired by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the positivist spirit, Vacherot, Taine and Renan. Vacherot's views on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the subject are given in one of his _Essais de Philosophie
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: critique_,_*_ entitled "_Doctrine du Progr<e8>s_." These pages, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which sublime confidence shines undimmed, were intended as part of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: longer work on the Philosophy of History. Many of Renan's essays, and
