title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: especially the concluding chapters of his work _L'Avenir de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science_, likewise profess an extreme confidence in progressive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development. Yet Taine and Renan are both free from the excessive and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: glowing confidence expressed by Condorcet, Saint-Simon and Comte.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Undoubtedly the events of their own time reacted upon their doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of progress, and we have already noted the pessimism and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disappointment which coloured their thoughts regarding contemporary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: political events. Both, however, are rationalists, and have unshaken
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith in the ultimate triumph of reason.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: Published in 1864.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The attitude which Taine adopts to history finds a parallel in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fatalism and determinism of Spinoza, for he looks upon the entire life
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of mankind as the unrolling of a rigidly predetermined series of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: events. "Our preferences," he remarks, "are futile; nature and history
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have determined things in advance; we must accommodate ourselves to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them, for it is certain that they will not accommodate themselves to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us." Taine's view of history reflects his rejection of freedom, for he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintains that it is a vast regulated chain which operates
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: independently of individuals. Fatalism colours it entirely. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pre-* *cisely this attitude of Taine which raises the wrath of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, and also that of both Cournot and Fouill<e9>e, whose
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussions we shall examine presently. They see in such a doctrine an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: untrue view of history and a theory vicious and detestable from a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral standpoint, although it doubtless, as Fouill<e9>e sarcastically
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarks, has been a very advantageous one for the exploiters of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity in all ages to teach and to preach to the people.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In passing from Taine's fatalistic view of history to note his views
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on progress we find him asserting that man's nature does not in itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inspire great optimism, for that nature is largely animal, and man is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ever ready, however "civilised" he may appear to be, to return to his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: native primitive ferocity and barbarism. Man is not, according to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine, even a sane animal, for he is by nature mad and foolish. Health
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and wisdom only occasionally reign, and so we have no great ground for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: optimism when we examine closely the nature of man, as it really is.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine's treatment of the French Revolution_*_ shows his hostility
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to democracy, and he is sceptical about the value or meaning of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: watchwords, "Rights of Man," or _Libert<e9>_, _Egalit<e9>_, _Fraternit<e9>_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This last, he claims, is merely a verbal fiction useful for disguising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the reality, which is actual warfare of all against all.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _"La R<e9>volution,"_ in his large work, _Les Origines de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: la France contemporaine_]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet in spite of these considerations Taine believes in a definitely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: guaranteed progress. Man's lower nature does not inspire optimism, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his high power of reason does, and it is on this faith in reason that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine confidently founds his assertions regarding progress. He sees in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason the ultimate end and meaning of all else. The triumph of reason
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is an ideal goal to which, in spite of so many obstacles, all the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: forces of the universe are striving. In this intellectual progress,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this gradual rationalisation of mankind, Taine sees the essential
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: element of progress upon which all other goods depend. The betterment
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of social conditions will naturally follow; it is the spiritual and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mental factor which is the keynote of progress Reason, he contends,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will give us a new ethic, a new politic and a new religion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan shares with Taine the belief in reason and its ultimate triumph.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His views on progress are, however, more discursive, and are extremely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interesting and suggestive. He was in his later years shrewd enough to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discover the difficulties of his own doctrine. Thus although he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believed in a "guaranteed" progress, Renan marks a stage midway
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between the idea of progress as held by Comte and Taine on the one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hand, and by Cournot and Renouvier on the other.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His early book, _L'Avenir de la Science_, glows with ardent belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this assured progress, which is bound up with his confidence in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science and rationality. "Our creed," he there declares, "is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reasonableness of progress." This idea of progress is almost as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: central a point in Renan's thought as it was in that of Comte, and he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gave it a more metaphysical significance. His general philosophy owes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: much to history, and for him the philosophy of history is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: explanation of progress. By this term he means an ever-growing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tendency to perfection, to fuller consciousness and life, to nobler,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: better and more beautiful ends. He thinks it necessary to conceive of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a sort of inner spring, urging all things on to fuller life. He seems
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here to anticipate vaguely the central conception of Guyau and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson. But, like Taine, Renan founds his doctrine of progress on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rationalism. He well expresses this in one of his _Drames
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophiques (L'Eau de Jouvence)_, through the mouth of Prospero,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who represents rational thought. This character declares that "it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science which brings about social progress, and not progress which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gives rise to science. Science only asks from society to have granted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to it the conditions necessary to its life and to produce a sufficient
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: number of minds capable of understanding it."_*_ In the preface
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: written for this drama he declares that science or reason will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimately succeed in creating the power and force of government in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _L'Eau de Jouvence_, Act 4, Scene I., Conclusion.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These thoughts re-echo many of the sentiments voiced on behalf of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress by Condorcet, Saint-Simon and Comte. It is interesting,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, to note an important point on which Renan not only parts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: company with them, but ranges himself in opposition to them. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point is that of socialism or democracy, call it what one will.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the spring of 1871 Renan was detained at Versailles during the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: uproar of the Commune in Paris, and there wrote his _Dialogues et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fragments philosophiques_, which were published five years later. In
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these pages certain doctrines of progress and history are set forth,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notably in the "dialogues of three philosophers of that school whose
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ground-principles are the cult of the ideal, the negation of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supernatural and the investigation of reality." Renan raises a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of the end of the world's development. The universe, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintains, is not devoid of purpose: it pursues an ideal end. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goal to which the evolutionary process moves is the reign of reason.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: But there are striking limitations to this advance. From this kingdom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of reason on the earth the mass of men are shut out. Renan does not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believe in a gradual improvement of the mass of mankind accompanied by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a general rationalisation which is democratic. The truth is that Renan
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was an intellectual aristocrat and, as such, he abhorred Demos. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gospel of culture, upon which he lays the greatest stress, is for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: few who are called and chosen, while the many remain outside the pale,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beyond the power of the salvation he offers. The development of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: democratic idea he looks upon as thoroughly mischievous, inasmuch as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it involves, in his opinion, degeneration, a levelling down to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mediocrity. In his philosophy of history he adopts an attitude
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: somewhat akin to that of Carlyle in his worship of Great Men. The end
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of history is, Renan states, the production of men of genius. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: great mass of men, the common stuff of humanity, he likens to the soil
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from which these Great Ones grow. The majority of men have their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existence justified only by the appearance upon the scene of "Heroes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Culture." In this teaching the parallelism to the gospel of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Superman is apparent, yet it seems clear that although Renan's man of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: culture despises the ignorance and vulgarity of the crowd, he does so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: condescendingly as a benefactor, and is free from the passionate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hatred and scorn to which Nietzsche's Superman is addicted.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nevertheless, Renan's attitude of uncompromising hostility to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: democratic development is very marked. He couples his confidence in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science to his anti-democratic views, and affirms the "Herd" to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: incapable of culture. Although the process of rationalisation and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: establishment of the kingdom of reason is applicable only to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: patrician and not to the _plebs_, this process is claimed by Renan to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be capable of great extension, not in the number of its adherents but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the extent of culture. In this final reign of reason, instinctive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action and impulse will be replaced by deliberation, and science will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: succeed religion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His famous letter to Berthelot includes a brief statement of his views
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on progressive culture, which, for him, constitutes the sign of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. "One ought never," he writes, "to regret seeing clearer into
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the depths." By endeavouring to increase the treasure of the truths
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which form the paid-up capital of humanity, we shall be carrying on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the work of our pious ancestors, who loved the good and the true as it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was understood in their time. The true men of progress, he claims, are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those who profess as their starting-point a profound respect for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: past. Renan himself was a great lover of the past, yet we find him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarking in his _Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse_ that he has no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wish to be taken for an uncompromising reactionist. "I love the past,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but I envy the future," and he thinks that it would be extremely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasant to live upon this planet at as late a period as possible. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appears jealous of the future and of the young, whose fate it will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to know what will be the outcome of the activities of the German
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Emperor, what will be the climax of the conflict of European
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nationalities, what development socialism will take. His shrewd mind
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: had alreadv foreseen in a measure the possible development of German
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: militarism and of Bolshevism. He regards the world as moving towards a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kind of "Americanism," by which he means a type of life in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: culture and refinement shall have little place. Yet, although he has a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: horror and a dread of democracy, he feels also that the evils
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: accompanying it may be, after all, no worse than those involved in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reactionary dominance of nobles and clergy.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Humanity has not hitherto marched, he thinks, with much method. Order
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he considers to be desirable, but only in view of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Revolutions are only absurd and odious, he asserts in _L'Avenir de la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Science_, to those who do not believe in progress. Yet he claims that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reaction has its place in the plan of Providence, for it works
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unwittingly for the general good. "There are," to quote his metaphor,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "declivities down which the _r<f4>le_ of the traction engine consists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solely in holding back."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan thinks that if democratic ideas should secure a clear triumph,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science and scientific teaching would soon find the modest subsidies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: now accorded them cut off. He fears the approach of an era of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mediocrity, of vulgarity, in fact, which will persecute the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellectuals and deprive the world of liberty. He is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thoughtlessly optimistic; he was far too shrewd an intellect for that.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Our age, he suggests, may be regarded in future as the turning point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of humanity's history, that point where its deterioration set in, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prelude to its decline and fall. But he asserts, as against this, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nature does not know the meaning of the word "discouragement."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Humanity, proving itself incapable of progress, but only capable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further deterioration, would be replaced by other forms. "We must not,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because of our personal tastes, our prejudices perhaps, set ourselves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to oppose the action of our time. This action goes on without regard
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to us and probably is right."_*_ The future of science is assured.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With its progress, Renan points out, we must reckon upon the decay of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: organised religion, as professed by sects or churches. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disappearance of this organised religion will, however, result most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assuredly in a temporary moral degeneration, since morality has been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: so conventionally bound up with the Church. An era of egoism, military
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and economic in character, will arise and for a time prevail.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Preface to _Souvenirs d'Enfance et de Jeunesse_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet we must not, Renan reminds us, grumble at having too much unrest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and conflict. The great object in life is the development of the mind,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and this requires liberty or freedom. The worst type of society is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theocratic state, or the ancient pontifical dominion or any modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: replica of these where dogma reigns supreme. A humanity which could
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not be revolutionary, which had lost the attraction of "Utopias,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believing itself to have established the perfect form of existence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would be intolerable. This raises also the query that if progress be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the main feature of our universe, then we have a dilemma to face, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: either it leads us to a _terminus ad quem_, and so finally contradicts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself, or else it goes on for ever, and it is doubtful then in what
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense it can be a progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan's own belief was essentially religious, and was coloured by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian and Hebrew conceptions. It was a rationalised belief in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Divine Providence. He professed a confidence in the final triumph of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth and goodness, and has faith in a dim, far-off divine event which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he terms "the complete advent of God." The objections which are so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: frequently urged by learned men against finalism or teleology of any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kind whatsoever Renan deemed superficial and claimed, rightly enough,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that they are not so much directed against teleology but against
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theology, against obsolete ideas of God, particularly against the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dogma of a deliberate and omnipotent Creator. Renan's own doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Deity is by no means clear, but he believed in a spiritual power
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: capable of becoming some day conscious, omniscient and omnipotent. God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will then have come to himself. From this point of view the universe
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a progress to God, to an increasing realisation of the Divinity in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth, beauty and goodness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The universe, Renan claims, must be ultimately rooted and grounded in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness; there must be, in spite of all existing "evils," a balance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on the side of goodness, otherwise the universe would, like a vast
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: banking-concern, fail. This balance of goodness is the _raison d'<ea>tre_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the world and the means of its existence. The general life of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe can be illustrated, according to Renan, by that of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: oyster, and the formation within it of the pearl, by a malady, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: process vague, obscure and painful. The pearl is the spirit which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the end, the final cause and last result, and assuredly the most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brilliant outcome of this universe. Through suffering the pearl is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formed; and likewise, through constant pain and conflict, suffering
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and hardship, the spirit of man moves intellectually and morally
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: onward and upward, to the completed realisation of justice, beauty,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth and infinite goodness and love, to the complete and triumphant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realisation of God. We must have patience, claims Renan, and have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith in these things, and have hope and take courage. "One day virtue
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will prove itself to have been the better part." Such is his doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: II
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With Cournot and Renouvier our discussion takes a new form. Renan,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine, Vacherot and the host of social and political writers, together
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with August Comte himself, had accepted the fact of progress and clung
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the idea of a law of progress. With these two thinkers, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is a more careful consideration given to the problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. It was recognised as a problem and this was an immense
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advance upon the previous period, whose thinkers accepted it as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dogma.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: True to the philosophic spirit of criticism and examination which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves the rejection of dogma as such, Cournot and Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: approach the idea of progress with reserve and free from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: confidently optimistic assertions of the eighteenth and early
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nineteenth century. Scorning the rhetoric of political socialists,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivists and rationalists, they endeavour to view progress as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: central problem of the philosophy of history, to ascertain what it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves, and to see whether such a phrase as "law of progress" has a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: meaning before they invoke it and repeat it in the overconfident
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manner which characterised their predecessors. We have maintained
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: throughout this work that the central problem of our period was that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom. By surveying the general character of the thought of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time, and in following this by an examination of the relation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science and philosophy, we were able to show how vital and how central
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this problem was. From another side we are again to emphasise this.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having seen the way in which the problem of freedom was dealt with, we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are in a position to observe how this coloured the solutions of other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problems. The illustration is vivid here, for Cournot and Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: develop their philosophy of history from their consideration of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, and base their doctrines of progress upon their maintenance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is obvious that the acceptance of such views as those expressed on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom by both Cournot and Renouvier must have far-reaching effects
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon their general attitude to history, for how is the dogma of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress, as it had been preached, to be reconciled with free action?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is much easier to believe in progress if one be a fatalist. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: difficulty here was apparent to Comte when he admitted the influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of variations, disturbing causes, which resulted in the development of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mankind assuming an oscillating character rather than that of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: straight-* forward progress. He did not, however, come sufficiently
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: close to this problem, and left the difficulty of freedom on one side
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by asserting that the operation of freedom, chance or contingency
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (call it what we will), issuing in non-predetermined actions, was so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limited as not to interfere with the general course of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot and Renouvier take up the problem where Comte left it at this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point. Each of them takes it a stage further onward in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development. The fundamental ideas of Cournot we have briefly noted as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: being those of order, chance and probability. The relation of these to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress he discusses, not only in his _Essai sur les Fondements de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nos Connaissances_ and the _Trait<e9> de l'Encha<ee>nement d'Id<e9>es_, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: also in a most interesting manner in his two volumes entitled
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Consid<e9>rations sur la Marche des Id<e9>es et des Ev<e8>nements dans les
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Temps modernes_. Like Comte, he is faithful, as far as his principles
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will allow, to the idea of order. There is order in the universe to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certain degree; science shows it to us. There is also, he maintains,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom, hazard or chance. Looking at history he sees, as did Comte,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phenomena which, upon taking a long perspective, appear as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interferences. Pure reason is, he claims, really incapable of deciding
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the vital question whether these disturbances are due to a pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency, chance or freedom, or whether they mark the points of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence of the supernatural upon mankind's development. He refers to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the _encha<ee>nement de circonstances providentielles_ which helped the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: early Jews and led to the propagation of their monotheism; which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: helped also the development of the Christian religion in the Roman
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Empire. Hazard itself, he claims,_*_ may be the agent or minister
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Providence. Such a view claims to be loyal at once to freedom and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to order.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Essai sur les Fondaments de nos Connaissances_, vol.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: i, chap. 5.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Cournot continues his discussion further and submits many other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considerations upon progress. He claims that it is absurd to see in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: every single occurrence the operations of a divine providence or the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work of a divine architect. Such a view would exalt his conception of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: order, undoubtedly, but only at the expense of his view of freedom. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will not give up his belief in freedom, and in consequence declares
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that there is no pre-arranged order or plan in the sense of a "law."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He sets down many considerations which appear as dilemmas to the pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason, and which only action, he thinks, will solve. He points out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the difficulty of economic and social progress owing to our being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unable to test theories until they are in action on a large field. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shows too how conflicting various developments may be, and how
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress in one direction may involve degeneration in another.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Equality may be good in some ways, unnatural and evil in others.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Increase of population may be applauded as a progress from a military
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: standpoint, but may be an economic evil with disastrous suffering as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its consequence. The "progress" to peace and stability in a society
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: usually involves a decrease in vitality and initiative. By much wealth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of argument, no less than by his general attitude, Cournot was able to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: apply the breaks to the excessive confidence in progress and to call a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: halt for sounder investigation of the matter.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier did much more in this direction. In his _Second Essay of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: General Criticism_ he touched upon the problem of progress in relation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to freedom, and his fourth and fifth essays constitute five large
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: volumes dealing with the "Philosophy of History." He also devotes the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: last two chapters of _La Nouvelle Monadologie_ to progress in relation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to societies, and brings out the central point of his social ethics,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that justice is the criterion of progress. Indeed, all that Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: says regarding history and progress leads up, in a manner peculiarly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his own, to his treatment of ethics, which will claim attention in our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: next chapter.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _The Analytic Philosophy of History_ forms an important item in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophical repertoire of Renouvier. He claims it to be a necessary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: feature of the neo-critical, and indeed of any serious, philosophy. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is, he claims, not a branch of knowledge which has an isolated place,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for it is as intimately connected to life as is any theory to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: facts which it embraces. That is not to say, and Renouvier is careful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to make this clear, that we approach history assuming that there are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: laws governing it, or a single law or formula by which human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development can be expressed. The "Philosophy of History" assumes no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such thing; it is precisely this investigation which it undertakes,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: loyal to the principles of General Criticism of which it, in a sense,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: forms a part. In a classification it strictly stands between General
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Criticism or Pure Philosophy and History itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "History," says Renouvier, "is the experience which humanity has of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself,"_*_ and his conclusions regarding progress depend on the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: views he holds regarding human personality and its essential
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attribute, freedom. The philosophy of history has to consider whether,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in observing the development of humanity on the earth, one may assert
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the presence of any general law or laws. Can one say legitimately that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there has been development? Is there really such a thing as progress?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: If so, what is our idea of progress? What is the trend of humanity's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history? These are great questions.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Introduction <e0> la Philosophie de l'Histoire_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Pr<e9>face.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The attitude which Renouvier adopts to the whole course of human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history is based upon his fundamental doctrines of discontinuity,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom and personality. There are, he claims, real beginnings,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unpredicable occurrences, happenings which cannot be explained as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: having been caused by preceding events. We must not, he urges, allow
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ourselves to be hypnotised by the name "History," as if it were in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself some great power, sweeping all of us onward in its course, or a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vast ocean in which we are merely waves. Renouvier stands firm in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: loyalty to personality, and sees in history, not a power of this sort,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but simply the total result of human actions. History is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: collective work of the human spirit or of free personalities._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Renouvier's great objection to Comte's work was due to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his disagreement with Comte's conception of Humanity. To Renouvier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with his intense valuation of personality, this Comtian conception was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: too much of an abstraction.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is erroneous to look upon it as either the fatalistic functioning
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of a law of things or as the results of the action of an all-powerful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Deity or Providence. Neither the "scientific" view of determinism nor
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the theological conception of God playing with loaded dice, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, will explain history. It is the outcome of human action, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personal acts which have real worth and significance in its formation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: History is no mere display of marionettes, no Punch-and-Judy show with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a divine operator pulling strings from his concealed position behind
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the curtain. Equally Renouvier disagrees with the view that history is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely an unrolling in time of a plan conceived from eternity. Human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society and civilisation (of which history is the record) are products
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of man's own thought and action, and in consequence manifest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discontinuity, freedom and contingency. Renouvier thus opposes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strongly all those thinkers, such as the Saint-Simonists, Hegelians
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Positivists, who see in history only a fatalistic development. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: joins battle especially with those who claim that there is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fatalistic or necessitated progress. History has no law, he claims,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and there is not and cannot be any law of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The idea of progress is certainly, he admits, one with which the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosopher is brought very vitally into contact in his survey of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history. Indeed an elucidation of, this notion might itself be a part
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the historian's task. If so, the historians have sadly neglected
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: part of their work. Renouvier calls attention to the fact that all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those historians or philosophers who accept a comforting doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity's assured progress make very plausible statements, but they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: never seem able to state with any clearness or definiteness what
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constitutes progress, or what significance lies in their oft-repeated
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phrase, "the law of progress." He rightly points out that this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insistence upon a law, coupled with a manifest inability to indicate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what it is, causes naturally a certain scepticism as to there being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any such law at all.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier brands the search for any law of progress a futile one,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: since we cannot scientifically or logically define the goal of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity or the course of its development because of the fact of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom and because of our ignorance. We must realise that we,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personally at firsthand, see only an infinitesimal part of humanity's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life on this planet alone, not to speak of a destiny possible beyond
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this globe, and that, at second-hand, we have only evidence of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: portion of the great procession of human events. We do not know
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity's beginning and primitive history, nor do we know its goal,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: if it has one. These factors alone are grave hindrances to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formulation of any conception of progress. Reflection upon them might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have saved men, Renouvier observes, from the presumptuous belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assured progress. We cannot presume even to estimate the tendencies,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the direction of its course, because of the enormous and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ever-increasing complexity of free human activity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By his large work on the "Philosophy of History," Renouvier shows that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the facts of history themselves are against the theory of a universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and continuous progress, for the record shows us conflict, advance,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: retrogression, peoples rising, others degenerating, empires
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: establishing themselves and passing away by inward ruin or outer
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: assaults, or both, and civilisations evolving and disintegrating in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their turn. The spectacle does not readily promote an optimistic view
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of human development at all, much less support the doctrine of a sure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and certain progress. Renouvier does not blind himself to the constant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: struggle and suffering. The theatre, or rather the arena, of history
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presents a curious spectacle. In politics and in religion he shows us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that there are conflicts of authority and of free thought, a warfare
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of majorities with minorities, a method of fighting issues slightly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: less savage than the appeal to pure force, but amounting to what he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: terms "a pacific application of the principle of force." History shows
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us the corruption, tyranny and blindness of many majorities, and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tragic and necessary resort to force as the only path to liberty for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: down-trodden minorities. How, Renouvier asks, can we fit this in with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a doctrine of assured progress, or, indeed, progress at all?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Further, he does not find it difficult to show that much unthinking
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: utterance on the part of the optimists may be somewhat checked by calm
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflection on even one or two questions. For example, Was progress
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involved in the change from ancient slavery to the wage-slavery of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: modern industrialism? Was Christianity, as Nietzsche and others have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempted to maintain, a retrogression? Or, again, Was the change from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Greek city life to the conditions of the Middle Ages in any way to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarded as a progress?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
