author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier considers it quite erroneous to assert, as did Comte, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is a steady and continuous development underlying the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: oscillations, and that the variations, as it were, from the direct
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: line of progress cancel one another or balance each other, leaving, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan claimed, a balance always and inevitably on the side of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such a confidence in the great world banking concern Renouvier does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not possess. There is no guarantee that the account of goodness may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not be overdrawn and found wanting. He reminds us sternly and solemnly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the terrible solidarity which characterises evil. Deceit, greed,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lust, violence and war have an enormous power of breeding each other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and of supporting one another increasingly. The optimistic doctrines
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of progress are simply untrue statements of the facts of history, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: falsely coloured views of human nature. It is an appalling error in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "social dynamics" to overlook the clash of interest, the greed of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nation and of class, the fundamental passionate hate and war. With it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is coupled an error in "social statics," in which faith is put in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: institutions, in the mechanism of society. These, declares Renouvier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will not save humanity; they will, indeed, ruin it if it allow itself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: through spiritual and moral lethargy, to be dominated by them. They
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have been serviceable creations of humanity at some time or other, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they must serve men, but men must not be bound down to serve them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This servitude is evil, and it has profoundly evil consequences.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having attacked Comte's view of progress and of order in its static
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and dynamic point of view, Renouvier then brings up his heavy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: artillery of argument against Comte's idealisation of the Middle Ages.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To assert that this period was an advance on the life of the Greek
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: city, Renouvier considers to be little short of impudence. The art and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science and philosophy of the Greeks are our best heritage, while the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Middle Ages, dominated by a vicious and intolerant Church, with its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: infallible theology and its crushing power of the clergy, was a "dead
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hand" upon the human spirit. While it provided an organic society, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only succeeded in doing so by narrowing and crushing the human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellect. The Renascence and the Reformation proved that there were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essential elements of human life being crushed down. They reached a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point, however, where they exploded.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Not only does Renouvier thus declare the Middle Ages to be a regress,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but he goes the length of asserting that the development of European
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history _could_ have been different. This is his doctrine of freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: applied to history. There is no reason at all for our regarding the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Middle Ages or any such period as necessitated in the order of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mankind's development. There is no law governing that development;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consequently, had mankind, or even a few of its number, willed and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: acted upon their freedom differently, the whole trend of the period we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: call the Dark Ages might have been quite other than it was. Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: does not shirk the development of this point, which is a central one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for his purpose. It may seem fantastic to the historians, who must of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: course accept the past as given and consequently regard reflection on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "what might have been" as wasted time. Certainly the past cannot be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: altered--that is not Renouvier's point. He intends to give a lesson to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity, a stern lesson to cure it of its belief in fatalism in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regard to history. This is the whole purpose of the curious volume he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: published in 1876, entitled _Uchronie_, which had as its explanatory
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sub-title _L'Utopie dans l'Histoire, Esquisse historique du
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: D<e9>veloppement de la Civilisation europ<e9>enne, tel qu'il n'a pas <e9>t<e9>,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tel qu'il avail pu <ea>tre_. The book, consisting of two manuscripts
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supposed to be kept in the care of an old Dutch monk, is actually an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imaginary construction by Renouvier himself of European history in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: period 100 to 800 A.D., written to show the real possibility that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sequence of events from the Emperor Nerva to the Emperor Charlemagne
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might have been radically different from what it actually was.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: All this is intended by Renouvier to combat the "universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justification of the past." He sees that the doctrine of progress as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: usually stated is not only a lie, but that it is an extremely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dangerous one, for it justifies the past, or at least condones it as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inevitable, and thus makes evil a condition of goodness, demoralises
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history, nullifies ethics and encourages the damnation of humanity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself. This fatalistic doctrine, asserts Renouvier with great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: earnestness, must be abandoned; freedom must be recognised as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operative, and the human will as making history.There is no law of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress, and the sooner humanity can come to realise this the better
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it will be for it. Only by such a realisation can it work out its own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: salvation. "The real law lies", declares Renouvier,"only in an equal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: possibility of progress or deterioration for both societies and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals." If there is to be progress it can only come because, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: when, humanity recognises itself as collectively responsible for its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own history, and when each person feels his own responsibility
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarding that action. No acceptance of events will avail; we must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _will_ progress and consciously set ourselves to realise it. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: possible, but it depends on us. Here Renouvier's considerations lead
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him from history to ethics. "Almost all the Great Men, men of great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will, have been fatalists. So slowly does humanity emerge from its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: shadows and beget for itself a just notion of its autonomy. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phantom of necessity weighs heavily," he laments, "over the night of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history."_*_ With freedom and a recognition of its freedom by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity generally we may see the dawn of better things. Humanity will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: then consciously and deliberately make its history, and not be led by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the operations of herd-instinct and fatalistic beliefs which in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: past have so disgraced and marred its record.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologie ralionnelle_, vol. 2, p. 91.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The existing condition of human society can only be described frankly,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in Renouvier's opinion, as a state of war. Each individual, each
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: class, each nation, each race, is actually at war with others. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matters not whether a diplomatic state of peace, as it is called,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: exists or not; that must not blind us to the facts. By institutions,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: customs, laws, hidden fraud, diplomacy, and open violence, this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conflict is kept up. It is all war, says Renouvier. Modern society is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: based on war, economic, military or judicial. Indeed, military and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: naval warfare is a clear issue, but only a symbol of what always goes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on. Might always has the upper hand, hence ordinary life in modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society is just a state of war. Our civilisation does not rest on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justice, or on the conception of justice; it rests on power and might.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Until it is founded on justice, peace, he urges, will not be possible;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity will be enslaved in further struggles disastrous o itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This doctrine of the _<e9>tat de guerre_, as descriptive of modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society, he makes a feature of his ethics, upon which we must not here
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: encroach, but may point out that he insists upon justice as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimate social criterion, and claims that this is higher than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: charity, which is inadequate as a basis for society, however much it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may alleviate its ills. One of the chief necessities, he points out,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an essential to any progressive measure would be to moralise our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: modern notion of the state._*_ In the notes to his last chapter of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the _Nouvelle Monadologie_ Renouvier attacks the Marxian doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the materialistic determination of history.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : This point was further emphasised by Henri Michel in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his work, _L'Id<e9>e de l'Etat_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This same book, however, we must note, marks a stage in Renouvier's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own thought different from his doctrines in the earlier _Essais de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Critique g<e9>n<e9>rale_, and this later philosophy, of which the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Monadologie_ and _Personnalisme_ are the two most notable volumes,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: displays an attempt to look upon progress from a more ultimate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: standpoint. His _th<e9>odic<e9>e_ here involves the notion, seen in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson, of an early perfection, involving a subsequent "fall," the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world now, with its _guerre universelle_, being an intermediate stage
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between a perfect or harmonious state in the past and one which lies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the future.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The march of humanity is an uncertain one because it is free. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy of history thus reiterates the central importance of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. The actual end or purpose of this freedom is not simply, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, the attainment of perfection, but rather the possibility of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. It was this thought which led him on in his reflections
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further than any of the thinkers of our period, or at least more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deliberately than any, to indicate his views on the doctrine of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: future life for humanity. So far from this being a purely religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem, Renouvier rightly looks upon it as merely a carrying further
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: afield of the conception of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: For him, and this is the significant point for us here, any notion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a future life for humanity, in the accepted sense of immortality, is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bound up with, and indeed based upon, the conception of progressive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development. It is true that Renouvier, like Kant, looks upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problems of "God, Freedom and Immortality" as the central ones in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy, true also that he recognises the significance of this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief in a Future Life as an extremely important one for religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teaching; but his main attitude to the question is merely a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continuation of his general doctrine of progress, coupled with his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appreciation of personality. It is in this light only that Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflects upon the problem of Immortality. He makes no appeal to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world beyond our experience-- a fact which follows from his rejection
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the Kantian world of "noumena"; nor does he wish the discussion to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be based on the assertions of religious faith. He admits that belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in a Future Life involves faith, in a sense, but it is a rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief, a philosophical hypothesis and, more particularly, according
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to Renouvier, a moral hypothesis. He asserts against critics that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: undertaking of such a discussion is a necessary part of any Critical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Philosophy, which would be incomplete without it, as its omission
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would involve an inadequate account of human experience.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier claims that, in the first instance, the question of a future
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existence arises naturally in the human mind from the discrepancy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is manifest in our experience between nature on the one hand and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience on the other. The course of events is not in accord with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what we feel to be morally right, and the demands of the moral law
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are, to Renouvier's mind, supreme. He realises how acutely this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discrepancy is sometimes felt by the human mind, and his remarks on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this point recall those of the sensitive soul, who, feeling this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: acutely, cried out:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Ah, Love! could thou and I with Fate conspire
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To grasp this sorry Scheme of Things entire,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Would we not shatter it to bits--and then
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Re-mould it nearer to the heart's desire."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These lines well express the sharpness of Renouvier's own feelings,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and he claims that, such a conspiracy being impossible, the belief in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Immortality becomes a necessary moral postulate or probability.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The grounds for such a postulate are to be found, he claims, even in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the processes of nature itself. The law of finality or teleology
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manifests itself throughout the universe: purpose is to be seen at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work in the Cosmos. It is true that in the lower stages of existence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it seems obscure and uncertain, but an observer cannot fail to see
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "ends" being achieved in the biological realm. The functions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: organisms, more particularly those of the animal world, show us a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realm of ends and means at work for achieving those ends. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development in the direction of an end, this teleology, implies, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, a destiny. The whole of existence is a gradual procession
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of beings at higher and higher levels of development, ends and means
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to each other, and all inheriting an immense past, which is itself a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: means to their existence as ends in themselves. May one not then,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: suggests Renouvier, make a valid induction from the destiny thus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: recognised and partially fulfilled of certain individual creatures, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a destiny common to all these creatures indefinitely prolonged?_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologic rationnelle_, vol. 2, pp. 220-221.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The objection is here made that Nature does not concern herself with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals; for her the individual is merely a means for the carrying
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on and propagation of the species. Individuals come into being, live
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for a time and pass away, the species lives on perpetually; only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: species are in the plan of the universe, individuals are of little or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no worth. To this Renouvier replies that species live long but are not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: perpetual; whole species have been wiped out by happenings on our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: planet, many now are dying out. The insinuation about the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: worthlessness of individuals rouses his wrath, for it strikes at the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: very root of his philosophy, of which personality is the keynote.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This, he says, is to lapse into Pantheism, into doctrines of Buddhists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and of Spinoza. Pantheism and all kindred views are to be rejected. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is not in the indefinable, All-existing, the eternal and infinite One,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that we find help with regard to the significance of ends in nature.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ends are to be sought in the individuals or the species. But while it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: behoves us to look upon the world as existing for the species and not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the species for the sake of the world, we must remember that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: species exists for the sake of the individuals in it. It is false to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: look upon the individuals as existing merely for the sake of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: species.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: If we subordinate the individual to the species, sacrificing his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inherent worth and unique value, and then subordinate species to genus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and all genera to the All, we lose ourselves in the Infinite substance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in which everything is swallowed up. Again, Pantheism tends to speak
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the perfection of individuals, and speaks loudly of progress from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: one generation to another. But it tells only of a future which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves the entire sacrifice of all that has worth or value in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: past. It shows endless sacrifice, improvement too, but all for naught.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "What does it matter to say that the best is yet to be, if the best
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must perish as the good, to give place to a yet better 'best' which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will not have the virtue of enduring any more than the others? Do we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: offer any real consolation to Sisyphus," asks Renouvier, "by promising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him annihilation, which is coupled with the promise of successors
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: capable of lifting his old rock higher and still higher up the fatal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: slope, by offering him the eternal falling of this rock and successors
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who will continually be annihilated and endlessly be replaced by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: others?" The rock is the personal life. On this theory, however high
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the rock be pushed, it always is destined to fall back to the same
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: depth, as low as if it had never been pushed up hill at all. We refuse
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to reconcile a world containing real ends and purposes within it with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such a game, vast and miserable, in which no actor plays for his own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sake, and all the false winners lose all their gains by being obliged
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to leave the party while the play goes on for ever. This is to throw
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: away all individual worth, the value of all personal work and effort,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to declare individuality a sham, and to embrace fatality. It is this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mischievous Pantheism which is the curse of many religions and many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophies. Against it Renouvier wages a ceaseless warfare. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals, he asserts exist both for their own sake and worth, also
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for the sake and welfare of others. In the person, the law of finality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finds its highest expression. Personality is of supreme and unique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: value.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This being so, it becomes a necessary postulate of our philosophy, if
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we really believe in the significance of personalities and in progress
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (which Renouvier considers to have no meaning apart from them), to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conclude that death is but an event in the career of these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personalities. They are perpetuated beyond death.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: For Renouvier, as for Kant, the chief arguments for survival are based
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on considerations of a moral character, upon the demands of the moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal for self- realisation, for the attainment of holiness or, more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: properly, "wholeness." This progress can only be made possible by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continued existence after bodily death of the identical personality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unique and of eternal worth in the scheme of things, capable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further development than is possible amid the conditions of life as we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: know it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We must, however, present to ourselves Immortality as given by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of appearances in this world of phenomena, under the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general laws with which we are acquainted to-day, thus correcting the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: method of Kant, who placed Immortality in a noumenal world. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: salvation of a philosopher should not be of such a kind. We must treat
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Immortality as a Law, not as a miracle. The thinker who accepts the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: latter view quits the realm of science--that is, of experience and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason--to establish a mystic order in contradiction with the laws of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature. The appeal to the "supernatural" is the denial of nature, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the appellant ruins his own case by his appeal. If Immortality is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fact, it must be considered rationally.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Is Death--that is, the destruction of individuals as such, or the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: annihilation of personalities--a reality? Renouvier reminds those who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: jeer at the doctrine of Immortality that "the reality of death (as so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: defined) has not been, and cannot be, proved." Our considerations must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of necessity be hypothetical, but they can be worthy of rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beings. We must then keep our hopes and investigations within the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realm of the universe and not seek to place our hope of immortality in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a region where nothing exists, "not even an ether to support the wings
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of our hope."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's general considerations led him to view all individuals as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: having a destiny in which their individuality should be conserved and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: developed. When we turn in particular to man, these points are to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seen in fuller light. The instinctive belief in Immortality is bound
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: up with his nature as a thinking being who is capable of setting up,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and of striving after, ends. This continual striving is a marked
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characteristic of all human life, a counting oneself not to have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attained, a missing of the mark.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The human consciousness protests against annihilation. At times this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is very keenly expressed. "At the period of the great aspirations of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the heart, the ecstasy of noble passions is accompanied by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conviction of Immortality. Life at its highest, realising its richest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality, protests, in virtue of its own worth, and in the name of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the depths of power it still feels latent in itself, against the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: menace of annihilation."_*_ It cries out with its unconquerable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: soul:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologie rationnelle_, vol. 2, p. 249.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Give me the glory of going on and not to die!"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier finds a further witness in the testimony of Love--that is to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: say, in nature itself arrived at the con-* *sciousness of that passion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in virtue of which it exists and assuring itself by this passion, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the power to surmount all these short-comings and failures. Love
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: casteth out fear, the dread of annihilation, and shows itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "stronger than death." Hope and Love unite in strengthening the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: initial belief in Immortality and the "will to survive."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier admits that this is _a priori_ reasoning, and speedily _a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: posteriori_ arguments can be brought up as mighty battering-rams
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: against the fortress of immortal life, but although they mav shake its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: walls, they are unable to destroy the citadel. Nothing can demonstrate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the impossibility of future existence, whereas the whole weight of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral law and the teleological elements at work in the universe are,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: according to Renouvier, in favour of such a belief.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Morality, like every other science, is entitled to, nay obliged to,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: employ the hypothesis of harmony. Now in this connection the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypothesis of harmony (or, as Kant styled it, the concurrence of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: happiness and virtue necessary to a conception of order) finds
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reinforcement from the consideration of the meaning and significance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom. For the actual end or purpose of freedom is not simply the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attainment of perfection, but rather the possibility of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Immortality becomes a necessary postulate, reinforced by instinct,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason, morality, by the fact of freedom, and the notion of progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Further, Renouvier feels that if we posit death as the end of all we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thereby give an absolute victory to physical evil in the universe.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The postulate of Immortality has a certain dignity and worth. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of future life must, however, be kept within the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: possibilities of law and phenomena. Religious views, such as those of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Priestley, by their appeal to the miraculous debase the notion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Immortality itself. Talk of an immortal essence, and a mortal essence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is meaningless, for unless the same identical person, with his unique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: character and memory, persists, then our conception of immortality is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of little or no value. The idea of an indestructible spiritual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: substance is not any better or more acceptable. Our notion of a future
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life must be based upon the inherent and inalienable rights of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral person to persistence and to chances of further development or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. Although we must beware of losing ourselves in vain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speculations, which really empty our thought of all its content,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier claims that we are quite entitled to lay down hypotheses.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The same general laws which we see in operation and which have brought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the universe and the beings in it to the stage of development in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they now are may, without contradiction, be conceived as operating in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: further developments after the change we call bodily death. There is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no incongruity in conceiving the self-same personality continuing in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: second and different organism. Renouvier cites the case of the grub
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the butterfly and other metamorphoses. In man himself he points to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: organic crises, which give the organism a very different character and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: effect a radical change in its constitution. For example, there is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: critical exit from the mother's womb, involving the change from a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: being living in an enclosure to that of an independent creature. When
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: once the crisis of the first breath be passed the organism starts upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: another life. There are other crises, as, for instance, the radical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: changes which operate in both sexes at the stage of puberty. Just as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the personality persists in its identity through all these changes,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may it not pass through that of bodily death?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The Stoics believed in a cosmic resurrection. Substituting the idea of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress for their view of a new beginning, Renouvier claims that we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may attain the hypothesis that all human history is but a fragment in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a development incomparably greater and grander. Again, we may conceive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of life in two worlds co-existing, indeed interpenetrating, so that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the dead are not gone far from us into some remote heaven.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: But, whatever form we give to our hypothesis regard-* *ing progress
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: into another existence beyond this present one, Renouvier does not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: easily allow us to forget that it must be based upon the significance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom, progress and personality supported by moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considerations. Even this progress is not guaranteed, and even if it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: should be the achievement of some spirits there is no proof that it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal. Our destiny, he finally reminds us, lies in our own hands,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for progress here means an increased capacity for progress later,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: while spiritual and moral indifference will result finally, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed, necessarily, in annihilation. Here, as so often in his work,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier puts moral arguments and appeals in the forefront of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought. Progress in relation to humanity's life on earth drew from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him an appeal for the establishment of justice: progress in a further
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world implies equally a moral appeal. Our duty is to keep the ideal of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress socially and individually ever before us, and to be worthy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immortality if it be a fact, rather than to lose ourselves in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mistaken piety of "other- worldliness." About neither progress can we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be dogmatic; it is not assured, Renouvier has shown, and we must work
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for it by the right use of our freedom, our intelligence and our will.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: III
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: No thinker discussed the problem of progress with greater energy or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: penetration than Renouvier. The new spiritualist group, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: developed certain views arising from the question of contingency, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the relation of freedom to progress. These thinkers were concerned
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more with psychological and metaphysical work, and with the exception
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Fouill<e9>e and Guyau, they wrote little which bore directly upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem of progress. Many of their ideas, however, have an indirect
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bearing upon important points at issue.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In Ravaisson, Lachelier and Boutroux, we find the question of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teleology presented, and also that of the opposition of spirit and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matter. From the outset the new spiritualism had to wrestle with two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: difficulties inherent in the thought of Ravaisson. These were,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: firstly, the reconciliation of the freedom and spontaneity of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit with the operations of a Divine Providence or teleology of some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kind; and, secondly, the dualism assumed in the warfare of spirit and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matter, although spirit was held to be superior and anterior to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matter. This last involved a complication for any doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress, as it required a primitive "fall" to account for matter,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even a fall of the Deity himself. This Ravaisson himself admits, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he thinks that in creating the world God had to sacrifice some of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own being. In this case "progress" is set over against a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: transcendental existence, and is but the reawakening of what once
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existed in God, and in a sense now and eternally exists. Progress
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is, claims Ravaisson, towards truth and beauty and goodness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is the operation of a Divine Providence acting by attracting men
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freely to these ideals, and as these are symbols of God himself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress is the return of the spirit through self-conscious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personalities to the fuller realisation of harmony, beauty and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: love--that is, to the glory of God, who has ever been, now is, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ever shall be, perfect beauty, goodness and love.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Thus, although from a temporal and finite standpoint Ravaisson can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speak of progress, it is doubtful if he is justified in doing so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimately, _sub specie <e6>ternitatis_. To solve the problem in the way
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he presents it, one would need to know more about the ultimate value
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and significance of the personalities themselves, and their destiny in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relation to the Divinity who is, as he claims, perfect harmony, beauty
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and love. It was this point, so dear to an upholder of personality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which had led Renouvier to continue his discussion of progress in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relation to history as generally understood, until it embraced a wider
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: field of eternal destiny, and to consider the idea of a future life as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: arising from, and based upon, the con-* *ception of progress. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this same point which later perplexes Bergson, when he recognises this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self-conscious personality as the ultimate development of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: <e9>volution cr<e9>atrice, and so constituting in a sense the goal of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit, although he is careful to state that there is no finalism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involved at all. Ravaisson stands for this finalism, however, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claiming that there are ends. He does not see how otherwise we could
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speak of progress, as we should have no criterion, no _terminus ad
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quem_; all would be simply process, not progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _"D<e9>tachement de Dieu, retour <e0> Dieu, cl<f4>ture du grand cercle
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cosmique, restitution de l'universel <e9>quilibre, telle est l'histoire
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: du monde."_ Such is Ravaisson's doctrine, much of which is akin to,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and indeed re-echoes, much in Christian theology from St. Augustine,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with his idea of an eternal and restless movement of return to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divinity, to the Westminster divines in their answer to the important
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: query about the chief end of man, which they considered to be not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to glorify God but to enjoy Him for ever. This last and rather strange
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phrase only seems to have significance if we conceive, in Ravaisson's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manner, of beauty, truth and goodness as expressions or manifestations
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the Divinity to whom the world-process may freely tend.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: For Lachelier the universal process presents a triple aspect,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mechanism which is coupled with finalism and with freedom. These three
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: principles are in action simultaneously in the world and in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individual. Each of us is at once matter, living soul and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality-- that is, necessity, finality and freedom. The laws of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander
