text: the universe, so far from being expressed entirely by mechanical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formulae, can only be expressed, as Ravaisson had claimed, by an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: approach to harmony and beauty, not in terms of logic or geometry. All
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this involves a real progress, a creativeness, which differs from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson's return, as it were, to the bosom of God.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux combines the views of Ravaisson and Lachelier by insisting on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom and contingency, but maintaining at the same time a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teleological doctrine. Already in discussing his conception of freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we have referred to his metaphor of the sailors in the ship. His
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of contingency is directly opposed to any rigid pre-ordained
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: plan of reality or progress, but it does not prevent the spirit from a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creative teleology, the formation of a plan as it advances. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: precisely, is it not, the combination of free action and of teleology
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which we find in our own lives? Boutroux is thus able to side with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson in his claim to see tendencies to beauty and truth and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness, the fruits of the spirit, which it creates and to which it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: draws us, while at the same time he maintains freedom in a manner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quite as emphatic as Lachelier. He is careful to remind us that "not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all developments are towards perfection."_*_ In particular he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dislikes the type of social theory or of sociology which undervalues
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the personal life._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Contingence des Lois de la Nature_, p. 127.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Thus he agrees with Renouvier's objection to Comte's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view and to Communism.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Similar in many ways to the ideas of Ravaisson and of Boutroux are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those expressed by Blondel. He is concerned deeply with the problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: God and progress, which arises out of his view of the Deity as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immanent and as transcendent. He is quite Bergsonian in his statement
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that God creates Himself in us, but he qualifies this by asking the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: significant question, "If he does not EXIST how can He create Himself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in us." This brings us back to Ravaisson's view. Other remarks of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Blondel, however, recall the doctrine of Vacherot and of Renan, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: God is the ideal to which we are ever striving. "It is a necessity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that we should be moving on, for He is always beyond." All action is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an advance, a progress through the realm of materialistic determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the self-conscious personality in man, but it is from a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: transcendent teleology, a Divine Providence, that this action
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proceeds.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is the line of thought pursued by Fouill<e9>e, who in many of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: writings gives considerable attention to the doctrines of progress. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may be doubted, however if he ever surpassed the pages in his _Libert<e9>
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: et D<e9>terminisme_ and _L'Evolutionnisme des Id<e9>es-forces_, which deal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with this point. These are the best expressions of his philosophy, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e repeated himself a great deal. We might add, however, his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Socialism_ and his book on _L'Avenir de la M<e9>taphysique_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We have observed the importance attached by Comte to his new science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of sociology. Fouill<e9>e endeavours to give to it a metaphysical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: significance with which Comte did not concern himself. He suggests in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his volume on _La Science sociale contemporaine_ that as biology and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociology are closely related, the laws common to them may have a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cosmic significance. Is the universe, he asks, anything more than a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vast society in process of formation, a vast system of conscious,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: striving atoms? Social science which Fouill<e9>e looks upon, as did
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte, as constituting the crown of human knowledge, may offer us, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinks, the secret of universal life, and show us the world as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: great society in process of development, erring here and blundering
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there in an effort to rise above the sphere of physical determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and materialism to a sphere where justice shall be supreme, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brotherhood take the place of antagonism, greed and war. The power at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the heart of things, which is always ready to manifest itself in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human consciousness when it can, might be expressed, says Fouill<e9>e, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: one word as "sociability."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Life in its social aspect displays a _conspiration_ to a common end.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The life of a community resembles a highly evolved organism in many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respects, as Fouill<e9>e shows; but although he thus partially adopts the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: biological and positivist view of the sociologists, Fouill<e9>e does not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: overlook the idealistic conceptions of Renouvier and his plea for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social justice. He rather emphasises this plea, and takes the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opportunity to point out that it represents the best political thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his country, being founded on the doctrine of the _contrat social_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Rousseau, of which social theory it is a clear and modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interpretation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We may take the opportunity afforded here by Fouill<e9>e's mention of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociology, in which he was so keenly interested, to observe that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist tendency to emphasise an indefinite progress remained with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most of the sociologists and some of the historians. It is seen in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: two famous sociological works of Tarde and Durkheim respectively, _Les
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Lois de l'Imitation_ and _La Division du Travail social_. Two writers
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on history deserve mention as illustrating the same tendency: Lacombe,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whose work _De l'Histoire consid<e9>r<e9>e comme Science_ (1894) was very
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivist in outlook, and X<e9>nopol. This last writer, treating history
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in 1899 in his _Principes fondamentaux de l'Histoire_,_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: distinguished cause in history from causality in science, and showed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that white the latter leads to the formation of general laws the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: former does not. History has no laws, for it is succession but never
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: repetition. Much of his book, however, reflects the naturalism and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positivism which is a feature of the sociological writers._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : This work, revised and considerably augmented, was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: re-issued in 1905 with the new title, _La Th<e9>orie de l'Histoire_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : It was this which made Enouvier criticise sociology.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He disagreed with its principles almost entirely. On this, see his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notes to "_La Justice_," Part VII. of _La Nouvelle Monadogie_, pp.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was his doctrine of _id<e9>es-forces_ and its essential spiritualism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or idealism which distinguished Fouill<e9>e's attitude from that of these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociologists who were his contemporaries. It was the basis, too, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his trenchant criticisms of socialism, particularly its Marxian forms.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e agrees with Comte's doctrine that speculation or thought is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the chief factor and prime mover in social change. For Fouill<e9>e the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idea is always a force; and it is, in this connection, the supreme
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: force. The history of action can only be understood, he asserts, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relation to the history of ideas. This is the central gospel of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _<e9>volutionnisme des id<e9>es-forces_. The mental or spiritual is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important factor. This he opposes to the Marxian doctrine of economic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinism. Will is, he claims a greater reality than brute forces,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in will lies the essence of the human spirit. It is a will,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, which is bound up with reason and self-consciousness, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is progressive in character.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Summing up his work, _Histoire g<e9>n<e9>rale de la Philosophie_, Fouill<e9>e
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: refers in his Conclusion to the idea of progress as having become the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dominant note in philosophy. He looks upon the history of philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as, in some measure, witness to this. Above the ebb and flow of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: varied systems and ideas which the ages have produced he sees an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advance accomplished in the direction to which humanity is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tending--perfect knowledge of itself or collective self-consciousness
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and perfect self- possession. This type of progress is not to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: equated with scientific progress. He points out that in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development of philosophy, which is that of human reflection itself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: two characteristics appear. The distinction of two kinds or aspects of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: truth is seen in philosophy; one section, dealing with logic,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychology, aesthetic and applied ethics, or sociology, approaches to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a scientific character of demonstrability, while the other section,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which constitutes philosophy in the strict sense of metaphysic, deals
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with ultimate questions not capable of proof but demanding a rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith. Obviously the same kind of progress cannot be found in each of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these sections. This must be realised when progress in knowledge is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spoken about. He suggests, as illustrative of progress even in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speculative realm, the fact that humanity is slowly purifying its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of God--a point for further notice in our last chapter.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: However much Fouill<e9>e is concerned with establishing; a case for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress in knowledge, it is clear that his main stress is on the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress in self-consciousness or that self- determination which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom. This freedom can only grow as man consciously realises it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself. It is an _id<e9>e-force_, and has against it all the forces of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fatalism and of egoism. For Fouill<e9>e quite explicitly connects his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of freedom with that of altruism. The real freedom and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: real progress are one, he claims, since they both are to be realised
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only in the increasing power of disinterestedness and love. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believes in the possibility of a free progress. Fatality is really
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: egoism, or produces it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e has a rather clear optimism, for he finds in the development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of real freedom a movement which will involve a moral and social union
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of mankind. The good- will is more truly human nature than egoism and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: selfishness. These vices, he maintains in his _Id<e9>e moderne du
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Droit_,_*_ are largely a product of unsatisfied physical wants. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal of the good-will is not a contradiction of human nature,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: because, he asserts, that nature desires and wills its good. More
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strikingly, he states that the human will tends ultimately not to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conflict but to co-operation as it becomes enlightened and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universalised. He disagrees with the pessimists and upholds a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comparatively cheerful view of human nature. Egoism is much less
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deeply rooted than sympathy, and therefore, he says, war and strife
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are transitory features of human development. One contrasts the views
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Taine and Renouvier with this, and feels that man's history has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been, as far as we know it, entirely of this "transitory" nature, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is long likely to be so.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _L'Id<e9>e moderne du Droit_, Livre IV.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e's optimism seems to be overdrawn mainly because of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of the _id<e9>e-force_. He exaggerates the response which human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature is likely to make to the ideal good. Even if it be lifted up,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is not likely to draw _all_ men to it. Yet Fouill<e9>e's social and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical doctrines stand entirely upon this foundation. They are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: valuable views, and Fouill<e9>e is never better than when he is exhorting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his fellows to act upon the ideas of freedom, of justice, of love and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brotherhood. He is right in his insistence upon humanity's power to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: create good- will, to develop a new order. For the good man, he says,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fatality and egoism are obstacles to be overcome Believing in freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in sympathy, he acts to others in a spirit of freedom and love. By
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his very belief in universal good-will among men, he assists largely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in creating it and realising it in the world._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Conclusion to _Libert<e9> et D<e9>terminisme_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: But did not Fouill<e9>e, one asks, overrate the number of good men (as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: good in his sense), or rather did he not exaggerate the capacities of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human nature to respond to the ideal which he presents? Much of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: confidence in moral and social progress finds its explanation here.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His step-son, Guyau, was not quite so optimistic, although he believed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in a progress towards "sociability" and he adopted many of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrines of the _philosphie des id<e9>es-forces_. He attacks cheerful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: optimism in his _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni Sanction_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: where he remarks_/-_ that an absolute theory of optimism is really
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an immoral theory, for it involves the negation of progress in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: strict and true sense. This is because, when it dominates the mind, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: produces a feeling of entire satisfaction and contentment with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existing reality, resulting in resignation and acceptance of, if not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an actual worship of, the _status quo_. In its utter obedience to all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "powers that be," the notions of right and of duty are dimmed, if not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lost. A definitely pessimistic view of the universe would, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: suggests, be in many respects better and more productive of good than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an outrageous optimism. Granting that it is a wretched state in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a man sees all things black, it is preferable, Guyau thinks, to that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in which all things appear rosy or blue.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Esquisse d'une Morale, p. 10.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau concludes his _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni Sanction_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by remarking: "We are, as it were, on the _Leviathan_, from which a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wave has torn the rudder and a blast of wind carried away the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mainmast. It is lost in the ocean as our earth is lost in space. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: floats thus at random, driven by the tempest, like a huge derelict,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: yet with men upon it, and yet it reaches port. Per-* haps our earth,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: perhaps humanity, will also reach that unknown end which they will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have created for themselves. No hand directs us; the rudder has long
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been broken, or rather it has never existed; we must make it: it is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: great task, and it is our task." This paragraph speaks for itself as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regards Guyau's attitude to the doctrine of an assured progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In his notable book _L'Irreligion de l'Avenir_, the importance of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which we shall note more fully when we deal with the religious problem
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in our last chapter, Guyau indicates the possibilities of general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellectual progress in the future. The demand of life itself for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fuller expression will involve the decay of cramping superstitions and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ecclesiastical dogmas. The aesthetic elements will be given a larger
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: place, and there will be intellectual freedom. Keen as Guyau is upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintaining the sociological standpoint, he sees the central factor in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress to be the mental. "Progress," he remarks,_*_ "is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: simply a sensible amelioration of life--it is also the achievement of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a better intellectual formulation of life, it is a triumph of logic.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To progress is to attain to a more complete consciousness of one's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self and of the world, and by that very fact to a more complete inner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consistency of one's theory of the world." Guyau follows his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stepfather in his view of "sociability" or _fraternit<e9>_ (to use the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: watchword of the Revolution) as the desirable end at which we should
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progressively aim-- a conclusion which is but the social application
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his central concept of Life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Introduction to _L'Irreligion de l'Avenir_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The next step in human progress must be in the direction of human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solidarity. Guyau thinks it will arise from collective, co-operative
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: energy (_synergie sociale_). Further progress must involve
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: simultaneously _sympathie sociale_, a community of fellowship or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comradeship, promoted by education of a true kind, not mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: instruction, but a proper development and valuation of the feelings.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Here art will play its part and have its place beside science, ethics
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and philosophy in furthering the ideal harmony in human society. Such
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Progress involves, therefore, that the Beautiful must be sought and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appreciated no less than the True and the Good, for it is a revelation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the larger Life of which we ourselves are part. These ideals are in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves but manifestations of the Supreme Vitality.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The same spontaneous vital activity of which Guyau makes a central
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine characterises Bergson's view of reality. He upholds, like
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux, freedom and contingency, but he will not admit finalism in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any shape or form, not even a teleology which is created in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: process of development. He refuses to admit as true of the universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: process in nature and in human history what is certainly true of human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life--the fact that we create ends as we go on living. For Bergson
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is no end in the universe, unless it be that of spontaneity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life such as Guyau had maintained. There is no guarantee of progress,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no law of development, but endless possibility of progress. Such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view, as we have already insisted, is not pessimistic. It is, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a warning to facile optimism to realise that humanity, being free, may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: go "dead wrong." While Boutroux maintains with Ravaisson that there is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: at the heart of things a tendency to superior values such as beauty,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness and truth, and while Renan assures us that the balance of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness in the world is a guarantee of its ultimate triumph, Bergson,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: like Renouvier, gives us stern warning that there is no guarantee in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the nature of things that humanity should not set its heart on other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: values, on materialistic and egoistic conceptions, and go down in ruin
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quarrelling and fighting for these things. There is no power, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reminds us, keeping humanity right and in the line of desirable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. All is change, but that is not to say that all changes are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: desirable or progressive. Here we arrive at a point far removed from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the rosy optimism of the earlier thinkers. Progress as a comfortable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine, confidently accepted and dogmatically asserted, no longer
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: holds ground; it is seen to be quite untenable.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In Bergson the difficulty which besets Ravaisson reappears more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: markedly--namely, the relation of spirit and matter to one another,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and to the power at the heart of things, which, according to Bergson
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself, is a spiritual principle. Here we seem forced to admit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson's view of a "fall" or, as the theologians would say, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Kenosis" of the deity in order to create the material universe. Yet
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the processes of nature we see spirit having to fight against
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matter, and of this warfare Bergson makes a great point. These
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considerations lead to discussions which Bergson has not touched upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as yet. He does not follow Ravaisson and Boutroux into the realm of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theological ideas. If he did he might have to make admissions which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: would compromise, or at least modify, other doctrines expressed by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him. He will have none of Hegel or of the Absolute Idealism which sees
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the world process as a development of a Divine Idea. It is new and it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is creation; there is no repetition. Even God himself _se fait_ in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: process, and it may be, suggests Bergson, that love is the secret of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the universe. If so we may well ask with Blondel, "If God _se fait_ in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the process, then does he not already exist and, in a sense, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: process with him?" Instead, however, of reverting to Ravaisson's view
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the whole affair being a search for, and return to God, Bergson
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims that the development is a purely contingent one, in which a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: super-consciousness develops by experiment and error.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson's God, if he may be so-called, is not so much a Creator, but a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: power creative of creators--that is, human personalities capable of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free action. The Deity is immanent in man, and, like man, is ignorant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the trend of the whole process. The universe, according to Bergson,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is a very haphazard affair, in which the only permanence is change.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: There is no goal, and progress has little meaning if it be only and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely further change, which may be equally regress rather than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progress. To live is not merely to change, but to triumph over change
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to set up some values as of absolute worth, and to aim at realising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and furthering these. Apart from some philosophy of values the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of progress has little meaning.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Interesting discussions of various aspects of the problem are to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: found in the writings of the sociologist we have mentioned, Durkheim,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: particularly _La Division du Travail sociale_, _Le Suicide_ and _Les
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Formes <e9>l<e9>mentaires de la Vie religieuse_. There is an interesting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: volume by Weber, entitled _Le Rythme du Progres_, and there are the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: numerous books of Dr. Gustave Le Bon.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Although he is not strictly a philosopher in the academic or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: professional sense, and his work belongs to literature rather than to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the philosophy of the period, we cannot help calling attention briefly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here, at the conclusion of this chapter, to the genial pessimism of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson's great literary contemporary, Anatole France, the famous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: satirist of our age. His irony on questions like that of progress is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: very marked in _L'Ile des Penguins_ and in _J<e9>r<f4>me Coignard_. A remark
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from one of his works, this latter, will sufficiently illustrate his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view on progress. "I take little interest," remarks his character, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Abb<e9> Coignard, "in what is done in the King's Cabinet, for I notice
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the course of life is in no way changed, and after reforms men
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are as before, selfish, avaricious, cowardly, cruel, stupid and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: furious by turns, and there is always a nearly even number of births,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: marriages, cuckolds and gallows-birds, in which is made manifest the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beautiful ordering of our society. This condition is stable, sir, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nothing could shake it, for it is founded on human misery and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imbecility, and those are foundations which will never be wanting."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The genial old Abb<e9> then goes on to remind socialist revolutionaries
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that new economic schemes will not radically change human nature. We
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: easily see the ills in history and blind ourselves with optimism for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the future. Even in Sorel, the Syndicalist, who has added to his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: articles on _Violence_ (which appeared in 1907 in the periodical _Le
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Mouvement socialiste_) a work on _Les Illusions du Progr<e8>s_, we find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the same doctrines about the vices of modern societies, which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considers no better than ancient ones in their morality; they are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: filled with more hypocrisy, that is all. France and Sorel only add
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more testimony to the utter collapse of the old doctrine of assured
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and general progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To such a final position do we come in following out the development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the idea of progress. The early assurance and dogmatic confidence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which marked the early years of the century are followed by a complete
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abandonment of the idea of a guaranteed or assured progress, whether
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: based on the operations of a Divine Providence, or on faith in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimate triumph of reason, or on merely a fatalistic determinism.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Progress is only a possibility, and its realisation depends on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 'humanity's own actions. Further, any mention of progress in future
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must not only present it as quite contingent, but we have to reckon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the fact that the idea of progress may itself progress until it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: resolves itself into another conception less complicated and less
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: paradoxical, such as "the attainment of a new equilibrium." Some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: effort must be devoted also to a valuation of criteria. Various values
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have in the past been confused together, scientific, materialistic,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hedonistic, moral, aesthetic. Ultimately it seems that we shall find
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: difficulty in settling this apart from the solution offered by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier--namely, that true progress is not merely intellectual, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral. It involves not merely a conquest of material nature but of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human nature--a self- mastery. Progress is to be measured not by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: achievements of any aristocracy, intellectual or other, but by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general social status, and our criterion of progress must be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimately that of social justice. This itself is a term needing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interpretation, and to this question of ethics we now turn.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: CHAPTER VI
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ETHICS
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: MORAL philosophy is probably the most difficult branch of those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: various disciplines of the human spirit summed up in the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of philosophy. This difficulty is one which all the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinkers of our period recognised. Many of them, occupied with other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problems on the psychological or metaphysical side, did not write
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: explicitly upon ethics. Yet the problem of ethics, its place,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: significance and authority, is but the other side of that problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom which has appeared throughout this development as central and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vital. The ethical consciousness of man has never been content for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: long with the assertion that ethics is a purely positive science,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: although it has obviously a positive side. The essence of morality has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been regarded as not merely a description of what exists, but what
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might, should or ought to exist. Ethics is normative, it erects or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavours to outline a standard which is an ideal standard. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the characteristic of ethics, and so long as the moral conscience of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity, individually and collectively, does not slumber nor die, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will remain so. This conflict between the ideal and the real, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positive and normative is indeed the chief source of pain and conflict
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to man, but without it he would cease to be human.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Whatever the difficulties, the philosopher who aspires to look upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human life as a whole must give _some_ interpretation of this vital
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: aspect of human consciousness. It is in this connection that a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solution of the problem of freedom is so valuable, for under a purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: determinist and positivist reading of life, the moral sentiments
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: become mere data for an anthropological survey, the hope and tragedy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of human life are replaced, comfortably perhaps for some, by an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interpretation in which the true significance of ethics is lost.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: One of the outstanding features of the discussion upon ethics in our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: period is the fact that the social standpoint colours most of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion. This was largely due to the impulse given by Comte and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continued by the sociologists. We have already remarked the importance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which he attached to his new science of society or "sociology."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: However much the development of this branch of study may have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disappointed the hopes of Comte, it has laid a powerful and necessary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: emphasis upon the solidarity of the problems of society. As Comte
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claimed that psychology could not be profitably studied in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: isolated individual alone, so he insisted that ethics could only be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: studied with profit from a social standpoint. This was not forgotten
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by subsequent thinkers, even by those who were not his followers, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the main development of the ethical problem in our period is marked by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an increasing insistence upon sociability and solidarity. Comte was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: able to turn the thoughts of philosophers away from pre-occupation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the isolated individual, conceived as a cold and calculating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellectual machine, a "fiction" which had engrossed the minds of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinkers of the previous century. He was able also to indicate the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: enormous part played by instincts, particularly "herd-instincts," by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: passion and feelings of social hatred and social sympathy. It was the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extension of social sympathy upon which Comte insisted as the chief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: good. The great defect of Christianity from an ethical standpoint was,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte pointed out, due to its individualistic ethic. To the doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of "saving one's own soul" Comte opposed that of the salvation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity. The social unit is not the individual man or woman, it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the family. In that society which is not a mere association but a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: union, arising from common interests and sympathy, the individual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realises himself as part of society. The highest ethical conception,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, arises when the individual, transcending himself and his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: family, feels and acts as a member of humanity itself, not only in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: public, but also in his private life. In the idea of humanity Comte
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finds the concrete form of that universal which in the ethic of Kant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was the symbol of duty itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was by this insistence on human social solidarity that Comte left
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his mark upon the ethical problem. Many of the details of social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethics given in the last three large volumes of his work are extremely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thoughtful and interesting, in spite of their excessive optimism, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we can only here indicate what is sufficient for our purpose, his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence over subsequent thought. That is summed up in the words
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "solidarity" and "social standpoint."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We may observe that the supreme problems in social ethics Comte
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarded as being those of education or mental development and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "right to work."_*_ He foresaw, as did Renan, that Culture and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Economic Justice were the two _foci_ around which the ethical problems
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: were to be ranged in the immediate future. He regretted that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proletariat in their cry for justice had not sufficient culture to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: observe that they themselves are not a class apart, however
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: class-conscious they be. They stand solid with the community, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Comte prophesied that, finding this out sooner or later, they would
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have to realise the folly of violent revolution. Only a positive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: culture or education of the democracy could, he believed, solve this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social problem, which is there precisely because the proletariat are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not sufficiently, and do not feel themselves to be, incorporated in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the life of the community or of humanity. Only when they realise this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will work be ennobled by a feeling of service. The Church has a moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advantage here, in that she has her organisation complete for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: furthering the conception of service to God. Comte realised this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advantage of religious morality, but he thought it would come also to
