title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "positive" morality when men came to a conception of service for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity To this great end, he urged, our education should be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: directed, and it should aim, he thought, at the decline and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elimination of militarism which, in Comte's view corresponds to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: second stage of development (marked also by theology), a stage to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: superseded in man's development, by an era in which the war-spirit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will be replaced by that of productive service performed not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _pour la patrie_, but _pour l'humanit<e9>_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Comte criticised the teaching given to the young in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: France as being "instruction" rather than "education." This has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: frequently been insisted upon since his time.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In viewing the general influences which bore upon the study of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical problem in our period this stress upon the social character of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality is supreme, and is the most distinctly marked. But in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: addition to the sociological influence there are others which it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: both interesting and important to note briefly. There is the influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of traditional religious morality, bound up with Christianity as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presented by the Roman Catholic Church. The deficiencies of this are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: frequently brought out in the discussion, but in certain of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinkers, chiefly the "modernists," it appears as an influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contributing to a religious morality and as offering, indeed, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: basis of a religion. Other writers, however, while rejecting the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: traditional morality of the Church, lay stress upon a humanitarian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethic which has an affinity to the idealistic morality preached by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: founder of Christianity, a morality which manifests a spirit different
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from that which his Church has usually shown. Indeed, the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tendency of the ethical development in our period is one of opposition
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the ecclesiastical and traditional standpoint in ethics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Then there is the influence of Kant's ethics, and here again, although
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier owed much to Kant, the general tendency is to get away from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the formalism and rigorism of his "categorical imperative." The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: current of English Utilitarian ethics appears as rather a negative
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence, and is rather scorned when mentioned. The common feature is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that of the social standpoint, issuing in conceptions of social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justice or humanitarianism and finding in action and life a concrete
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality which is but the reflection of the living conscience of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mankind creating itself and finding in the claims of the practical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason that Absolute or Ideal to which the pure reason feels it cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alone attain.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Taine and Renan were influenced by the outlook adopted by Comte. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might well be said that Taine was more strictly positivist than Comte.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In his view of ethics, Taine, as might be expected from the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: character of his work and his philosophical attitude, adheres to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rigidly positivist and naturalist conception. He looks upon ethics as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely positive, since it merely states the scientific conditions of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtue and vice, and he despairs of altering human nature or conduct.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is due almost entirely to his doctrine of rigid determinism which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reacts with disastrous consequences upon his ethical outlook. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only further confirms our contention that the problem of freedom is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the central and vital one of the period. We have already pointed out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the criticism which Fouill<e9>e brought against Taine's dogmatic belief
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in determinism, as an incomplete doctrine, a half-truth, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves mischievous consequences and permits of no valuable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of the ethical problem.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: More interesting and useful, if we are to follow at all closely the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical thought of our period, is it to observe the attitude adopted
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to ethics by Taine's contemporary, Renan.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The extreme confidence which Renan professed to have in "science," and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed in all intellectual pursuits, led him to accord to morality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather a secondary place. "There are three great things," he remarks
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in his _Discours et Conf<e9>rences_,_*_ "goodness, beauty and truth,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the greatest of these is truth." Neither virtue, he con-* tinues,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nor art is able to exclude illusions. Truth is the representation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reality, and in this world the search for truth is the most serious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: occupation of all. One of his main charges against the Christian
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Church in general is that it has insisted upon moral good to such an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extent as to undervalue and depreciate the other goods, expressed in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beauty and in truth. It has looked upon life from one point of view
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only--namely, the moral--and has judged all action by ethical values
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alone, despising in this way philosophy, science, literature, poetry,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: painting and music. In its more ascetic moods it has claimed that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these things are "of the devil." Thus Christianity has introduced a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vicious distinction which has done much to mutilate human nature and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to cramp the wholesome expression of the life of the human spirit.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Whatever is an expression of spirit is, claims Renan, to be looked
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon as sacred. If such a distinction as that of sacred and profane
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: were to be drawn it should be between what appertains to the soul and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what does not. The distinction, when made between the ethical and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beautiful or true, is disastrous.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Discours, dated November 26th, 1885.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan considers that of the two, the ethical and the beautiful, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: latter may be the finer and grander distinction, the former merely a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: species of it. The moral, he thinks, will give place to the beautiful.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Before any action," he himself says in _L'Avenir de la Science_, "I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prefer to ask myself, not whether it be good or bad, but whether it be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beautiful or ugly, and I feel that I have in this an excellent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: criterion."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Morality, he further insists, has been conceived up to now in far too
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rigid a manner as obedience to a law, as a warfare and strife between
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: opposing laws. But the really virtuous man is an artist who is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creating beauty, the beauty of character, and is fashioning it out of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his human nature, as the sculptor fashions a statue out of marble or a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: musician composes a melody from sounds. Neither the sculptor nor the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: musician feels that he is obeying a law. He is expressing and creating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beauty.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Another criticism which Renan brings against the ethic of Christianity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is its insistence upon humility as a virtue. He sees nothing virtuous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in it as it is generally interpreted: quite rightly he suspects it of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypocritically covering a gross pride, after the manner of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Pharisees. He gives a place to honest asceticism which has its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nobility, even although it be a narrow, misconceived ideal. Much
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nobler is it, he thinks, than the type of life which has only one
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: object, getting a fortune.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This leads him to another remark on the moral hypocrisy of so many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: professedly religious folk. Having an easy substance and possessing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: already a decent share of this world's goods, they devote all their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: energies to the pursuit of pleasure or of further superfluous wealth.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: From this position they criticise the worker who endeavours to improve
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his lot, and have the audacity to tell him in pious fashion that he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must not be materialistic, and must not set his heart on this world's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goods. It would be laughable were it not so tragic. The whole question
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the relativity of the two positions is overlooked, the whole ethic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the business ignored. Material welfare is good and valuable, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan, in so far as it frees man's spirit from mean and wretched
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dependence and a cramped life which injures development, physical and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritual. These goods are a means to an end. When, therefore, a man,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: already comfortably endowed, amasses more and more for its own sake,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he commits both a profane and immoral act. But when a worker
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavours to augment his recompense for his labour, he is but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demanding "what is the condition of his redemption. He is performing a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtuous action."_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote * : L'Avenir de la Science, p. 83.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Sound as many of these considerations undoubtedly are, they come from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Renan, who wrote in the years 1848-9 L'Avenir de la Science. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lived long enough to see that these truths had complements, that there
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might be, even ethically, another side. In speaking of Progress this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: has been noted: in his later years he forecasted the coming of an era
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of egoism, of national and industrial selfishness, working itself out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in policies of military imperialism among the nations, and of economic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: greed and tyranny among the proletariat. His remarks about the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtuous action of the worker bettering his lot were inspired by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: socialism of Saint-Simon. Renan did not at that time raise in his own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mind the question of the workers themselves carrying their reaction so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: far, that it, although just at first, might reach a point where it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: became a dictatorship decreed by self-interest alone. It is in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: as Renan felt it, his solution was that which he suggested for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: education. He looked upon wickedness as a symptom of a lack of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: culture, particularly the lack of any moral teaching.

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: plan for state education of a compulsory, gratuitous and secular
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: character was carried in 1882, largely through the efforts of Jules

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

text: II
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The great moralist of our period was Renouvier. Not only, as we have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: already seen, did ethical considerations mark and colour his whole
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought, but he set forth those considerations themselves with a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarkable power. His treatise in two volumes on _The Science of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ethics_ is one of the most noteworthy contributions to ethical thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which has been made in modern times. Although half a century has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elapsed since its publication on the eve of the Franco-Prussian War,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its intense pre-occupation with the problems which beset our modern
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: industrial civilisation, its profound judgments and discussions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concerning subjects so vital to the world of to-day (such as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relations of the sexes, marriage, sex-ethics, civil liberty, property,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: communism, state intervention, socialist ideals, nationalism, war, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: modern idea of the State, and international law), give to it a value,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which very few works upon the subject possess. Long as the work is, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: has the merit of thoroughness, and difficulties are not slurred over,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but stated frankly, and some endeavours are made to overcome them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Consequently, it is a work which amply repays careful study. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: almost presumption to attempt in a few pages to summarise Renouvier's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important treatise. Some estimate of its significance is, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vital to our history.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The title itself is noteworthy and must at that date have appeared
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more striking than it does to us now by its claim that there is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _science_ of ethics._*_ We are accustomed to regard physics,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mathematics and even logic as entitled to the name Sciences. Can we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: legitimately speak of a Science of Ethics?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: It is interesting for comparative study to note that Leslie
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Stephen's _Science of Ethics_ was a much later production than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's treatise, appearing thirteen years later.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier insists that we can. Morality deals with facts, although
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they are not embraced by the categories of number, extension, duration
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or becoming (as mathematical and physical data), but rather by those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of causality, finality and consciousness. The facts "are not the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: natural being of things, but the _devoir-<ea>tre_ of the human will, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _devoir-faire_ of persons, and the devoir-<ea>tre of things in so far as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they depend upon persons."_*_ Personal effort, initiative and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: responsibility lie at the basis of all ethics. Morality is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: construction, like every science, partly individual and partly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: collective; it must lay down postulates, and if it is to justify the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claim to be a science, these postulates must be such as to command a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _consensus gentium_. Further, if ethics is to be scientifically based
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it must be independent. In the past this has unfortunately not been
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the case, for history shows us ethics bound up with some system of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion or metaphysics. If ethics is to be established as a science,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier points out that it must be free from all hypothesis of an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: irrelevant character, such as cosmological speculations and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theological dogmas. Renouvier's insistence upon the independence of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethics was followed up in an even clearer and more trenchant manner by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau in his famous _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Sanction_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 10.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Although, generally, ethics has suffered by reason of its alliance to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theological and metaphysical systems, Renouvier affirms that, in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: connection, there is one philosophy which is not open to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: objection--namely, the Critical Philosophy of Kant. This is because it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: subordinates all the unknown to phenomena, all phenomena to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness, and, within the sphere of consciousness itself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: subordinates the speculative reason (_reinen Vernunft_) to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical reason (_praktischen Vernunft_). Its chief value, according
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to Renouvier, lies precisely in this maintenance of the primacy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral considerations.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Two standpoints or lines of thought which are characteristic of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier, and whose presence we have already noted in our first
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chapter, operate also in his ethics and govern his whole treatment of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the nature of morality and the problems of the moral life. Briefly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stated these are, firstly, his regard for the Critical Philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kant; secondly, his view of man as "an order, a harmony of functions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reciprocally conditioned, and, by this fact, inseparable."_*_ As in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his treatment of Certitude, Renouvier showed this to be a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychological complex into which entered elements not only of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cognition, but of feeling and will, the same insistence upon this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unity of human nature meets us again in his ethics. "Any ethical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine which definitely splits up the elements of human nature is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: erroneous."_/-_ Abstraction is necessary and useful for any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science, even the science of ethics, but however far we may carry our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific analysis, we must never lose sight of the fact that we are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dealing with abstractions. To lose sight of the relationship of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: data under observation or discussion is, indeed, working away from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goal of scientific knowledge.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_ (first edition, 1869), vol. I,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Nothing," remarks Renouvier in this connection, "has done more to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hinder the spread of Kant's doctrines in the world than his assertion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the morally good act must be performed absolutely without
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: feeling." In view of man as he is, and in so far as we understand
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human nature at all, it seems a vain and foolish statement. For Kant,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Duty was supreme, and the sole criterion of a good act was, for him,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its being done from a consciousness of Duty. He himself had to confess
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that he did not know of any act which quite fulfilled this ideal of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral action. With this view of morality Renouvier so heartily
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disagrees that he is inclined to think that, so far from a purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational act (if we suppose such an act possible) being praiseworthy,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he would almost give greater moral worth to an act purely emotional,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whose "motive" lay, not in the idea of cold and stern Duty, but in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: warm impulses of the human heart, springing from emotion or feeling
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alone. Emotion is a part of our nature--it has its role to play; the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational element enters as a guide or controlling power. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: desirable that all acts should be so guided, but that is far from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stating, as does Kant, that they should proceed solely from rational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considerations. Ultimately reason and sentiment unite in furthering
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the same ends. No adequate conception of justice can be arrived at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is not accompanied by, and determined by, correlatively, love of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity. Kant rigorously excluded from operation even the most noble
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: feelings, whose intrusion should dim the worth and glory of his moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: act, devoid of feeling. But "without good-will and mutual sympathy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persons, no society could ever have established itself beyond the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: family, and scarcely the family itself."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 184.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier confesses that in most of this treatment of the problem of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethics he follows Kant,_/-_ and although his admiration for Kant's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work is not concealed, nevertheless he is not altogether satisfied
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with it, and does not refrain from criticism. Indeed this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reconstruction of the Critical Philosophy in a revised version is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: main effort of the neo-critical philosopher, and it is constantly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manifest.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : On p. 108 (vol. I) he refers to "_le philosophie que
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: je suis, et que j'aimerais de pouvoir suivre toujours_."]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He complains that Kant did not adhere rigorously to his own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: principles, but vainly strove to give an objectivity to the laws of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the practical reason by connecting them to metaphysics. But, he says,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "on the other hand I maintain that the errors of Kant can be corrected
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in accordance with the actual principles of his own philosophy. I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continue my serious attachment to this great reformer in spite of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: very serious modifications I am endeavouring to make in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work."_/=_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. no. 110]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the opinion of Renouvier, Kant's work, the _Metaphysic of Morals_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is marred by its neglect of history in its relation to ethics, by a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disfigured picture of right which does not make it any more applicable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to existing human conditions, also by the rather artificial and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complicated nature of its doctrines. He further reproaches Kant for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: excessive rigorism and formalism, accompanied by a vagueness which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prevents the application of much of his teaching. This, it seems to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us, is a reproach which can be hurled easily at most of the ethical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teachers whom the world has seen. The incessant vagueness of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: paradoxical elements in the utterances of such teachers has inevitably
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: compelled their disciples to find refuge in insisting upon a "right
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit" of action, being devoid of any clear teaching as to what might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constitute right action in any particular case.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The rudiments of morality, according to Renouvier, are found in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: general notion of "obligation," the sense of ought (_devoir-faire_)
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which the human consciousness cannot escape. Any end of action is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conceived as a good for the agent himself; and because of liberty of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: choice between actions or ends, or between both, certain of these are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deemed morally preferable. There are certain obligations which are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely personal, elementary virtues demanded from any rational being.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is his interest to preserve his body by abstaining from excesses;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is his interest also to conserve and develop the faculties of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature. This is the point upon which Guyau makes such insistence in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: common with Nietzsche--the development, expansion and intensification
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of life. There are, Renouvier points out, duties towards oneself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involving constant watchfulness and intelligence, so that the agent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may be truly self-possessed under all circumstances, maintaining an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: empire over himself and not falling a constant victim to passion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Greater is he that ruleth himself than he that taketh a city," are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not vain words. This is the rudimentary but essential virtue which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier calls "virtue militant"--moral courage. Intellectually it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: issues in Prudence or Wisdom; on the side of sense and passion it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: represented by Temperance. These duties are present to conscience,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which itself arises from a doubling of consciousness. "We have the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: empirical person with his experience of the past, and we have the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal person--that is to say, that which we wish to be,"_*_ our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal character. In so far as we are conscientious we endeavour to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bring "what we are" into line with "what we conceive we should be."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The moral agent thus has duties towards himself, obligations apart
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from any relation to or with others of his kind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 25.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This elementary morality is "essentially subjective,"_*_ but this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only shows us that the most thorough-going individualism does not by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its neglect of others, its denial of altruism, thereby escape entirely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from moral obligations. There are always duties to one's higher self,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even for a Robinson Crusoe. Frequently it is stated that duties and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rights are co-relative; but Renouvier regards Duty as more fundamental
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than Right, which he uses only of man in association with his fellows.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Between persons, right and duty are in a synthesis, but the person
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself has no rights as distinct from duties to himself; he has no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: right not to do what it is his duty to perform. From this it follows
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that if his personal notion of obligation changes, he has no right
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whatever to carry out actions in accordance with his judgments made
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prior to his change of conscience, merely for the sake of consistency.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He is in this respect a law to him- self, for no man can act as a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience for another. The notion of rights only arises when others
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are in question, and only too often the word has been abused by being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: employed where simply power is meant, as, for example, in many views
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of "natural right." This procedure both sullies the usage of the term
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Right and lowers the status of personality. It is always, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: claims, to "the inherent worth and force of personality, with its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: powers of reflection, deliberation, liberty, self-possession and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self-direction, that one must return in order to understand each and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: every virtue."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote: _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 81.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's insistence upon the inherent worth, the dignity and moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: value of personality becomes clearer as he proceeds from his treatment
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the lonely individual (who, it may be objected, is to such an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extent an abstraction, as to resemble a fiction) to associated
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persons. The reciprocal relation of two persons brings out the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essential meaning of Justice. Two personalities co-operating for a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: common end find themselves each possessed of duties and, inversely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: therefore, of rights which are simply duties regarded from the point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of view not of the agent, but of the other party. The neo-critical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethic here brings itself definitely into line with the principle of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical reason of the Critical Philosophy. This, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier,_*_ is the profound meaning of Justice, which consists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the fact that the moral agent, instead of subordinating the ends of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other people to his own, considers the personalities_/-_ of others
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as similar to his own and possessing their own ends which he must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respect. This principle is that which Kant formulated under the name
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of "practical obligation" or "supreme principle."_/=_ "Recognise
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the personality of others as equal in nature and dignity, as being an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: end in itself, and consequently refrain from employing the personality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of others merely as a means to achieve your own ends."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, pp. 82-83.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Personality is a better translation, as it avoids the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather legal and technical meaning of "person" in English.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : In a footnote to this passage, Renouvier states his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own preference for "moral obligation" rather than "imperative of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience."]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This doctrine of Personalism is an assertion not only of _Libert<e9>_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Egalit<e9>_, _Fraternit<e9>_ as necessary and fundamental principles, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: also of the value of personality in general and the relativity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "things." It constitutes an ethical challenge to the existing state of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society which is not only inclined, in its headlong pursuit of wealth,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its fanatical worship of Mammon, to treat its workers as purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "means" to the attainment of its end, but further minimises
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality by its legal codes and social conventions, which both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operate far more readily and efficiently in the defence of property
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than in the defence or protection of personality. From the ethical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: standpoint the world is a realm of ends or persons and all other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: values must be adjusted in relation to these.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We have been told by religious ethical teachers that we must love our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neighbour as ourself, and have been reminded by moralists continually
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the conflict between Egoism and Altruism. Renouvier points out that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimately obligation towards others is reducible to a duty to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: oneself. He does not do this from the point of view of Hobbes, who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarded all actions, however altruistic they appeared to be, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: founded purely upon self-interest, but rather from the opposite
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: standpoint. "We should make our duty to others rank foremost among our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: duties to ourselves."_*_ This is the transcendent duty through the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: performance of which we achieve a realisation of the solidarity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persons, demonstrate an objective value for our own existence, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gain a fuller and richer life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 85.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The idea of personal and moral reciprocity was formulated by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Chinese and the Greeks; at a later date it reappeared in the teaching
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Jesus. This ancient and almost universal maxim has been stated both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positively and negatively: "Do not to others what you would not have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them do unto you," "Do as you would be done by." The maxim itself,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, beyond a statement of the principle of reciprocity rather
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vaguely put, has no great value for the science of ethics. Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regards it not as a principle of morality but a rule-of-thumb, and he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considers the negative statement of it to be more in harmony with what
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was intended by the early ethical teachers--namely, to give a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical warning against the committing of evil actions rather than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to establish a scientific principle of right action.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier has shown the origin of the notion of Justice as arising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: primarily from an association of two persons. "Reason established a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kind of community and moral solidarity in this reciprocity."_/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This right and duty unite to constitute Justice. It is truly said that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is just to fulfil one's duty, just to demand one's right, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Justice is formed by a union of these two in such a manner that they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: always complement one another. Bearing in mind the doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality as an end, we get a general law of action which may be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stated in these terms: "Always act in such a way that the maxim
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: applicable to your act can be erected by your conscience into a law
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: common to you and your associate." Now to apply this to an association
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of any number of persons-- _e g._, human society as a whole--we need
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only generalise it and state it in these terms: "Act always in such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: way that the maxim of your conduct can be erected by your conscience
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: into a universal law or formulated in an article of legislation which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: you can look upon as expressing the will of every rational being."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This "categorical obligation" is the basis of ethics. It stands clear
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of hypothetical cases as a general law of action, and "there is no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such thing really as practical morality," remarks Renouvier, "except
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by voluntary obedience to a law."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_., pp. 79-80.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 100.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The fulfilment of our duties to ourselves generally tends to fit us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for fulfilling our duties to others, and the neglect of the former
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will lead inevitably to inability to perform these latter. Our duty to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: others thus involves our duty to ourselves._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : The notion of self-sacrifice itself involves also, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a degree, the maintenance of self, without which there could be no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self to sacrifice. History has frequently given examples of men of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: types refusing to sacrifice their lives for a certain cause because
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they wished to preserve them for some other (and possibly better--in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their minds at any rate, better) form of self-sacrifice.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Personality which lies at the root of the moral problem demands Truth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Liberty, and it has a right to these two, for without them it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: injured. They are essential to a society of persons. Another vital
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: element in society is Work, the neglect of which is a grave immoral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: act, for as there is in any society a certain amount of necessary work
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be performed, a "slacker" dumps his share upon his fellows to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: perform in addition to their own share. With industrial or general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander
