text: laziness, and the parasitism of those whose riches enable them to live
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: without working, is to be condemned also the shirking of intellectual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work by all. Quite apart from those who are "intellectuals" as such, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solemn duty of work, of thought, reflection and reasoning lies on each
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: person in a society. Apathy among citizens is really a form of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: culpable negligence. The duty of work and thought is so vital and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such ethical, political and social importance that Renouvier suggests
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the two words, work and duty, be regarded as synonyms. It might,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he thinks, make clearer to many the obligation involved.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Justice has been made clear in the foregoing remarks, but in view of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kant's distinction of "large" and "strict" duties, Renouvier raises
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the question of the relation of Justice and Goodness. He concludes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that acts proceeding from the latter are to be distinguished from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Justice. They proceed not from considerations of persons as such, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from their "nature" or common humanity, and are near to being "duties
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to oneself." They are of the heart rather than of the head, proceeding
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from sentiments of humanity, and sentiment is not, strictly speaking,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the foundation of justice, which is based on the notions of duties and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rights. There can be, therefore, an opposition of Justice and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Goodness (Kindness or Love), and the sphere of the latter is often
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limited by considering the former. Renouvier recognises the fact that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Justice in the moral sense of recognition and respect for personality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is itself often "constitutionally and legally" violated in societies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by custom, laws and institutions as well as by members of society in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their actions, and he notes that this "legal" injustice makes the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem of the relation of Justice and Charity excessively difficult.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The science of ethics is faced with a double task owing to the nature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of man's evolution and history. Human societies have been built upon a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: basis which is not that of justice and right, but upon the basis of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: force and tyranny--in short, upon war. There is, therefore, for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moralist the twin duty of constructing laws and principles for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: true society founded upon an ethical basis, that is to say on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conceptions of Justice, while at the same time he must give practical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advice to his fellows living and striving in present society, where a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: continual state of war exists owing to the operation of force and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tyranny in place of justice, and he must so _apply_ his principles
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that they may be capable of moving this unjust existing society
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: progressively towards the ideal society.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In our account of Renouvier's "Philosophy of History" we brought out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his insistence upon war as the essential feature of man's life on this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: planet, as the basis of our present "civilisation." Here he proclaims
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it again in his ethics._*_ War reigns everywhere: it is around us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and within us--individuals, families, tribes, classes, nations and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: races. He includes in the term much more than open fighting with guns.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The distribution of wealth, of property (especially of land), wages,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: custom duties, diplomacy, fraud, violence, bigotry, orthodoxy, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persecution, lies themselves, are all, to him, forms of war. Its most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ludicrous stronghold is among men who pride themselves on being at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: peace with all men, while they force their idea of God upon other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: men's consciences. Religious intolerance is one, and a very absurd
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: kind of warfare._/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. I, p. 332.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Renouvier sums up its spirit in the words: "_Crois ce
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: que je crois moi, o<f9> je te tue_" (_La Nouvelle Monadologie_).]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The principle of justice confers upon the person a certain "right of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: defence" in the midst of all this existing varied warfare of mankind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It involves, according to Renouvier, resistance. The just man cannot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stand by and see the unjust man oppress his fellow so that the victim
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is "obliged to give up his waistcoat after having had his coat torn
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from him." Otherwise we must confuse the _just_ with the _saintly_ man
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who only admits one law--namely, that of sacrifice. But Renouvier will
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have us be clear as to the price involved in all this violent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: resistance. It means calling up powers of evil, emis-* *saries of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: injustice. He does not found his "right of defence" on rational right;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is to misconceive it so to found it. We must recognise the use of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: violence and force, even in self-defence, as in itself evil, an evil
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessitated by facts which do not conform to the rules of peace and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justice themselves. It is to a large degree necessary, unfortunately,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but is none the less evil and to be frankly regarded as evil, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: likely to multiply evil in the world, owing to the tremendous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solidarity of wickedness of which Renouvier has already spoken in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: history. It is the absence of the reign of justice which necessitates
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these conflicts, and we have to content ourselves with a conception of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: actual "right," a conception already based on war, not with one of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "rational right" or justice.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Right in the true sense, Renouvier insists, belongs to a state of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: peace; in a state of war, such as our civilisation is perpetually in,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it cannot be realised. The objection may be made that Renouvier is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: then justifying the means by the end. He emphatically denies this. By
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: no means is this the case, for "the evil," he remarks, "which corrects
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: another evil does not therefore become good; it may be useful, but it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is none the less evil, immoral, or unjust, and what is not just is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justifiable. Wars, rebellions, revolutions may lessen certain evils,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but they do not thereby cease to be any the less evils themselves.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Morally we are obliged to avoid all violence; a revolution is only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justified if its success gives an indication of its absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity. We must lament, from the standpoint of ethics or justice,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the evil state of affairs which gives rise to it._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : On this point, it is interesting to compare with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: above the views of Spinoza in his _Tractatus Theologico-politicus_ and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Tractatus-politicus_, and those of T. H. Green in his _Lectures on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Political Obligation_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier devotes a considerable portion of his treatise to problems
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of domestic morals, economic questions and problems of a political and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: international character. In all these discussions, however, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: maintains as central his thesis of the supremacy of personality.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Under _droit domestique_ he defends very warmly the right of the woman
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the wife to treatment as a personality. He laments particularly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the injustice which usually rules in marriage, where, under a cloak of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: legality, the married man denies to his wife a personal control of her
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own body and the freedom of self-determination in matters of sexual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intercourse. So unjust and loathsome in its violation of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality of woman is the modern view of marriage that Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considers it little better than polygamy (which is often a better
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: state for women than monogamy) or prostitution. It is less just than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: either, owing to its degradation of the personality of the wife. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarked too in his _Nouvelle Monadologie_ that love (in the popular
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense), being so largely an affair of passion and physical attraction,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is usually unjust, and that friendship is a better basis for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relationship of marriage, which should be, while it lasts among
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mankind, one of justice._*_ Consequently, it should involve
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neither the idea of possession nor of obedience, but of mutual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comradeship.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : See particularly the notes in _La Nouvelle Monadologie_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appended to the fourth part, "Passion," pp. 216-222.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the economic sphere Renouvier endeavours to uphold freedom, and for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this reason he is an enemy of communism. Hostile to the communistic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of property, he is a definite defender of property which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considers to be a necessity of personality. He considers each person
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the community entitled to property as a guarantee of his own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: liberty and development. While disagreeing with communism, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is sympathetic to the socialist view that property might be, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: should be, more justly distributed, and he advocates means to limit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: excessive possession by private persons and to "generalise" the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: distribution of the goods of the community among its members.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Progressive taxation, a guarantee of the "right to work" and a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complete system of insurance are among his suggestions. He is careful,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: however, to avoid giving to the state too much power.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier was no lover of the state. While regarding it as necessary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: under present conditions, he agrees with the anarchist idealists, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whom government is an evil. He admits its use, however, as a guarantor
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of personal liberty, but is against any semblance of state- worship.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The state is not a person, nor is it, as it exists at present, a moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: institution. One of the needs of modern times is, he points out, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moralising of the conception of the state, and of the state itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Although, therefore, he has no _a priori_ objection to state
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interference in the economic sphere, and would not advocate a mere
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _laissez-faire_ policy, with its vicious consequences, yet he does not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: look with approval upon such interference unless it be "the collective
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expression of the personalities forming the community."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The fact of living in a society, highly organised although it be, does
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not diminish at all the moral significance of personality. Rights and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: duties belong essentially to persons and to them only. We must beware
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the political philosophy which regards the citizens as existing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only for the state. Rather the state exists, or should exist, for the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: welfare of the citizens. In the past this was a grave defect of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: military despotisms, and was well illustrated by the view of the state
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: taken, or rather inculcated, by German political philosophy. In the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: future the danger of the violation of personality may lie, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinks, in another direction--namely, in the establishment of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Communistic states. The basic principle of his ethic is the person as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an end in himself, and the treatment of persons as ends. If this be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: so, a Communistic Republic which has as its motto "Each for all,"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: without also "All for each," may gravely violate personality and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral law if, by constraint, it treats all its citizens and their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: efforts not as ends in themselves, but merely means to the collective
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ends of all.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The moral ideal demands that personality must not be obliterated.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Personality bound up with "autonomy of reason" is the fundamental
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical fact._*_ In the last resort, responsibility rests upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals of the society for the evils of the system of social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: organisation under which they live. The state itself cannot be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarded as a moral person. Renouvier opposes strongly any doctrine
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which tends to the personalisation or the deification of the state.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Note that Renouvier prefers this term to Kant's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "autonomy of will," which he thinks confuses moral obligation and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free-will.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He combats also the modern doctrines of "nationality," and claims that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even the idea of the state is a higher one, for it at any rate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves co-operating personalities, while a nation is a fiction, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which no satisfactory definition can be given. He laughs at the "unity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of language, race, culture and religion," and asks where we can find a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nation?_/-_ War and death have long since destroyed such united
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and harmonious groups as were found in ancient times.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. 2, chap. xcvi, "_Id<e9>es
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de la Nationalit<e9> et d'Etat_," pp. 416-427.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In approaching the questions of international morality Renouvier makes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clear that there is only one morality, one code of justice. Morality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be divided against itself, and there cannot be an admission
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that things which are immoral in the individual are justifiable, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: permissible, between different states. Morality has not been applied
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to these relationships, which are governed by aggressive militarism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and diplomacy, the negation of all conceptions of justice. Ethical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obligation has only a meaning and significance for personalities, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our states do but reflect the morality of those who constitute them;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our world reflects the relationships and immorality of the states. War
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: characterises our whole civilisation, domestic, economic and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: international. To have inter- national peace, internal peace is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essential, and this pre- supposes the reign of justice within states.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: War we shall have with us, Renouvier reminds us, in all its forms, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our institutions, our laws and customs, until it has disappeared from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: our hearts. Treaties of "peace" and federations or leagues of nations
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are themselves based on injustice and on force, and in this he sees
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but another instance of the "terrible solidarity of evil."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Better it is to recognise this, thinks Renouvier, than to consider
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ourselves in, or even near, a Utopia, whence human greed and passion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have fled.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Science de la Morale_, vol. 2, p. 474.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We find in Renouvier's ethics a notable reversion to the individualism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which characterised the previous century. Much of the individualistic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tone of his work is, however, due to his finding himself in opposition
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the doctrines preached by communists, positivists, sociologists,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pessimistic and fatalistic historians, and supporters of the deified
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: state. Renouvier acclaims the freedom of the individual, but his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individualism is "personalism." In proclaiming that the basis of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justice and of all morality is respect for personality, as such, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: has no desire to set up a standard of selfish individualism; he wishes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only to combat those heretical doctrines which would minimise and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: crush personality. For him the moral "person" is not an isolated
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individual--he is a social human being, free and responsible, who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lives with his fellows in society. Only upon a recognition of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality as a supreme value can justice or peace ever be attained
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in human society; and it is to this end that all moral education,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier advocates, should tend. The moral ideal should be, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practice, the constant effort to free man from the terrible solidarity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of evil which characterises the civilisation into which he is born,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and to establish a community or association of personalities. Such an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal does not lie necessarily at the end of a determined evolution;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's views on history and progress have shown us that.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Consequently it depends upon us; it is our duty to believe in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pos-* sibility and to work, each according to his or her power, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its realisation. The ideal or the idea, will, in so far as it is set
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: before self-conscious personalities as an end, become a force.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier agrees on this point with Fouill<e9>e, to whose ethic, founded
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on the conception of _id<e9>es-forces_, we now turn.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: III
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The philosophy of _id<e9>e-forces_ propounded by Fouill<e9>e assumes, in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical aspect, a role of reconciliation (which is characteristic, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we have noted, of his whole method and his entire philosophy) by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempting a synthesis of individualism and humanitarianism. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: therefore another kind of _personnalisme_, differing in type from that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Renouvier. Fouill<e9>e's full statement of his ethical doctrines was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not written until the year 1907,_*_ but long before the conclusion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the nineteenth century he had already indicated the essential
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: points of his ethics. The conclusion of his thesis _La Libert<e9> et le
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: D<e9>terminisme_ (1872) is very largely filled with his ethical views and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with his optimism. Four years later appeared his study _L'Id<e9>e moderne
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: du Droit en Allemagne, en Angleterre et en France_, which was followed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in 1880 by _La Science sociale contemporaine_, where the relation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the study of ethics to that of sociology was discussed. A volume
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: containing much acute criticism of current ethical theories was his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Critique des Syst<e8>mes de Morale contemporains_ (1883), which gave him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a further opportunity of offering by way of contrast his application
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the doctrine of _id<e9>es-forces_ to the solution of moral problems.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: To this he added in the following year a study upon _La Propri<e9>t<e9>
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociale et la D<e9>mocratie_, where he discussed the ethical value and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: significance of various political and socialist doctrines. Ethical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: questions raised by the problems of education he discussed in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _L'Enseignement au Point de Vue national_ (1891). At the close of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: century he issued his book on morality in his own country, _La France
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: au Point de Vue morale_ (1900)._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : His _Morale des Id<e9>es-forces_ was then published.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : It is interesting to note the wealth of Fouill<e9>e's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: almost annual output on ethics alone in his later years. We may cite,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the twentieth century: _La R<e9>forme de l'Enseignement par la
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Philosophie_, 1901; _La Conception morale et critique de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: l'Enseignement_; _Nietzsche et l'Immoralisme_, 1904; _Le Moralisme de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kant et l'Amoralisme contemporaine_, 1905; _Les El<e9>ments sociologiques
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de la Morale_, 1905; _La Morale des Id<e9>es-forces_, 1907; _Le
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Socialisme_, 1910; _La D<e9>mocratie politique et sociale en France_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1910; and the posthumous volume, _Humanitaires et Libertaires au Point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de Vue sociologique et morale_, 1914.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e endeavours to unite the purely ideal aspect of ethics--that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is to say, its notion of what ought to be, with the more positive view
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of ethics as dealing with what now is. His ethic is, therefore, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attempt to relate more intimately the twin spheres of Renouvier,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _l'<e9>tat de guerre_ with _l'<e9>tat de paix_, for it is concerned not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with what _is_, but with that which _tends_ to be and which _can_ be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by the simple fact that it is _thought_. As, however, what _can_ be is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a matter of intense interest to us, we are inevitably led from this to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consider what _ought_ to be--that is to say, what is better, or of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more worth or value. The ethical application of the philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _id<e9>es-forces_ is at once theoretical and practical, that philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: being concerned both with ideas and values.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: As in his treatment of freedom we found Fouill<e9>e beginning with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _idea_ of freedom, so here in a parallel manner he lays down the _idea_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of an end of action as an incontestable fact of experience, although
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the existence of such an end is contested and is a separate question.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This idea operates in consciousness as a power of will (_volont<e9> de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience_). Intelligence, power, love and happiness-in short, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: highest conscious life--are involved in it, not only for us, but for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all. Thus it comes about that the conscious subject, just because he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: finds himself confronted by nature and by over-individual ends,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proposes to himself an ideal, and imposes at the same time upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself the obligation to act in conformity with this full
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness which is in all, as in him, and thus he allows universal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness to operate in his own individual life. Here we have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience, the idea of duty or obligation, accounted for, and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: principle of autonomy of the moral person laid down. The ethical life
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is shown as the conscious will in action, finding within itself its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own end and rule of action, finding also the conscious wills of others
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: like itself. Morality is the indefinite extension of the conscious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will which brings about the condition that others tend to become "me."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Through the increasing power of intellectual disinterestedness and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social sympathy, the old formula "_cogito, conscius sum_" gives place
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to that of "_conscii sumus_," and this is no mere intellectual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: speculation, but a concrete principle of action and feeling which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself akin to the highest and best in all religions.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: One of the features of this ethic is its insistence upon the primacy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of self-consciousness. Indeed, it has its central point in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrine of self-consciousness, which, according to Fouill<e9>e, implies
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the consciousness of others and of the whole unity of mankind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Emphasising his gospel of _id<e9>es-forces_, he outlines a morality in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which the ideal shall attract men persuasively, and not dominate them
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in what he regards as the arbitrary and rather despotic manner of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kant.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By advocating the primacy of self-consciousness Fouill<e9>e claims to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: establish an ethic which towers above those founded upon pleasure,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: happiness and feeling. The morality of the _id<e9>es-forces_ is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely sentimental, not purely intellectual, not purely voluntarist;
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it claims to rest on the totality of the functions of consciousness,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as revealed in the feelings, in intellect and will, acting in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solidarity and in harmony.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He endeavours to unite the positive and evolutionary views of morality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to those associated with theological or metaphysical doctrines,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concerning the deity or the morally perfect absolute. He claims,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: against the theologians and on behalf of the positivists, that ethics
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: can be an independent study, that it is not necessarily bound up with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: theological dogmas. There is no need to found the notion of duty upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that of the existence of God. Our own existence is sufficient; the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: voice of conscience is within our human nature. He objects, as did
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nietzsche, to the formality and rigour of Kant's "categorical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imperative." His method is free from the legalism of Kant, and in him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Guyau is seen an attempt to relate morality itself to life,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expanding and showing itself creative of ideals and tending to their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fulfilment.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: From the primacy of self-consciousness which can be expressed in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notion, _Je pense, donc j'ai une valeur morale_, a transition is made
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to a conception of values. _Je pense, donc j'evalue des objets_. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: essential element in the psychology of the _idees-forces_ then comes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: into play by tending to the realisation of the ideals conceived and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: based on the valuation previously made. Finally, Fouill<e9>e claims that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on this ethical operation of the _id<e9>es-forces_ can be founded the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notion of a universal society of consciences. This notion itself is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: force operating to create that society. The ideal is itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persuasive, and Fouillee's inherent optimism, which we have observed
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in his doctrine of progress, colours also his ethical theory. He has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith in men's capacity to be attracted by the ideals of love and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: brotherhood, and insists that in the extension of these lies the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supreme duty, and the ideal, like the notion of duty itself, is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: creation of our own thought. The realisation of the universality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: altruism, love and brotherhood of which he speaks, depends upon our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action, our power to foster ideas, to create ideals, particularly in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the minds of the young, and to strive ever for their realisation. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the great need of our time, Fouill<e9>e rightly urges._*_ Such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality contains in a more concentrated form, he thinks, the best
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that has been said and thought in the world-religions; it achieves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: also that union of the scientific spirit with the aspirations of man,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which Fouill<e9>e regards as so desirable, and he claims for it a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophical value by its success in uniting the subjective and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personal factors of consciousness with those which are objective and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : The work of Benjamin Kidd should be compared in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: connection, particularly his _Social Evolution_, 1894; _Principles of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Western Civilisation_, 1902; and _The Science of Power_, 1918 (chap,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: v., "The Emotion of the Ideal").]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Similar in several respects to the ethical doctrines of Fouill<e9>e are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: those of his step-son. Guyau insists more profoundly, however, upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the "free" conception of morality, as spontaneous and living, thus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: marking a further reaction from Kant's doctrine. Both Fouill<e9>e and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau interacted upon one another in their mental relationship, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: both of them (particularly Guyau) have affinities with Nietzsche, who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: knew their work. While the three thinkers are in revolt against the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Kantian conception of ethics, the two Frenchmen use their conceptions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to develop an ethic altruistic in character, far removed from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: egoism which characterises the German._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : We find the optimism and humanitarian idealism of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Frenchmen surprising. May not this be piecisely because the world has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: followed the gospel of Nietzsche? We may dislike him, but he is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: greater painter of the real state of world-morality than are the two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Frenchmen. They, with their watchword of _fraternit<e9>_, are proclaiming
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a more excellent way they are standing for an ethical ideal of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: highest type.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau, after showing in his critique of English Ethics (_La Morale
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: anglaise contemporaine_, 1879) the inadequacies of a purely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: utilitarian doctrine of morality, endeavoured to set forth in a more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constructive manner the principles of a scientific morality in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni Sanction_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He takes as his starting-point the position where John Stuart Mill
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fell foul of the word "desirable." What, asks Guyau, is the supreme
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: desire of every living creature? The answer to this question is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Life." What we all of us desire most and constantly is Life, the most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intensive and extensive in all its relationships, physical and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spiritual. In the principle of Life we find cause and end--a unity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is a synthesis of all desires and all desirables. Moreover, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concept or the principle of Life embraces all functions of our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature--those within consciousness and those which are subconscious or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unconscious. It thus relates intimately purely instinctive action and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reflective acts, both of which are manifestations of Life and can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: enrich and increase its power.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The purely hedonistic views of the Utilitarians he considers untrue.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Doubtless, he admits, there is a degree of truth in the doctrine that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness tends to pursue the line of greatest pleasure or least
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: resistance, but then we must remember how slight a part this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consciousness actually plays. Instincts and an intensive subconscious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "will-to-live" are constantly operating. A purely scientific ethic, if
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is to present a complete scheme, must allow for this by admitting
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that the purely hedonistic search after pleasure is not in itself a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cause of action, but is an effect of a more fundamental or dominating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: factor. This factor is precisely the effort of Life to maintain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself, to intensify itself and expand. The chief motive power lies in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the "intensity of Life." "The end which actually determines all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscious action is also the cause which produces every unconscious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action; it is Life itself, Life at once the most intense and the most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: varied in its forms. From the first thrill of the embryo in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mother's womb to the last convulsion of the old man, every movement of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the being has had as cause Life in its evolution; this universal cause
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of actions is, from another point of view, its constant effect and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Esquisse d'une Morale_, p. 87.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: A true ethic proceeding upon the recognition of these principles is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scientific, and constitutes a science having as its object all the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: means by which Life, material and spiritual, may be conserved and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expanded. Rising in the evolutionary development we find the variety
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and scope of action increased. The highest beings find rest not in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sleep merely, but in variety and change of action. The moral ideal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lies in activity, in all the variety of its manifestations. For Guyau,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as for Bergson, the worst vice is idleness, inertia, lack of _<e9>lan
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vital_, decay of personal initiative, and a consequent degeneration to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely automatic existence.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Hedonism is quite untenable as a principle; pleasure is merely a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consequence, and its being set in the van of ethics is due to a false
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: psychology and false science. Granting that pleasure attends the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: satisfaction of a desire, pain its repression, recognising that a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: feeling of pleasure accompanies many actions which expand life, we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must live, as Guyau reminds us, before we enjoy. The activity of life
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: surges within us, and we do not act with a view to pleasure or with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasure as a motive, but life, just because it is life, seeks to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expand. Man in acting has created his pleasures and his organs. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasure and the organ alike proceed from function--that is, life
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself. The pleasure of an action and even the consciousness of it are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attributes, not ends. The action arises naturally from the inherent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intensity of life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The hedonists, too, says Guyau, have been negligent of the widest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasures, and have frequently confined their attention to those of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: eating and drinking and sexual intercourse, purely sensitive, and have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: neglected those of living, willing and thinking, which are more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander
