text: fundamental as being identical with the consciousness of life. But
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau asserts that, as the greatest intensity of life involves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessarily its widest expansion, we must give special attention to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thought and will and feeling, which bring us into touch universally
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with our fellows and promote the widest life. This expansiveness of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life has great ethical importance. With the change in the nature of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reproduction, involving the sexual union of two beings, "a new moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phase began in the world." It involved an expansion not merely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: physical, but mental--a union, however crude, of soul.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is in the extension of this feature of human life that Guyau sees
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the ethical ideal. The most perfect organism is the most sociable, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the ideal of the individual life is the common or social life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Morality is for him almost synonymous with sociability,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: disinterestedness, love and brotherhood, and in it we find, he says,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "the flower of human life."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: All our action should be referred to this moral ideal of sociability.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau sees in the phrase "social service" a conception which should
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not be confined to those who are endeavouring in some religious or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philanthropic manner to alleviate the suffering caused by evil in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: human society, but a conception to which the acts, all acts, of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: members of society should be related. Like Renouvier, he gives to work
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an important ethical value. "To work is to produce--that is, to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: useful to oneself and to others." In work he sees the economic and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral reconciliation of egoism and altruism. It is a good and it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: praiseworthy. Those who neglect and despise it are parasites, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their existence in society is a negation of the moral ideal of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociability and social service. In so far as the work of certain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: persons leads to the accumulation of excessive capital in individual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hands, it is likely to annul itself sooner or later in luxury and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idleness. Such an immoral state of affairs, it is the concern of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society, by its laws of inheritance and possession, to prevent.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having made clear his principle of morality, Guyau then has to face
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the question of its relation to the notion of duty or obligation. Duty
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in itself is an idea which he rejects as vague, and he disapproves of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the external and artificial element present in the Kantian "rigorism."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: For Guyau the very power of action contained in life itself creates an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: impersonal duty. While Emerson could write:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Duty says, 'I must,'
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The youth replies, 'I can,'"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the view of Guyau is directly the converse; for him "I can" gives the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "I must"; it is the power which precedes and creates the obligation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Life cannot maintain itself unless it grows and expands. The soul that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: liveth to itself, that liveth solely by habit and automatism, is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: already dead. Morality is the unity of the personality expanding by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action and by sympathy. It is at this point that Guyau's thought
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: approaches closely to the _philosophie des id<e9>es-forces_ of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: step-father, by his doctrine of thought and action.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Immorality is really unsociability, and Guyau thinks this a better
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: key-note than to regard it as disobedience. If it is so to be spoken
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of, it is disobedience to the social elements in one's own self--a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mischievous duplication of personality, egoistic in character and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: profoundly antisocial. The sociological elements which characterise
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all Guyau's work are here very marked. In the notion of sociability we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: find an equivalent of the older and more artificial conception of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Duty--a conception which lacks concreteness and offers in itself so
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: little guidance because it is abstract and empty. The criterion of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociability, Guyau claims, is much more concrete and useful. He asks
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us to observe its spirituality, for the more gross and materialistic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasures fall short of the criterion by the very fact that they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cannot be shared. Guyau's thought is here at its best. The higher
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasures, which are not those of bodily enjoyment and satisfaction,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but those of the spirit, which thinks, feels, wills and loves, are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: precisely those which come nearest to fulfilling the ideal of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociability, for they tend less to divide men than to unite them and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to urge them to a closer co-operation for their spiritual advancement.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau writes here with sarcasm regarding the lonely imbecile in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: carriage drawn by four horses. For his own part it is enough to have--
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ". . . a Loaf of Bread beneath the Bough,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: A Flask of Wine, a Book of Verse--and Thou
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Beside me singing in the Wilderness--
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: And Wilderness is Paradise enow."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He knows who really has chosen the better part. One cannot rejoice
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: much and rejoice alone. Companionship and love are supremely valuable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "goods," and the pleasure of others he recognises as a very real part
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his own. The egoist's pleasure is, on the other hand, very largely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an illusion. He loses, says Guyau, far more by his isolated enjoyment
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than he would gain by sharing.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Life itself is the greatest of all goods, as it is the condition of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all others, but life's value fades if we are not loved. It is love,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comradeship and the fellowship of kindred souls which give to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humblest life a significance and a feeling of value. This, Guyau
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: points out with some tenderness, is the tragedy of suicides. These
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: occurrences are a social no less than an individual tragedy. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tragic element lies in the fact that they were persons who were unable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to give their devotion to some object, and the loss of personalities
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in this way is a real loss to society, but it is mainly society itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is to blame for them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We need not fear, says Guyau, that such a gospel will promote unduly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the operation of mere animality or instinctive action, for in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: growth of the scientific spirit he sees the development of the great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: enemy of all instinct. It is the dissolving force _par excellence_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the revolutionary spirit which incessantly wages warfare within
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society against authority, and in the individual it operates through
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reason against the instinctive impulses. Every instinct tends to lapse
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in so far as it is reflected upon by consciousness.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The old notion of duty or obligation must, in Guyau's opinion, be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: abandoned. The sole commandment which a scientific and positive ethic,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: such as he endeavours to indicate, can recognise, is expressible only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the words, "Develop your life in all directions, be an individual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as rich as possible in energy, intensive and extensive"--in other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: words, "Be the most social and sociable being you can." It is this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which replaces the "categorical imperative."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He aptly points out the failure of modern society to offer scope for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: devotion, which is really a superabundance of life, and its proneness
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to crush out opportunities which offer a challenge to the human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spirit. There is a claim of life itself to adventure; there is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pleasure in risk and in conflict; and this pleasure in risk and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adventure has been largely overlooked in its relation to the moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life. Such risk and adventure are not merely a pure negation of self
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or of personal life, but rather, he considers, that life raised to its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: highest power, reaching the sublime. By virtue of such devotion our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lives are enriched. He draws a touching picture of the sacrifice upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which our modern social life and civilisation are based, and draws an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: analogy between the blood of dead horses used by the ploughman in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fertilising his field, and the blood of the martyrs of humanity, _qui
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ont f<e9>cond<e9> l'avenir_. Often they may have been mistaken; later
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: generations may wonder if their cause was worth fighting for; yet,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: although nothing truly is sadder than to die in vain, that devotion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was valuable in and for itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With the demand of life for risk in action is bound up the impetus to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: undertake risk in thought. From this springs the moral need for faith,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for belief and acceptance of some hypotheses. The very divergence or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: diversity of the world-religions is not discouraging but rather the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reverse. It is a sign of healthy moral life. Uniformity would be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: highly detrimental; it would cease to express life, for with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conformity of belief would come spiritual decline and stagnation.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau anticipates here his doctrine of a religion of free thought, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "non-religion" of the future, which we shall discuss in our next
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chapter, when we examine his book on that subject. In the diversity of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious views Guyau sees a moral good, for these religions are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves an expression of life in its richness, and the conservation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and expansion of this rich variety of life are precisely the moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We must endeavour to realise how rich and varied the nature of human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life really is. Revolutionaries, Guyau points out, are always making
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the mistake of regarding life and truth as too simple. Life and truth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are so complex that evolution is the key-note to what is desirable in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the individual intellect and in society, not a revolution which must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inevitably express the extreme of one side or the other. The search
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for truth is slow and needs faith and patience, but the careful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: seekers of it are making the future of mankind. But truth will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discovered only in relation to action and life and in proportion to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the labour put into its realisation. The search for truth must never
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be divorced from the active life, Guyau insists, and, indeed, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: approaches the view that the action will produce the knowledge, "He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that doeth the will shall know of the doctrine." Moreover he rightly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sees in action the wholesome cure for pessimism and that cynicism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which all too frequently arises from an equal appreciation of opposing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: views. "Even in doubt," he exclaims, "we can love; even in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellectual night, which prevents our seeing any ultimate goal, we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: can stretch out a hand to him who weeps at our feet."_*_ In other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: words, we must do the duty that lies nearest, in the hope and faith
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that by that action itself light will come.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni Sanction_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the last part of his treatise Guyau deals with the difficult
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problem of "sanction," so ultimately connected with ethics, and, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must be added, with religion. The Providence who rewards and punishes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us, according to the orthodox religious creed of Christendom, is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: merely a personified "sanction" or distributive justice, operating in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a terrestrial and celestial court of assize. Guyau condemns this as an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: utterly immoral conception. Religious sanctions, as he has not much
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: difficulty in showing, are more cruel than those which a man could
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imagine himself inflicting upon his mortal enemy. The "Heavenly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Father" ought at least to be as good as earthly ones, who do not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cruelly punish their children. Guyau touches upon an important point
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here, which will be further emphasised--namely, the necessity for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: making our idea of God, if we have one at all, harmonious with our own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethical conceptions. The old ideas of the divinity are profoundly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immoral and are based on physical force. This is natural because those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: views which have survived in modern times are those of primitive and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: savage people to whom the most holy was the most powerful and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: physically majestic. But, says Guyau, now that we see that "all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: physical force represents moral weakness," the idea of God the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: All-terrible, with his hell-fire ready for the sinful soul, must be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: condemned as immoral blasphemy itself. "God," he remarks, "in damning
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any soul might be said to damn himself."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Virtue is really its own reward. No one should be or do good in order
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to gain an entry into paradise or to escape the torments of hell. That
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is to build morality on an immoral principle and on a belief, not in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness as valuable in and for itself, but on a basis of material
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: self-interest alone, "the best policy." It is true, Guyau admits, that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtue involves happiness, but it is not in this sense. A conflict
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between "pleasure" and virtue is usually one of higher _versus_ lower
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideals. Virtue is not a precedent to sense-happiness, and in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense is not at all equivalent or bound up with happiness, but, as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: facts of life reveal, very often opposed to it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau opposes the ordinary view of punishment in society and shows
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that it is both immoral and socially harmful in its application. It
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adds evil to evil, and legal murder is really more absurd than the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: illegal murder. Punishment, capital or other, is no "compensation"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: exacted for the crime committed, and it never can be such. Attempts to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: treat and cure the guilty one would, Guyau suggests, be far more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational, humane and really beneficial to society itself, which at
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: present creates by its punishments, especially those inflicted for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: first offences, a "criminal class." One should convert the criminal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: before punishing him, and then, Guvau asks, if he is converted, why
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: punish him?
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The appeal to justice denoted in the words "To everyone according to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his works" is frequently heard in the defence of punishment. This is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an excellent maxim in Guyau's opinion, but he is careful to point out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that it is purely one of social economics. It is a plea for a just
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: distribution of the products of labour, but does not apply at all to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the problem of punishment. In a manner which recalls the remarks of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan, Guyau sees in evil-doing a lack of culture, or rather of that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sociability, which comes of social culture, from consciousness of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: membership of society and a solidarity with one's fellows. In vice and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in virtue alike the human will appears aspiring to better things
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: according to its lights. As virtue is its own reward, so is evil; and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the moralist must say to the wicked: "Verily they have their reward"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (_Comme si ce n'<e9>tait pas assez pour eux d'<ea>tre m<e9>chants_).
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau comments upon the gradual modifications of punishment from a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social point of view. There was the day when the chastisement was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: infinitely worse than the crime itself. Then came the morality of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reciprocity, "an eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth," an ethic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which represented a high ideal for primitive man to reach, and one to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which, Guyau thinks, we have yet to reach to-day in some spheres of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life. Yet a further moral development will show how foolish, in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: civilised society, are wrath and hatred of the criminal and the cry
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for vengeance. Society must aim at ensuring protection for itself with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the minimum of individual suffering. Punishment must be regarded as an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: example for the future rather than as revenge or compensation. In the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individual himself Guyau observes how powerful can be the inner
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sanction of remorse, the suffering caused by the unrealised ideal.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This is perhaps the only real moral punishment, and it is one which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: society cannot itself directly enforce. Only by increasing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "sociability" and social sensitiveness can this sanction be indirectly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: developed.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Herein lies the highest ethical ideal, far more concrete and living,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in Guyau's opinion, than the rigorism of a Kant or the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "scholastic"_*_ temper of a Renouvier. Charity or love for all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: men, whatever their value morally, intellectually or physically, must,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he claims, "be the final end pursued even by public opinion."In
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: co-operation and sociability, he finds the vital moral ideal; in love
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and brotherhood, he finds the real sanction which should operate."Love
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supposes mutuality of love," he says; and there is one idea superior
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to that of justice, that is the idea of brotherhood, and he remarks
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with a humane tenderness "the guilty have probably more need for love
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than anyone else." "I have," he cries, "two hands-- the one for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gripping the hand of those with whom I march along in life, the other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to lift up the fallen. Indeed, to these I should be able to stretch
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: out both hands together."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_: This is Guyau's word to describe Renouvier, whom he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regards as far too much under the influence of Kant.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Esquisse d'une Morale sans Obligation ni Sanction_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While Fouill<e9>e and, more especially, Guyau were thus outlining an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethic marked by a strong humanitarianism, a more definitely religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethic was being proclaimed by that current of philosophy of belief and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of action which has profoundly associated itself in its later
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: developments with "Modernism" in the Roman Church. The tendency to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stress action and the practical reason is noticeable in the work of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Brochard, Oll<e9>-Laprune and Blondel, also in Rauh. They agree with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier in advocating the primacy of the practical reason, but their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: own reasons for this are different from his, or at least in them the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reasons are more clearly enunciated. Plainly these reasons lie in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: difficulties of intellectualism and the quest of truth. They propose
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the quest of the good in the hope of finding in that sphere some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: objectivity, some absolute, in fact, which they cannot find out by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellectual searching. They correspond in a somewhat parallel fashion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the philosophy of intuition with its rejection of intellectualism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as offering a final solution. These thinkers desire by action, by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doing the will, to attain to a knowledge of the doctrine. The first
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: word in their gospel is--
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Im Anfang war die That."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is for them the beginning and the end. Their certainty is an act of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief, which grows out of action and life. It is a curious mixture of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insistence upon life and action, such as we find in Guyau and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson, coupled with a religious Platonism. Brochard's work is of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this type. He wrote as early as 1874 on _La Responsabilit<e9> morale_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and in 1876 on _L'Universalit<e9> des Notions morales_. Three years later
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeared his work _L'Erreur_. Oll<e9>-Laprune and Blondel, who best
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: represent this tendency, do not like Guyau's ethics, which lacks the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious idealism which they consider should be bound up with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality. This was the thesis developed in the volume _La Certitude
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morale_, written by Oll<e9>-Laprune in 1881. "By what right," says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Oll<e9>-Laprune in his subsequent book _Le Prix de la Vie_ (1895), "can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau speak of a high exalted life, of a moral ideal? It is impossible
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to speak so when you have only a purely naturalistic ethic; for merely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to name these things is an implication that there is not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intensity in life, but also quality. You suppress duty because you can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: see in it only a falsely mystical view of life and of nature. What you
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fail to realise is that between duty and life there is a profound
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: agreement. You reduce duty to life, and in life itself you consider
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: only its quantity and intensity, and regard as illusion everything
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that is of a different order from the natural physical order in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: you imprison yourself."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Le Prix de la Vie_, p. 139.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such a criticism is not altogether fair to Guyau who, as we noted,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: proclaimed the superiority of the higher qualities of spiritual life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It does, however, attack his abandonment of the idea of Duty; and we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must now turn to examine a thinker, who, by his contribution to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ethics, endeavoured to satisfy the claims of life and of duty.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This was Rauh, whose _Essai sur le Fondement m<e9>taphysique de la Morale_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeared in 1890. It had been preceded by a study of the psychology of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the feelings, and was later followed by _L'Exp<e9>rience morale_ (1903).
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In seeking a metaphysical foundation for morality, Rauh recalls Kant's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Metaphysic of Morals_. He, indeed, agrees with Kant in the view that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the essence of morality lies in the sentiment of obligation. Belief or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith in an ideal, by which it behoves us to act, imposes itself, says
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Rauh, upon the mind of man as essential. It is as positive a fact as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the laws of the natural sciences. Man not only states facts and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: formulates general laws in a scientific manner, he also conceives and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believes in ideals, which become bound up in his mind with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sentiment of obligation--that is, the general feeling of duty. But
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beyond a general agreement upon this point, Rauh does not follow Kant.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He tends to look upon the ethical problem in the spirit which Guyau,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Bergson and Blondel show in their general philosophic outlook. In
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life, action and immediacy alone can we find a solution. Nothing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical can be deduced from the abstract principle of obligation or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: duty in general. The moral consciousness of man is, in Rauh's opinion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: akin to the intuitional perceptions of Bergson's philosophy. Morality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moreover, is creating itself perpetually by the reflection of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sensitive minds on action and on life itself. "Morality, or rather
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral action, is not merely the crown of metaphysical speculation, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself the true metaphysic, which is learnt only in living, as it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: naught but life itself."_*_ In concluding his thesis, Rauh reminds
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: us that "the essential and most certain factor in the midst of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: uncertainties of life and of duty lies in the constant consciousness
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the moral ideal." In it he sees a spiritual reality which, if we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: keep it ever before us, may inspire the most insignificant of our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: actions and render them into a harmony, a living harmony of character.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Essai sur le Fondement m<e9>taphysique de la Morale_, p.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Rauh's doctrines, we claim, have affinities to the doctrines of action
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and intuition. That does not imply, however, that the intelligence is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be minimised--far from this; but the intelligence triumphs here in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realising that it is not all-sufficing or supreme. "The heart hath
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reasons which the reason cannot know." While Fouill<e9>e had remarked
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that morality is metaphysics in action, Rauh points out that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "metaphysics in action" is the foundation of our knowledge. We must,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he insists, seek for certitude in an immediate and active adaptation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to reality instead of deducing a rule or rules of action from abstract
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: systems.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He separates himself from the sociologists_*_ by pointing out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that, however largely social environment may determine our moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideals and rules of conduct, nevertheless the ethical decision is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fundamentally an absolutely personal affair. The human conscience, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: so far as active, must never _passively_ accept the existing social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morality. It finds itself sometimes in agreement, sometimes obliged to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: give a newer interpretation to old conventions, and at times is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obliged to revolt against them. In no case can the idea of duty be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: equated simply and calmly with acquiescence in the collective general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: will. It must demand from social morality its credentials and hold
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: itself free to criticise the current ethic of the community. More
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: often than not society acts, Rauh thinks, as a break rather than a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stimulus; and social interest is not a measure of the moral ideal, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather a limitation of it.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : The relation of ethics and sociology is well
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussed, not only by Durkheim (who, in his _Division du Travail
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: social_, speaks of the development of democracy and increasing respect
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for human personality), but also by L<e9>vy-Bruhl, who followed his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thesis on _L'Id<e9>e de Responsabilit<e9>_, 1883, by the volume, _La Morale
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: el la Science des Moeurs_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Although the moral ideal is one which must be personally worked out,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is not a merely individualistic affair. Rauh does not abandon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: guidance of reason, but he objects equally to the following of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: instinct or a transcendent teaching divorced from the reality of life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Our guide must be reflection upon instinct, and this is only possible
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by action and experience, the unique experience of living itself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Reason itself is experience; and it is our duty to face problems
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personally and sincerely, in a manner which the rational element in us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: renders "impersonal, universal and disinterested."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Any code of morality which is not directly in contact with life is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: worthless, and all ethical ideas which are not those of our time are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of little value. Only he is truly a man who lives the life of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time. The truly moral man is he who is alive to this spirit and who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: does not unreflectingly deduce his rules of conduct from ancient books
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or teachers of a past age. The art of living is the supreme art, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is this which the great moralists have endeavoured to show
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity. Neither Socrates nor Jesus wrote down their ethical ideas:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they lived them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Rauh thus reminds us partly of Guyau in his insistence upon life. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regards the ethical life at its highest, as one _sans obligation ni
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sanction_. Rather than the Kantian obligation of duty, of constraint,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he favours in his second book, _L'Exp<e9>rience morale_, a state of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: spontaneity, of passion and exaltation of the personal conscience
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which faces the issue in a disinterested manner. The man who is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: morally honest himself selects his values, his ideals, his ends, by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the light which reason gives him. Ethics becomes thus an independent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science, a science of "ends," which Reason, as reflected in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personal conscience, acclaims a science of the ideal ordering of life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Such was Rauh's conception of rational moral experience, one which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: endeavoured to apply in his lectures to the two problems which he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considered to be supreme in his time, that of patriotism and of social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: justice.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These problems were further touched upon in 1896, when L<e9>on Bourgeois
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (since noted for his advocacy of the "League of Nations") published
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: his little work _Solidarit<e9>_, which was also a further contribution to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an independent, positive and lay morality. In the conception of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: solidarity of humanity throughout the ages, Bourgeois accepted the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teaching of the sociologists, and urges that herein can be found an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obligation, for the present generation must repay their debt to their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ancestors and be worthy of the social heritage which has made them
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: what they are. Somewhat similar sentiments had Been expressed by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Marion in his Solidarit<e9> morale (1880). Ethical questions were kept in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the forefront by the society known as _L'Union pour l'Action morale_,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: founded by Desjardins and supported by Lagneau (1851- 1894). After the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: excitement of the Dreyfus case (1894- 1899) this society took the name
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _L'Union pour la Verit<e9>_. In 1902 Lapie made an eloquent plea for a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational morality in his _Logique de la Volont<e9>_, and in the following
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: year S<e9>ailles published his _Affirmations de la Conscience moderne_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The little _Pr<e9>cis_ of Andr<e9> Lalande, written in the form of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: catechism, was a further contribution to the establishment of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational and independent lay morality, which the teaching of ethics as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a subject in the _lyc<e9>es_ and lay schools rendered in some degree
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessary._*_ This little work appeared in 1907, the same year in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which Paul Bureau wrote his book _La Crise morale des Temps nouveaux_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Then Parodi (who in 1919 produced a fine study of French thought since
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1890_/-_) followed up the discussion of ethical problems by his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: work _Le Probl<e8>me morale et la Pens<e9>e contemporaine_ (1909), and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1912 Wilbois published his contribution entitled _Devoir et Dur<e9>e:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Essai de Morale sociale_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : The teaching of a lay morality is a vital and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical problem which the Government of the Republic is obliged to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: face. The urgent need for such lay teaching will be more clearly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demonstrated or evident when our next chapter, dealing with the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious problem, has been read.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _La Philosophie contemporaine en France_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Thus concludes a period in which the discussion, although not marked
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by a definite turning round of positions as was manifested in our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussions of science, freedom and progress, bears signs of a general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: development. This development is shown by the greater insistence upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the social aspects of ethics and by a turning away from the formalism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Kant to a more concrete conception of duty, or an ethic in which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the notion of duty itself has disappeared. This is the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tendency from Renan with his insistence upon the aesthetic element,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier with his claim for justice in terms of personality, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Fouill<e9>e, Guyau, Oll<e9>-Laprune and Rauh with their insistence upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action, upon love and life.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet, although the departure from an intense individualism in ethics is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: desirable, we must beware of the danger which threatens from the other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: extreme. We cannot close this chapter without insisting upon this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point. Good must be personally realised in the inner life of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals, even if they form a community. The collective life is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed necessary, but it is not collectively that the good is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: experienced. It is personal. In the neglect of this important aspect
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: lies the error of much Communistic philosophy and of that social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: science which looks on society as purely an organism. This analogy is
