text: upon as a close preserve, reserved for the theologians or churchmen
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alone, was deemed at that time an original and daring feat in France.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His particular views, which created at the time such scandal, were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: akin to those of Baur and the Tubingen School, which Strauss (Renan's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contemporary) had already set forth in his _Leben Jesu_._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Briefly, they may be expressed as the rejection of the supernatural.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Herein is seen the scientific or "positive" influence at work upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dogmas of the Christian religion, a tendency which culminated in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Modernism" within the Church, only to be condemned violently by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Pope in 1907. It was this temper, produced by the study of documents,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by criticism and historical research which put Renan out of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Catholic Church. His rational mind could not accept the dogmas laid
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: down. Lamennais (who was conservative and orthodox in his theology,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and possessed no taint of "modernism" in the technical sense) had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: declared that the starting-point should be faith and not reason. Renan
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: aptly asks in reply to this, "and what is to be the test, in the last
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: resort, of the claims of faith is not reason?"
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Written in 1835. Littr<e9> issued a French translation in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1839, a year previous to the appearance of the English version by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: George Eliot. Strauss's life covers 1808-1874.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In Renan we find a good illustration of the working of the spirit of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: modern thought upon a religious mind. Being a sincere and penetrating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intellect he could not, like so many people, learned folk among them,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: keep his religious ideas and his reason in separate watertight
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: compartments. This kind of people Renan likens in his _Souvenirs
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: d'Enfance et de Jeunesse_ to mother-o'-pearl shells of Francois de
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Sales "which are able to live in the sea without tasting a drop of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: salt water." Yet he realises the comfort of such an attitude. "I see
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: around me," he continues, "men of pure and simple lives whom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christianity has had the power to make virtuous and happy. . . . But I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have noticed that none of them have the critical faculty, for which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: let them bless God!" He well realises the contentment which, springing
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sometimes from a dullness of mind or lack of sensitiveness, excludes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all doubt and all problems.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In Catholicism he sees a bar of iron which will not reason or bend. "I
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: can only return to it by amputation of my faculties, by definitely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stigmatising my reason and condemning it to perpetual silence."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Writing of his exit from the Seminary of Saint Sulpice, where he was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: trained for the priesthood, he remarks in his _Souvenirs d'Enfance et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de Jeunesse_ that "there were times when I was sorry that I was not a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Protestant, so that I might be a philosopher without ceasing to be a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian." For Renan, as for so many minds in modern France,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: severance from the Roman Church is equivalent to severance from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christianity as an organised religion. The practical dilemma is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presented of unquestioning obedience to an infallible Church on the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: one hand, or the attitude of _libre-penseur_ on the other. There are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not the accommodating varieties of the Protestant presentation of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian religion. Renan's spiritual pilgrimage is but an example of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: many. In a measure this condition of affairs is a source of strength
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to the Roman Church for, since a break with it so often means a break
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with Christianity or indeed with all definite religion, only the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: bolder and stronger thinkers make the break which their intellect
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: makes imperative. The mass of the people, however dissatisfied they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may be with the Church, nevertheless accept it, for they see no
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: alternative but the opposite extreme. No half-way house of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: non-conformity presents itself as a rule.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Yet, as we have insisted, Renan had an essentially religious view of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the universe, and he expressly claimed that his break with the Church
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and his criticism of her were due to a devotion to pure religion, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he even adds, to a loyalty to the spirit of her Founder. Although, as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he remarks in his _Nouvelles Etudes religieuses_, it is true that the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most modest education tends to destroy the belief in the superstitious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elements in religion, it is none the less true that the very highest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: culture can never destroy religion in the highest sense. "Dogmas pass,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but piety is eternal." The external trappings of religion have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: suffered by the growth of the modern sciences of nature and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: historical criticism. The mind of cultivated persons does not now
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: present the same attitude to evidence in regard to religious doctrines
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which were once accepted without question. The sources of the origins
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the Christian religion are themselves questionable. This, Renan
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: says, must not discourage the believers in true religion, for that is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not the kind of foundation upon which religion reposes. Dogmas in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: past gave rise to divisions and quarrels, only by feeling can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious persons be united in fellowship. The most prophetic words of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Jesus were, Renan points out, those in which he indicated a time when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: men "would not worship God in this mountain nor in Jerusalem, but when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the true worshippers would worship in spirit and in truth." It was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: precisely this spirit which Renan admired in Jesus, whom he considered
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more of a philosopher than the Church, and he reminds the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Christians"_*_ who railed against him as an unbeliever that Jesus
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: had had much more influence upon him than they gave him credit for,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and, more particularly, that his break with the Church was due to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: loyalty to Jesus. By such loyalty Renan meant not a blind worship, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a reverence which endeavoured to appreciate and follow the ideals for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which Jesus himself stood. It did not involve slavish acceptance of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all he said, even if that were intelligible, and clear, which it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not. "To be a Platonist," remarks Renan, "I need not adore Plato, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believe _all_ that he said."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Renan complains of the ignorance of the clergy of Rome
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarding his own work, which they did not understand because they had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not read it, merely relying on the Press and other sources for false
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and biassed accounts.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Cf._ Renan's Essay in _Questions contemporaines_ on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "_L'Avenir religieux des Soci<e9>t<e9>s modernes_."]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan is in agreement with the central ideas of Jesus' own faith, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he rightly regards him as one of the greatest contributors to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: world's religious thought. Renan's religion is free from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supernaturalism and dogma. He believes in infinite Goodness or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Providence, but he despises the vulgar and crude conceptions of God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which so mar a truly religious outlook. He points out how prayer, in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the sense of a request to Heaven for a particular object, is becoming
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: recognised as foolish. 'As a "meditation," an interview with one's own
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience, it has a deeply religious value. The vulgar idea of prayer
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reposes on an immoral conception of God. Renan rightly sees the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: central importance for religion of possessing a sane view of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divinity, not one which belongs to primitive tribal wargods and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: weather-gods. He aptly says, in this connection, that the one who was
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: defeated in 1871 was not only France but _le bon Dieu_ to which she in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vain appealed. In his place was to be found, remarks Renan with a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: little sarcasm, "only a Lord God of Hosts who was unmoved by the moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 'd<e9>licatesse' of the Uhlans and the incontestable excellence of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Prussian shells."_/-_ He rightly points to the immoral use made of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the divinity by pious folk whose whole religion is utilitarian and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: materialistic. They do good only in order to get to heaven or escape
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hell,_/=_ and believe in God because it is necessary for them to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have a confidant and sonsoler, to whom they may cry in time of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: trouble, and to whose will they may resignedly impute the evil
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chastisement which their own errors have brought upon them
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individually or collectively. But, he rightly claims, it is only where
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: utilitarian calculations and self-interest end, that religion begins
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the sense of the Infinite and of the Ideal Goodness and Beauty
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and Love.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Dialogues et Fragments philosophiques_, p. ix.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/=_ : One pious individual thought to convert Renan himself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by writing him every month, quite briefly, to this effect "There is a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hell."]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He endeavours in his _Examen de Conscience philosophique_ (1888) to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sum up his attitude upon this question. There he affirms that it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beyond dispute or doubt that we have no evidence whatever of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: action in the universe of one or of several wills superior to that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man. The actual state of this universe gives no sign of any external
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intervention, and we know nothing of its beginning. No beneficent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: interfering power, a _deus ex machin<e2>_, corrects or directs the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operation of blind forces, enlightens man or improves his lot. No God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appears miraculously to prevent evils, to crush disease, stop wars, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: save his children from peril. No end or purpose is visible to us. God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the popular sense, living and acting as a Divine Providence, is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be seen in our universe. The question is, however, whether this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe of ours is the totality of existence. Doubt comes into play
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here, and if our universe is not this totality, then God, although
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absent from his world, might still exist outside it. Our finite world
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is little in relation to the Infinite, it is a mere speck in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe we know, and its duration to a divine Being might be only a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: day.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The Infinite, continues Renan, surrounds our finite world above and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: below. It stretches on the one hand to the infinitely large concourse
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of worlds and systems, and, on the other, to the infinitely little as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: atoms, microbes and the germs by which human life itself is passed on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from one generation to another. The prospect of the world we know
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves logically and fatally, says Renan, atheism. But this atheism,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he adds, may be due to the fact that we cannot see far enough. Our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe is a phenomenon which has had a beginning and will have an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: end. That which has had no beginning and will have no end is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Absolute All, or God. Metaphysics has always been a science proceeding
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon this assumption, "Something exists, therefore something has
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existed from all eternity." which is akin to the scientific principle,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "No effect with- out a cause."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Examen de Conscience philosophique_, p. 412 of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: volume _Feuilles d<e9>tach<e9>es_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We must not allow ourselves to be misled too far by the constructions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or inductions about the uniformity and immutability of the laws of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature. "A God may reveal himself, perhaps, one day." The infinite may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dispose of our finite world, use it for its own ends. The expression,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Nature and its author," may not be so absurd as some seem to think
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it. It is true that our experience presents no reason for forming such
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: an hypothesis, but we must keep our sense of the infinite. "Everything
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is possible, even God," and Renan adds, "If God exists, he must be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: good, and he will finish by being just." It is as foolish to deny as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to assert his existence in a dogmatic and thoughtless manner. It is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon this sense of the infinite and upon the ideals of Goodness,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Beauty and Love that true faith or piety reposes.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Love, declares Renan, is one of the principal revelations of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divine, and he laments the neglect of it by philosophy. It runs in a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certain sense through all living beings, and in man has been the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: school of gentleness and courtesy--nay more, of morals and of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion. Love, understood in the high sense, is a sacred, religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thing, or rather is a part of religion itself. In a tone which recalls
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that of the New Testament and Tolstoi, Renan beseeches us to remember
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that God _is_ Love, and that where Love is there God is. In loving,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man is at his best; he goes out of himself and feels himself in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contact with the infinite. The very act of love is veritably sacred
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and divine, the union of body and soul with another is a holy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: communion with the infinite. He remarks in his _Souvenirs d'Enfance et
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: de Jeunesse_, doubtless remembering the simple purity and piety of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mother and sister, that when reflection has brought us to doubt, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even to a scepticism regarding goodness, then the spontaneous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: affirmation of goodness and beauty which exists in a noble and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtuous woman saves us from cynicism and restores us to communication
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the eternal spring in which God reflects himself. Love, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan with reason laments as having been neglected on its most serious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: side and looked upon as mere sentimentality, offers the highest proof
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of God. In it lies our umbilical link with nature, but at the same
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time our communion with the infinite. He recalls some of Browning's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: views in his attitude to love as a redeeming power. The most wretched
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: criminal still has something good in him, a divine spark, if he be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: capable of loving.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is the spirit of love and goodness which Renan admires in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: simple faith of those separated far from him in their theological
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideas. "God forbid," he says,_*_ "that I should speak slightingly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of those who, devoid of the critical sense, and impelled by very pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and powerful religious motives, are attached to one or other of the

text: This is the point upon which Vacherot insisted in his treatment of

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte

author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Like Renan, Renouvier was keenly interested in religion and its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: problems; he was also a keen opponent of the Roman Catholic Church and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faith, against which he brought his influence into play in two
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ways--by his _n<e9>o-criticisme_ as expressed in his written volumes and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by his energetic editing of the two periodicals _La Critique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophique_ and _La Critique religieuse_.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In undertaking the publication of these periodicals Renouvier's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: confessed aim was that of a definite propaganda. While the Roman
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Church profited by the feelings of disappointment and demoralisation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which followed the Franco-Prussian War, and strove to shepherd
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: wavering souls again into its fold, to find there a peace which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evidently the world could not give, Renouvier (together with his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: friend Pillon) endeavoured to rally his countrymen by urging the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: importance, and, if possible, the acceptance of his own political and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious convictions arising out of his philosophy. The _Critique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophique_ appeared weekly from its commencement in 1872 until
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1884, thereafter as a monthly until 1889. Among its contributors,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whose names are of religious significance, were A. Sabatier, L.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Dauriac, R. Allier_*_ and William James.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Now Dean of the Protestant Faculty of Theology in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Paris.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's great enthusiasm for his periodical is the main feature of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this period of his life, although, owing to his tremendous energy, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: does not seem to have interfered with the publication of his more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: permanent works. The political and general policy of this journal may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: be summed up in a sentence from the last year's issue,_/-_ where we
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: find Renouvier remarking that it had been his aim throughout "to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: uphold strictly republican principles and to fight all that savoured
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of Caesar, or imperialism." The declared foe of monarchy in politics,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he was equally the declared foe of the Pope in the religious realm.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: His attitude was one of very marked hostility to the power of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Vatican, which he realised to be increasing within the Roman Church,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and one of keen opposition to the general power of that Church and her
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clergy in France. Renouvier's paper was quite definitely and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: aggressively anti-Catholic. He urged all Catholic readers of his paper
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who professed loyalty to the Republic to quit the Roman Church and to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: affiliate themselves to the Protestant body.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _La Critique philosophique_, 1889, tome ii., p. 403.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It was with this precise object in view that, in 1878, he added to his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Critique philosophique_ a supplement which he entitled _La Critique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religieuse_, a quarterly intended purely for propaganda purposes.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Criticism," he had said, "is in philosophy what Protestantism is in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion."_/=_ As certitude is, according to Renouvier's doctrines,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the fruit of intelligence, heart and will, it can never be obtained by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the coercion of authority or by obedience such as the Roman Church
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: demands. He appealed to the testimony of history, as a witness to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conflict between authority and the individual conscience. Jesus, whom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Church adores, was himself a superb example of such revolt.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: History, however, shows us, says Renouvier, the gradual decay of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: authority in such matters. Thought, if it is really to be thought in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its sincerity, must be free. This Renouvier realised, and in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom he saw the characteristic of the future development of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion, and shows himself, in this connection, in substantial
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: agreement with Renan and Guyau.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's interest in theology and religion, and in the theological
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: implications of all philosophical thought, was not due merely to a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: purely speculative impulse, but to a very practical desire to initiate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a rational restatement of religious conceptions, which he considered
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be an urgent need of his time. He lamented the influence of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Roman Church over the minds of the youth of his country, and realised
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the vital importance of the controversy between Church and State
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarding secular education. Renouvier was a keen supporter of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: secular schools (_<e9>coles la<ef>ques_). In 1879, when the educational
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: controversy was at its height, he issued a little book on ethics for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these institutions (_Petit Trait<e9> de Morale pour les Ecoles la<ef>ques_),
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which was republished in an enlarged form in 1882, when the secular
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: party, ably led by Jules Ferry, triumphed in the establishment of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: compulsory, free, secular education. That great achievement, however,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: did not solve all the difficulties presented by the Church in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: educational attitude, and even now the influence of clericalism is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dreaded.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier realised all the dangers, but he was forced also to realise
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: that his enthusiastic and energetic campaign against the power of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Church had failed to achieve what he had desired. He complained of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: receiving insufficient support from quarters where he might well have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: expected it. His failure is a fairly conclusive proof that
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Protestantism has no future in France: it is a stubborn survival,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather than a growing influence. With the decline in the power and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeal of the Roman Catholic Church will come the decline of religion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of a dogmatic and organised kind. Renouvier probably had an influence
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in hastening the day of the official severance of Church and State, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: event which he did not live long enough to see._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : It occurred, however, only two years after his death.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Having become somewhat discouraged, Renouvier stopped the publication
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of his religious quarterly in 1885 and made the _Critique
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophique_ a monthly instead of a weekly Journal. It ceased in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1889, but the following year Renouvier's friend, Pillon, began a new
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: periodical, which bore the same name as the one which had ceased with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the outbreak of the war in 1870. This was _L'Ann<e9>e philosophique_, to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which Renouvier contributed articles from time to time on religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: topics.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Some writers are of the opinion that Renouvier's attacks on the Roman
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Catholic Church and faith, so far from strengthening the Protestant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: party in France, tended rather to increase the hostility to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian religion generally or, indeed, to any religious view of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier's own statements in his philosophy, in so far as these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: concern religion and theology, are in harmony with his rejection of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Absolute in philosophy and the Absolute in politics. His criticism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the idea of God, the central point in any philosophy of religion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is in terms similar to his critique of the worship of the Absolute or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the deification of the State.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In dealing with the question of a "Total Synthesis" Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indicated his objections to the metaphysical doctrine of an Absolute,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which is diametrically opposed to his general doctrine of relativity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He is violently in conflict with all religious conceptions which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: savour of this Absolute or have a pantheistic emphasis, which would
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: diminish the value and significance of relativity and of personality.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The "All-in-All" conception of God, which represents the pantheistic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elements in many theologies and religions, both Christian and other,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is not really a consciousness, he shows, for consciousness itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: implies a relation, a union of the self and non-self. In such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception actor, play and theatre all blend into one, God alone is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: real, and he is unconscious, for there is, according to this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypothesis, nothing outside himself which he can know. Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realises that he is faced with the ancient problem of the One and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Many, with the alternative of unity or plurality. With his usual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: logical decisiveness Renouvier posits plurality. He does not attempt
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to reconcile the two opposites, and he deals with the problem in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manner in which he faced the antinomies of Kant. Both cannot be true,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and the enemy of pantheism and absolutism acclaims pluralism, both for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: logical reasons and in order to safeguard the significance of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality. In particular he directly criticises the philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Spinoza in which he sees the supreme statement of this philosophy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the eternal, the perfect, necessary, unchanging One, who is the same
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: yesterday, to-day and forever. He admits that the idea of law or a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: system of laws leads to the introduction of something approaching the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypothesis of unity, but he is careful to show by his doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom and personality that this is only a limited unity and that,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: considered even from a scientific standpoint, a Total Synthesis, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the logical outcome of such an hypothesis, is ultimately untenable.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He overthrows the idols of Spinoza and Hegel. Such absolutes, infinite
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and eternal, whether described as an infinite love which loves itself
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: or a thought thinking thought, are nothing more to Renouvier than vain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: words, which it is absurd to offer as "The Living God."
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Against these metaphysical erections Renouvier opposes his doctrines
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of freedom, of personality, relativity and pluralism. He offers in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contrast the conception of God as a Person, not an Absolute, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: relative, not infinite, but finite, limited by man's freedom and by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contingency in the world of creatures. God, in his view, is not a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Being who is omnipotent, or omniscient. He is a Person of whom man is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a type, certainly a degraded type, but man is made in the image of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divine personality. Our notion of God, Renouvier reminds us, must be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: con-* sistent with the doctrine of freedom, hence we must conceive of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him not merely as a creator of creatures or subjects, but of creative
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: power itself in those creatures. The relation of God to man is more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: complex than that of simple "creation" as this word is usually
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: comprehended, "It is a creation of creation," says Renouvier,_*_ a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remark which is parallel to the view expressed by Bergson, to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: effect that, we must conceive of God as a "creator of creators."_/-_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The existence of this Creative Person must be conceived, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insists, as indissolubly bound up with his work, and it is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unintelligible otherwise. That work is one of creation and not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: emanation--it involves more than mere power and transcendence. God is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immanent in the universe.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologie ralionnelle_, vol. 2, p. 104.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : In his address to the Edinburgh Philosophical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Society, 1914.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Theology has wavered between the two views--that of absolute
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: transcendence and omnipotence and that of immanence based on freedom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and limitation. In the first, every single thing depends upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: operation of God, whose Providence rules all. This is pure determinism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of a theological character. In the other view man's free personality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is recognised; part of the creation is looked upon as partaking of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: freedom and contingency, therefore the divinity is conceived as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limited and finite.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier insists that this view of God as finite is the only tenable
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: one, for it is the only one which gives a rational and moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: explanation of evil. In the first view God is responsible for all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things, evil included, and man is therefore much superior to him from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a moral standpoint. The idea of God must be ethically acceptable, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it is unfortunate that this idea, so central to religion, is the least
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: susceptible to modification in harmony with man's ethical development.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We already have noticed Guyau's stress upon this point in our
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of ethics. Our conception of God must, Renouvier claims, be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the affirmation of our highest category, Personality, and must express
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the best ethical ideals of mankind. Society suffers for its immoral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and primitive view of God, which gives to its religion a barbarous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: character which is disgraceful and revolting to finer or more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thoughtful minds.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is true that the acceptance of the second view, which carries with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it the complete rejection of the ideas of omnipotence and omniscience,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: modifies profoundly many of the old and primitive views of God.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier recognises this, and wishes his readers also to grasp this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point, for only so is religion to be brought forward in a development
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: harmonious with the growth of man's mind in other spheres. Man should
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not profess the results of elaborate culture in science while he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: professes at the same time doctrines of God which are not above those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of a savage or primitive people. This is the chief mischief which the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: influence of the Hebrew writings of the Old Testament has had upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian religion. The moral conscience now demands their rejection,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for to those who value religion they can only appear as being of pure
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: blasphemy. God is neither omnipotent nor omniscient, consequently many
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things must be unknown to him until they happen. Foreknowledge and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: predetermination on his part are impossible, according to Renouvier.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: God is not to be conceived as a consciousness enveloping the entire
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universe, past, present and future, in a total synthesis. Such a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief is mischievous to humanity because of its fatalism, in spite of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the comfortable consolation it offers to pious souls. Moreover, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presents the absurd view of God working often against himself.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The idea of God, Renouvier shows, arises out of the discussions of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature of the universal laws of the universe and from the progress of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personalities. The plausible conceptions of God based on causality and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on "necessary essence" have not survived the onslaughts of Criticism.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The personality of God seems to us, says Renouvier, indicated as the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conclusion and the almost necessary culmination of the consideration
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the probabilities laid down by the practical reason or moral law.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The primary, though not primitive, evidence for the existence of God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is contained in, and results from, the generalisation of the idea of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "ends" in the universe. We must not go bevond phenomena or seek
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evidence in some fictitious sphere outside of our experience. In its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most general and abstract sense the idea of God arises from the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception of moral order, immortality, or the accord of happiness and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness. We cannot deny the existence of a morality in the order and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: movements of the world, a physical sanction to the moral laws of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtue and of progress, an external reality of good, a supremacy of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: good, a witness of the Good itself. Renouvier does not think that any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: man, having sufficiently developed his thought, would refuse to give
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the name God to the object of this supreme conception, which at first
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may seem abstract because it is not in any way crude, many of its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intrinsic elements remaining undetermined in face of our ignorance,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: but which, nevertheless, or just for that very reason, is essentially
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: practical and moral, representing the most notable fact of all those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: included in our belief. This method of approaching the problem of God
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is, he thinks, both simple and grand. It is a noble contrast to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: scholastic edifice built up on the metaphysical perfection of being,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: called the Absolute. In this conception all attributes of personality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are replaced by an accumulation of metaphysical properties,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contradictory in themselves and quite incompatible with one another.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This Absolute is a pure chimerical abstraction; its pure being and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: pure essence are equivalent to pure nothing or pure nonsense.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The fetish of pure substance, substantial cause, absolute being,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whatever it be called, is vicious at all times, but particularly when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we are dealing with the fundamental problems of science. It would be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: advisable here that the only method of investigation be that of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander
