text: atheism, for scientific investigation should not be tainted by any
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prejudices or preconceived ideas upon the nature of the divinity.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: What really is Atheism? The answer to this query, says Renouvier, is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clear. The idea of God is essentially a product of the moral law or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience. An atheist is, strictly speaking, one who does not admit
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the reality of this moral order of ends and of persons as valuable in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: themselves. Verily, he himself may personally lead a much more upright
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life than the loud champions of theism, but he denies the general
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral order, which is God. With the epithet of atheist as commonly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: used for those who merelv have a conception of God which differs from
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the orthodox view, we are not here concerned. That may be dismissed as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a misuse of the word due to religious bigotry. The fruits of true
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: atheism are materialism, pantheism and fatalism. Indeed any doctrine,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even a theological doctrine, which debases and destroys the inherent
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: value of the human consciousness and personality, is rightly to be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: regarded, whatever it may _say_ about God, however it may repeat his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: name (and two of these doctrines are very fond of this repetition, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this must not blind us to the real issue)--that doctrine is atheistic.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The most resolute materialists, the most high-minded worshippers of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Providence and the great philosophers of the Absolute, find themselves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: united here in atheism. God is not a mere totality of laws operating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the universe. Such a theism is but a form of real atheism. We must,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: insists Renouvier, abandon views of this type, with all that savours
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of an Absolute, a Perfect Infinite, and affirm our belief in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: existence of an order of Goodness which gives value to human
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality and assures ultimate victory to Justice. This is to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believe in God. We arrive at this belief rationally and after
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consideration of the world and of the moral law of persons. Through
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these we come to God. We do not begin with him and pretend to deduce
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these from his nature by some incomprehensible _a priori_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: propositions. The methods of the old dogmatic theology are reversed.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Instead of beginning with a Being of whom we know nothing and can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obviously deduce nothing, let us proceed inductively, and by careful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consideration of the revelation we have before us in the world and in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity let us build up our idea of God.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier is anxious that we should examine the data upon which we may
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: found "rational hypotheses" as to the nature of God. The Critical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Philosophy has upset the demonstrations of the existence of God, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: were based upon causality and upon necessary existence (the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: cosmological and ontological proofs). Neo-criticism not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: establishes the existence of God as a rational hypothesis, but "this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: point of view of the divine problem is the most favourable to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: notion of the personality of God. The personality of God seems to us
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be indicated as the looked-for conclusion and almost necessary
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consummation of the probabilities of practical reason."_*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _Psychologie rationnelle_, vol. 2, p. 300.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The admission of ends, of finality, or purpose in the universe is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: frequently given as involving a supreme consciousness embracing this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teleology. Also it is argued that Good could not exist in its
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: generality save in an external consciousness--that is, a divine mind.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By recalling the objections to a total synthesis of phenomena,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier refutes both these arguments which rest upon erroneous
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: methods in ontology and in theology. The explanation of the world by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: God, as in the cosmological argument, is fanciful, while the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ontological argument leads us to erect an unintelligible and illogical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolute. Renouvier regards God as existing as a general consciousness
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: corresponding to the generality of ends which man himself finds before
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: him, finite, limited in power and in knowledge. But in avowing this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: God, Renouvier points him out to us as the first of all beings, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: being like them, not an absolute, but a personality, possessing (and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this is important) the perfection of morality, goodness and justice.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: He is the supreme personality in action, and as a perfect person he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respects the personality of others and operates on our world only in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the degree which the freedom and individuality of persons who are not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: himself can permit him, and within the limits of the general laws
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: under which he represents to himself his own enveloped existence. This
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is the hypothesis of unity rendered intelligible, and as such
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier claims that it bridges in a marvellous manner the gap always
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: deemed to exist between monotheism and polytheism--the two great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: currents of religious thought in humanity. The monotheists have
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: appeared intolerant and fanatical in their religion and in their deity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: (not in so far as it was manifest in the thoughts of the simple, who
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: professed a faith of the heart, but as shown in the ambitious theology
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of books and of schools), bearing on their banner the signs of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: jealous deity, wishing no other gods but himself, declaring to his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: awed worshippers: "I am that I am; have no other gods but me!" On the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other hand, the polytheistic peoples have been worshippers of beauty
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and goodness in all things, and where they saw these things they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: created a deity. They were more concerned with the immortality of good
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: souls than the eternal existence of one supreme being; they were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free-thinkers, creators of beauty and seekers after truth, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: believers in freedom. The humanism of Greece stands in contrast to the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idolatrous theocracy of the Hebrews.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The unity of God previously mentioned does not exclude the possibility
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of a plurality of divine persons. God the one would be the first and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: foremost, _rex hominum deorumque_. Some there may be that rise through
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: saintliness to divinity, Sons of God, persons surpassing man in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: intelligence, power and morality. To take sides in this matter is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: equivalent to professing a particular religion. We must avoid the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: absolutist spirit in religion no less than in philosophy. By this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier means that brutal fanaticism which prohibits the Gods of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: other people by passion and hatred, which aims at establishing and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: imposing its own God (which is, after all, but its own idea of God) as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the imperialist plants his flag, his kind and his customs in new
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: territory, in the spirit of war and conquest. Such a "holy war" is an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: outrage, based not upon real religion, but on intolerant fana-* ticism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in which freedom and the inherent rights of personality to construct
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its own particular faith are denied.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renouvier finds a parallelism between the worship of the State in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: politics and of the One God in religion. The systems in which unity or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: plurality of divine personality appears differ from one another in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: same way in which monarchal and republican ideas differ. Monarchy in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion offers the same obstacles to progress as it has done in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: politics. It involves a parallel enslavement of one's entire self and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goods, a conscription which is hateful to freedom and detrimental to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personality. To this supreme and regal Providence all is due; it alone
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in any real sense exists. Persons are shadows, of no reality, serfs
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: less than the dust, to whom a miserable dole is given called grace,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: for which prayer and sacrifice are to be unceasingly made or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: chastisements from the Almighty will follow. This notion is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: product of monarchy in politics, and with monarchy it will perish. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: two are bound up, for "by the grace of God" we are told monarchs hold
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their thrones, by his favour their sceptre sways and their battalions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: move on to victory. This monarchal God, this King of kings and Lord of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hosts, ruler of heaven and earth, is the last refuge of monarchs on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the earth. Confidence in both has been shaken, and both, Renouvier
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: asserts, will disappear and give place to a real democracy, not only
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to republics on earth, but to the conception of the whole universe as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a republic. Men raise up saints and intercessors to bridge the gulf
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: between the divine Monarch and his slaves. They conceive angels as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doing his work in heaven; they tolerate priests to bring down grace to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: them here and now. The doctrine of unity thus gives rise to fanatical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious devotion or philosophical belief in the absolute, which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: stifles religion and perishes in its own turn. The doctrine of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: immortality, based on the belief in the value of human personality,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: leads us away from monarchy to a republic of free spirits. A
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: democratic religion in this sense will display human nature raised to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its highest dignity by virtue of an energetic affirmation of personal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: liberty, tolerance, mutual respect and liberty of faith--a free
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion without priests or clericalism, not in conflict with science
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and philosophy, but encouraging these pursuits and in turn encouraged
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by them._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : The fullest treatment of this is the large section in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the conclusion to the _Philosophie analytique de l'Histoire_ (tome
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: iv.). _Cf_. also the discussion of the influence of religious beliefs
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: on societies in the last chapter of _La Nouvelle Monadologie_.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: III
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Ravaisson, in founding the new spiritual philosophy, professed certain
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: doctrines which were a blending of Hellenism and Christianity. In the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: midst of thought which was dominated by positivism, naturalism or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: materialism, or by a shallow eclecticism, wherein religious ideas were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rather held in contempt, he issued a challenge on behalf of spiritual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: values and ideals. Beauty, love and goodness, he declared, were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: divine. God himself is these things, said Ravaisson, and the divinity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is "not far from any of us." In so far as we manifest these qualities
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: we approach the perfect personality of God himself. In the infinite,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in God, will is identical with love, which itself is not distinguished
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the absolutely good and the absolutely beautiful. This love can
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: govern our wills; the love of the beautiful and the good can operate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in our lives. In so far as this is so, we participate in the love and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the life of God.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Boutroux agrees substantially with Ravaisson, but he lays more stress
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: upon the free creative power of the deity as immanent. "God," he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: remarks in his thesis, "is not only the creator of the world, he is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: also its Providence, and watches over the details as well as over the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whole."_/-_ God is thus an immanent and creative power in his world
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: as well as the perfect being of supreme goodness and beauty. Boutroux
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here finds this problem of divine im-* *manence and transcendence as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important as does Blondel, and his attitude is like that of Blondel,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: midway between that of Ravaisson and Bergson.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _La Contingence des Lois de la Nature_, p. 150.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Religion, Boutroux urges, must show man that the supreme ideal for him
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: is to realise in his own nature this idea of God. There is an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: obligation upon man to pursue after these things-goodness, truth,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beauty and love--for they are his good, they are the Good; they are,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: indeed, God. In them is a harmony which satisfies his whole nature,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and which does not neglect or crush any aspect of character, as narrow
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conceptions of religion inevitably do. Boutroux insists upon the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: necessity for intellectual satisfaction, and opposes the "philosophy
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of action" in ils doctrine of "faith for faith's sake." At the same
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: time he conceives Reason as a harmony, not merely a coldly logical
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thing. Feeling and will must be satisfied also._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : Boutroux has in his volume, _Science et Religion dans
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: la Philosophie contemporaine_, contributed a luminous and penetrating
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: discussion of various religious doctrines from Comte to William James.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: This was published in 1908.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: We have observed already how Fouill<e9>e claimed that the ethics of his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _id<e9>es-forces_ contained the gist of what was valuable in the world
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religions. He claims that philosophy includes under the form of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: rational belief or thought what the religions include as instinctive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: belief. In religion he sees a spontaneous type of metaphysic, while
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysic or philosophy is a rationalised religion.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Nothing in this connection is more important than a rational and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: harmonious view of God. This he insists upon in his thesis and in his
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _Sketch of the Future of a Metaphysic founded on Experience_. The old
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: idea of God was that of a monarch governing the world as a despot
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: governs his subjects. The government of the universe may still be held
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to be a monarchy, but modern science is careful to assure us that it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: must be regarded as an absolutely constitutional monarchy. The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: monarch, if there be one, acts in accordance with the laws and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respects the established constitution. Reason obliges us to conceive
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the sovereign: experience enlightens us as to the constitution.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: There can be little doubt that one of the world's greatest books upon
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religion is the work of Guyau, which appeared in 1886, bearing the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: arresting title, _L'Irreligion de l'Avenir_. Its sub-title describes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it as an Etude sociologique, and it is this treatment of the subject
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the standpoint of sociology which is such a distinctive feature
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the book. The notion of a _social bond_ between man and the powers
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: superior to him, but resembling him, is, claims Guyau, a point of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unity in which all religions are at one. The foundation of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious sentiment lies in sociality, and the religious man is just
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the man who is disposed to be sociable, not only with all living
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beings whom he meets, but with those whom he imaginatively creates as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: gods. Guyau's thesis, briefly put, is that religion is a manifestation
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of life (again he insists on "Life," as in his Ethics, as a central
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conception), becoming self-conscious and seeking the explanation of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: things by analogies drawn from human society. Religion is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "sociomorphic" rather than merely anthropomorphic; it is, indeed, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universal sociological hypothesis, mythical in form.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The religious sentiment expresses a consciousness of dependence, and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in addition, adds Guyau, it expresses the need of affection,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: tenderness and love--that is to say, the "social" side of man's
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: nature. In the conception of the Great Companion or Loving Father,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: humanity finds consolation and hope. Children and women readily turn
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to such an ideal, and primitive peoples, who are just like children,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conceive of the deity as severe and all- powerful. To this conception
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: moral attributes were subsequently added, as man's own moral
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: conscience developed, and it now issues in a doctrine of God as Love.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: All this development is, together with that of esthetics and ethics, a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manifestation of life in its individual and more especially social
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: manifestations.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is the purpose of Guyau's book not only to present a study of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: evolution of religion in this manner, from a sociological point of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: view, but to indicate a further development of which the beginnings
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: are already manifest--namely, a decomposition of all systems of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: dogmatic religion. It is primarily the decay of dogma and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ecclesiasticism which he intends to indicate by the French term
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: _irr<e9>ligion_. The English translation of his work bears the title _The
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Non-religion of the Future_. Had Guyau been writing and living in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: another country it is undoubtedly true that his work would probably
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: have been entitled _The Religion of the Future_. Owing to the Roman
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Catholic environment and the conception of religion in his own land,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he was, however, obliged to abandon the use of the word religion
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: altogether. In order to avoid misunderstanding, we must examine the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense he gives to this word, and shall see then that his title is not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: meant to convey the impression of being anti-religious in the widest
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: sense, nor is it irreligious in the English meaning of that word.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau considers every positive and historical religion to present
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: three distinct and essential elements:
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 1. An attempt at a mythical and non-scientific explanation of (_a_)
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: natural phenomena--_e.g._, intervention, miracles, efficacious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: prayer; (_b_) historical facts--_e.g._, incarnation of Buddha or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Jesus.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 2. A system of dogmas--that is to say, symbolic ideas or imaginative
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beliefs--forcibly imposed upon one's faith as absolute verities,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: even though they are susceptible to no scientific demonstration or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophical justification.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: 3. A cult and a system of rites or of worship, made up of more or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: less immutable practices which are looked upon as possessing a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: marvellous efficacy upon the course of things, a propitiatory
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: virtue._*_
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _L'Irr<e9>ligion de l'Avenir_, p. xiii; Eng. trans., p.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: By these three different and really organic elements, religion is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: clearly marked off from philosophy. Owing to the stability of these
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: elements religion is apt to be centuries behind science and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophy, and consequently reconciliation is only effected by a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: subtle process which, while maintaining the traditional dogmas and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: phrases, evolves a new interpretation of them sufficiently modern to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: harmonise a little more with the advance in thought, but which
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: presents a false appearance of stability and consistency, disguising
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the real change of meaning, of view-point and of doctrine. Of this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: effort we shall see the most notable instance is that of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "Modernists" or Neo-Catholics in France and Italy, and the Liberal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christians in England and America.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau claims that these newer interpretations, subtle and useful as
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: they are, and frequently the assertions of minds who desire sincerely
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to adapt the ancient traditions to modern needs, are in themselves
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: hypocritical, and the Church in a sense does right to oppose them.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Guyau cannot see any satisfactoriness in these compromises and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adaptations which lack the clearness of the old teaching, which they
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in a sense betray, while they do not sufficiently satisfy the demands
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of modern thought.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With the decay of the dogmatic religion of Christendom which is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: supremely stated in the faith of the Roman Catholic Church, there must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: follow the non-religion of the future, which may well preserve, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: points out, all that is pure in the religious sentiment and carry with
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: it an admiration for the cosmos and for the infinite powers which are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there displayed. It will be a search for, and a belief in, an ideal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: not only individual, but social and even cosmic, which shall pass the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: limits of actual reality. Hence it appears that "non-religion" or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "a-religion," which is for Guyau simply "the negation of all dogma, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all traditional and supernatural authority, of all revelation, of all
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: miracle, of all myth, of all rite erected into a duty," is most
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: certainly not a synonym for irreligion or impiety, nor does it involve
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: any contempt for the moral and metaphysical doctrines expressed by the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ancient religions of the world. The non-religious man in Guyau's sense
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of the term is simply the man without a religion, as he has defined it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: above, and he may quite well admire and sympathise with the great
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: founders of religion, not only in that they were thinkers,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: metaphysicians, moralists and philanthropists, but in that they were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reformers of established belief, more or less avowed enemies of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious authority and of every affirmation laid down by an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ecclesiastical body in order to bind the intellectual freedom of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: individuals. Guyau's remarks in this connection agree with the tone in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which Renan spoke of his leaving the Church because of a feeling of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: respect and loyalty to its Founder. Guyau points out that there exists
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in the bosom of every great religion a dissolving force--namely, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: very force which in the beginning served to constitute it and to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: establish its triumphant revolt over its predecessor. That force is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the absolute right of private judgment, the free factor of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: personal conscience, which no external authority can succeed,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ultimately, in coercing or silencing. The Roman Church, and almost
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: every other organised branch of the Christian religion, forgets, when
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: faced with a spirit which will not conform, that it is precisely to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: this spirit that it owes its own foundation and also the best years of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: its existence. Guyau has little difficulty in pressing the conclusions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: which follow from the recognition of this vital point.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Briefly, it follows that the hope of a world-religion is an illusion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whether it be the dream of a perfect and world-wide Judaism, Buddhism,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christianity, or Mohammedanism. The sole authority in religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: matters, that of the individual conscience, prevents any such
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: consummation, which, even if it could be achieved, would be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: mischievous. The future will display a variety of beliefs and
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religions, as it does now. This need not discourage us, for therein is
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: a sign of vitality or spiritual life, of which the world-religions are
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: examples, marred, however, by their profession of universality, an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: ideal which they do not and never will realise.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: The notion of a Catholic Church or a great world- religion is really
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: contrary to the duty of personal thought and reflection, which must
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inevitably (unless they give way to mere lazy repetition of other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: people's thoughts) lead to differences. The tendency is for humanity
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to move away from dogmatic religion, with its pretensions to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: universality, catholicity, and monarchy (of which, says Guyau, the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: most curious type has just recently been achieved in our own day, by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the Pope's proclamation of the dogma of papal infallibility), towards
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious individualism and to a plurality of religions. There may, of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: course, be religious associations or federations, but these will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: free, and will not demand the adherence to any dogma as such.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With the decay of dogmatic religion the best elements of religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life will have freer scope to develop themselves, and will grow both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: in intensity and in extent. "He alone is religious, in the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: philosophical sense of the word, who researches for, who thinks about,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who loves, truth." Such inquiry or search involves freedom, it
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: involves conflict, but the conflict of ideas, which is perfectly
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: compatible with toleration in a political sense, and is the essence of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the spirit of the great world teachers. This is what Jesus foresaw
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: when he remarked: "I did not come to bring peace, but a sword." More
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fully, he might have put it, Guyau suggests: "I came not to bring
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: peace into human thought, but an incessant battle of ideas; not
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: repose, but movement and progress of spirit; not universal dogma, but
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: liberty of belief, which is the first condition of growth." Well might
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Renan remark that it was loyalty to such a spirit which caused him to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: break with the Church.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While attacking religious orthodoxy in this manner, Guyau is careful
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to point out that if religious fanaticism ls bad, anti-religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: fanaticism is equally mischievous, wicked and foolish._*_ While the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: eighteenth century could only scoff at religion, the nineteenth
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: realised the absurdity of such raillery. We have come to see that even
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: although a belief may be irrational and even erroneous, it may still
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: survive, and it may console multitudes whose minds would be lost on
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the stormy sea of life without such an anchor. While dogmatic or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: positive religions do exist they will do so, Guyau reminds us, for
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: quite definite and adequate reasons, chiefly because there are people
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: who believe them, to whom they mean something and often a great deal.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: These reasons certainly do diminish daily, and the number of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: adherents, too, but we must refrain from all that savours of anti-
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious fanaticism._/-_ He himself speaks with great respect of a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Christian missionary. Are we not, he asks, both brothers and humble
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: collaborators in the work and advance of humanity? He sees no real
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: inconsistency between his own dislike of orthodoxy and dogma and the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: missionary's work of raising the ignorant to a better life by those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: very dogmas. It is a case of relative advance and mental progress.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : He cites a curious case of anti-religious fanaticism
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: at Marseilles in 1885, when all texts and scripture pictures were
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: removed fromthe schools.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : Guyau's book abounds in illustrations. He mentions
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: here Huss's approval of the sincerity of one man who brought straw
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from his own house to burn him. Huss admired this act of a man in whom
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: he saw a brother in sincerity.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: It is with great wealth of discussion that Guyau recounts the genesis
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of religions in primitive societies to indicate the sociological basis
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of religion. More important are his chapters on the dissolution of
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religions in existing societies, in which he shows the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: unsatisfactoriness of the dogmas of orthodox Protestantism equally
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with those of the Catholic Church. As mischievous as the notion of an
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: infallible Church is that of an infallible book, literally--that is to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: say, foolishly-interpreted. He recognises that for a literal
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: explanation of the Bible must be substituted, and is, indeed, being
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: substituted, a literary explanation. Like Renan, he criticises the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: vulgar conception of prayer and of religious morality which promotes
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: goodness by promise of paradise or fear of hell. He urges in this
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: connection the futility of the effort made by Michelet, Quinet and,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: more especially, by Renouvier and Pillon to "Protestantise" France.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: While admitting a certain intellectual, moral and political
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: superiority to it, Guyau claims that for the promotion of morality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: there is little use in substituting Protestantism for Catholicism. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: forecasts the limitation of the power of priests and other religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: teachers over the minds of young children. Protestant clergymen in
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: England and America he considers to be no more tolerant in regard to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: the educational problem than the priests. Guyau urges the importance
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: of an elementary education being free from religious propaganda. He
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: was writing in 1886, some years after the secular education law had
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: been carried. There is, however, more to be done, and he points out
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: "how strange it is that a society should not do its best to form those
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whose function it is to form it."_*_ In higher education some
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: attention should be given to the comparative study of religions. "Even
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: from the point of view of philosophy, Buddha and Jesus are more
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: important than Anaximander or Thales."_/-_ It is a pity, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: thinks, that there is not a little more done to acquaint the young
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: with the ideas for which the great world-teachers, Confucius,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Zoroaster, Buddha, Socrates, Mohammed, stood, instead of cramming a
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: few additional obscure names from early national history. It would
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: give children at least a notion that history had a wider range than
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: their own country, a realisation of the fact that humanity was already
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: old when Christ appeared, and that there are great religions other
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: than Christianity, religions whose followers are not poor ignorant
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: savages or heathen, but intelligent beings, from whom even Christians
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: may learn much. It is thoroughly mischievous, he aptly adds, to bring
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: up children in such a narrow mental atmosphere that the rest of their
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: life is one long disillusionment.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _*_ : _L'Irr<e9>ligion de l'Avenir_, p. 232; Eng. trans., p.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: [Footnote _/-_ : _Ibid_., p. 236; Eng. trans., p. 283.]
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With particular reference to his own country, Guyau criticises the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious education of women, the question of "mixed marriages," the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: celibacy of the Roman Catholic clergy, and the influence of religious
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: beliefs upon the limitation or increase of the family.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: After having summed up the tendency of dogmatic religion to decay, he
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: asks if any unification of the great religions is to-day possible, or
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whether any new religion may be expected? The answer he gives to both
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: these questions is negative, and he produces a wealth of very valid
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: reasons in support of his finding. He is, of course, here using the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: term religion as he has himself defined it. The claim to universality
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: by all world-religions, the insistence by each that it alone is the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: really best or true religion, precludes any question of unity. As well
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: might we imagine unity between Protestantism and the Roman Catholic
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: Church.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: In the "non-religious" state, dogma will be replaced by individual
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: constructions. Religion will be a free, personal affair, in which the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: great philosophical hypotheses (_e.g._, Theism and Pantheism) will be
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to a large extent utilised. They will, however, be regarded as such by
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: all, as rational hypotheses, which some individuals will accept,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: others will reject. Certain doctrines will appeal to some, not to
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: others. The evidence for a certain type of theism will seem adequate
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: to some, not to others. There will be no endeavour to impose
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: corporately or singly the acceptance of any creed upon others.
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: With Guyau's conception of the future of religion or non-religion,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: whichever we care to call it, we may well close this survey of the
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: religious ideas in modern France. In the Roman Church on the one hand,
title: Modern French Philosophy: a Study of the Development Since Comte
author: Gunn, John Alexander

text: and, on the other, in the thought of Renan, Renouvier and Guyau,
